loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
After undergoing a period of the eight loans, Ni Ketut and the Kucup Mekar group can repay their loans on time. During 6 months of maintaining pigs, Ni Ketut may enjoy satisfactory results.

From sales, Ni Ketut and the Kucup Mekar group using net gain of overall sales of pigs for children's education and for their families. The group hopes to continue their loans. They said thanks you to lenders, Kiva, and MUK for supporting their business.

Now Ni Ketut has a new activity in which, besides being the farmer in her garden, she also busies herself with raising pigs. In this way, Ni Ketut has a higher income than the time before she started raising pigs. The breeding process goes well without any obstacles. The advantage of raising pigs she use for everyday family needs.

In this period, four of the members decide to resign, because they succeeded in managing their profit and have saving and capital to continue the pig business by themselves. This is the main goal for every group. The member succeed and they can have savings and continue the business with their own money.

Now the four members become an example to other breeders. They manage the pigs and loans professionally and share their success stories to us and to other members.

Ni Ketut will use her portion of loan to purchase three piglets. She spends 30,000 IDR for electricity and 200,000 IDR for water a month.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a 65-year-old married woman with five children. For the past five years, she has operated a small plantation. To earn a living, she grows taro, taamu, and bananas. 

Pelenatete is requesting a loan to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and other items. With her profits, Pelenatete hopes to expand her house and support her family financially. She has been a member of SBPD since 2000. (would you please clarify more on this issue)

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe

loans.name: Takku Liggey Sam 8 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Takku Liggey Sam 8, réuni 5 femmes qui s’activent dans le petit commerce de divers produits : vaisselles, pâte d’arachide, huile de palme, eau de citron, eau de javel…
La présidente, la dame Aissatou,qui se trouve au milieu de la photo habillée en couleur orange, est une brave femme qui évolue dans la vente de vaisselles. Elle achète en gros des bols, des verres, des plats en aluminium et en inox, et même se fait confectionner des marmites pour replacer la marchandise sous forme de tontine journalier dans le quartier et chez sa clientèle.
Aissatou est mariée et mère de famille, elle appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison grâce aux bénéfices de son activité. Elle a comme ambition de s’occuper le plus possible de ses enfants et les aider à prendre un bon départ.
texts.en:
The loan group Takku Liggey Sam 8 is composed of women who are active in the small-scale commerce of various goods: dishes, cups, peanut butter, palm oil, lime drinks, bleach,…

Ms. Aissatou, the president of the group, is in the middle of the photo and dressed in orange. She is a good and honest woman who works at selling plates and cups. She buys in bulk cups, glasses, and aluminum or stainless dishes; and she even has stew pots produced to sell by revolving credit paid daily in her district and where her customers live. 

Aissatou is a married mother. Thanks to the profits from her business, she supports her husband in covering household expenses. Her ambition is to do her best to take care of her children and help them get off to a good start.

loans.use: to purchase dishes and cups to resell

loans.name: Delicias Del Valle Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral coordinado por la señora María, 29 años de edad, soltera y se dedica a vender cosméticos AVON desde el crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en el negocio en productos como perfumes para damas, pinturas labial, vanidad, delineadores, rubor, perfumes para caballeros, etc., con el crédito anterior obtuvo aumento en ventas mayores ganancias por lo que le motiva a seguir prestando en esta institución. Otra de las socias es la señora Antonia 46 años de edad se dedica a comercializar ropa de segunda calidad en su domicilio y comunidad la y señora Yeri de 27 años comercializa ropa nueva y vende refrescos en el domicilio.
texts.en: This solidarity group is formed by three members who are successful in her wok life. The group is coordinated by Maria, 29, single and who sells cosmetics from Avon. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business in products such as perfumes for women, lipsticks, compacts, eyeliners, blush, perfumes for men, etc. With her previous loan, Maria, increased her sales, which motivates her to keep working with the lending partner institution. The other group members are Antonia, 46, who sells second-hand clothes from her home and in her community, and Yeri, 27, who sells new clothes and sodas from her home.

loans.use: to buy women's perfumes, lipsticks, compacts, eyeliners, blush, men's perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé âgée de 47ans vit avec son mari et et leurs 03 progénitures à Lomé. Elle a appris la coiffure.  A la fin de sa formation, elle a ouvert son atelier pour servir ses clients.  En plus de son activité elle revend des produits de beauté, des mèches et bijoux. C'est justement pour l'achat de ses marchandises que madame Ayélé sollicite un quatrième crédit dans notre institution. Elle espère réinvestir et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Ayélé, aged 47, lives with her husband and their three children in Lomé. She has learned how to style hair. Upon finishing her training, she opened a shop to serve her customers. In addition to this business, she resells beauty products, hair extensions, and jewelry. It is only to purchase these goods that Ms. Ayélé is requesting a fourth loan from our institution. She hopes to reinvest in her business and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción tiene 28 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su esposo en el Caserío El Frayle del Distrito del Distrito Santo Tomas, una comunidad de clima variado y abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo, también se decida a la crianza de ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando el ganado lechero para posteriormente ofrecerlo a la venta leche fresca a sus vecinos o mediante la elaboración artesanal de queso fresco, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Asunción is 28 years old. He has a stable household with his wife in the El Frayle community of the Santo Tomás district, a community with a varied climate and abundant vegetation located in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains. Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production. 

Asunción earns his living in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of yellow corn. He also raises cattle. His wife supports him in this work, milking the dairy cows in order to later sell the fresh milk to their neighbors or to make artisanal fresh cheeses. He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles [PEN] in order to pay for labor for the maintenance of his corn crop so that he can have a good production to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for labor to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is 28 years old and married with five children, who are in school.

Norelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

Norelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Norelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inplements

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 37 years old and lives with his brother and disabled sister in the city of Vanadzor  in Lori region.

Artak has a small business to sell fruit and vegetables. He rents a stall at the city's central wholesale market and sells a variety of apples, carrots, potatoes and radishes. He buys his produce from the villagers of the Lori region. Artak’s brother works at the soft drink stall. But the family’s main needs are met through Artak’s income. The brothers do their best to provide their sister with better living conditions.

Artak asks for this loan to buy vegetables and fruit to increase the assortment of produce.  He hopes for more customers  and a better income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Loerm Yus' Group

texts.en:
Loerm, 57, is a widow living with her child in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia.  She earns a living through farming rice and sometimes she also catches fish. She has been in this business for 11 years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day allowing them to save about 7,000 KHR each day after expenses for their future needs. 

Loerm has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already and she has completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business.  She is now leading her group to ask for another loan.  She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  With this loan she hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Matrushakti Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, a group of fourteen women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Matrushakti Self-Help Group. Pratima was selected as the leader of Matrushakti SHG. The lady standing with her raised hand is Pratima. 

Pratima is 38 years old, married, and living with her husband and two children. She has been involved in a milk business for twelve years. She has one cow, and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high, and she is not able to supply the growing demand of the customers in the market. She has applied for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and also wants to repair her cattle shed. 

This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education and to pay her children's tuition fee.

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities like vegetable selling, paddy cultivation, daily labourer, etc. All the members are happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her milk business.

loans.name: En Yoak's Group

texts.en: En is 56 years old and married. She has eight children, one of whom is in school. Rice farming and cassava planting are the main sources of income for her family, earning her about 37,000 KHR per day. En and her joint borrower are eighth-cycle clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. Now she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, the same loan amount as her joint borrower. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, insecticide, fertilizer and reaping fees. En hopes that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, insecticide, fertilizer and reaping fees

loans.name: Srey Khim's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Srey is a married mother blessed with three children. 

To cover the daily cost of living, she is running a food store business as the main source of income; she sells rice for extra income. 

She is in the second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s  partner) and she has fully repaid her first loan. 

Now she is seeking a new loan, and she is group leader of three for get the loan. Srey wants to use her portion to buy grocery items to sell, and to buy a bucket to support her business. 

She hopes to improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell and to buy a bucket for support her business

loans.name: Sreymao Ouch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Sreymao is a 35-year-old mother of two children. To make a living, she has been working for others for a fee while her husband is a taxi-driver. Having been in the business for 10 years, she can make daily income from her current business of 30,000 KHR and is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the second loan for Sreymao with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sreymao is going to use her portion to refill the land in front of her house. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to refill the land in front of her house

loans.name: Sreyneang Theng's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a 24-year-old married mother blessed with two children. One of her children is in school and one is too young for schooling. She is a villager who lives in Kampong Cham province. She has been a cassava farmer for ages to provide income to support her family’s daily cost of living and her farm provides her with a decent income. She has borrowed and repaid one previous loan form the Kiva partner VisionFund. She used the profit from her loan to improve her living conditions.

Sreyneang is the leader of a group loan. She and her partner are requesting loans of 1,600,000 KHR and 700,000 KHR respectively. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees. She hopes to expand her cassava farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, bread, slippers and books. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400. Joana is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store such as water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, bread, slippers and books.

loans.name: Gachanja

texts.en:
Gachanja lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya.  The town is located over 6,300 feet above sea level and is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. 

Gachanja is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years and they  grow maize, beans and bananas. Gachanja is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food.

The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, earning it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.”   Many farmers in the region have started planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeepers for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

This is Gachanja’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to save for his old age. Gachanja’s hopes for his family live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne lives in Kipasi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Roselyne is a widow with five children. She works as the chief in her location. She runs her own business and does farming as well. She has been farming for 15 years now and is currently growing maize, beans, millet, and butternut on her farm. Roselyne is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income and provide her with honey for food and medicine.

This is Roselyne's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy more beehives and to expand her business. Roselyne’s hope for the future is to see her community financially uplifted and empowered.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is a single and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish, oils, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, eggs, water, slippers, and shampoo. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, bordering Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Josephine is married and has six children. She is a social health worker, while her husband is a clerk in the Ministry of Agriculture. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet, groundnuts, and green grams on their farm. Josephine is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to manage unlike other farming activities.

This is Josephine’s first loan with Honey Care Africa, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Josephine’s hope for the future is to have consistent income.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has four children. The family lives close to the town of Kakamega in Kakamega County. Both he and his wife have been farming for twenty-five years now. They are currently growing garden crops, bananas and passion fruit on their farm. He also runs a brick business.

Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugarcane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Peter has decided to take up beekeeping. He is excited about doing so, as it will earn him extra income and thus boost his financial stability. This loan of 28,500 KES with Honey Care will be Peter's first, and he plans to use profits from his beehives to buy yet more beehives.

Peter's hope for the future is to become one of the best farmers in his county.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Zipphorah

texts.en:
Zipphorah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of 'the breadbasket of Kenya.'

Many farmers in the region have started businesses, planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Zipphorah is married and has nine children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for six years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, bananas, and trees. Zipphorah is excited about beekeeping since she will earn some income from the sale of honey.

This is Zipphorah’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Zipphorah’s hope for the future is to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Mirogi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people.  A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to sell their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region place a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures are above the national average.

John is married, has seven children and runs a small farm business. He has farmed for twelve years and grows maize, millet, sunflower, vegetables, beans, pawpaw and trees. John is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him income and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. John’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Abel is married and has seven children. He is a Church Elder. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas, and potatoes on their farm. Abel is excited about beekeeping since he will earn some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Abel’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Abel’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. 

Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary, extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Charles is married and has three children. He is a village elder. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for 15 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, and bananas and they rear livestock, as well. Charles is excited about beekeeping since he will earn some income from the sale of honey.

This is Charles’ first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm business and help the needy. Charles’ hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, llego a Rosita desde hace 2 años por motivo de su trabajo como docente, es padre soltero de 2 hijos, un adolescente de 7 años de edad que estudia su tercer grado de primaria y un menor de un año de edad. Con el propósito de construir su propia vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para construir su vivienda de tambo de madera de 10*20 pies: madera rustica y cepillada, clavos, zinc, postes y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Actualmente habita en casa de una hermana. Su sueño es ampliar su vivienda y construirla de concreto.
texts.en:
This borrower is originally from Puerto Cabezas. He arrived in Rosita two years ago because of his job as a teacher. He is a single father with two children, a seven-year-old who is in the third year of primary school and a one-year-old.

His goal is to build a house of his own. He is requesting his first loan so that he can buy materials for building a 10 x 20 ft. wooden cottage. These materials include rustic planed wood, nails, zinc sheets, and posts. He will also pay the cost of labor.

The borrower currently lives at his sister’s house. His dream is to expand his home and build it out of concrete.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to build his home.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, comenta que le inspira las ganas de superación y poder tener un mejor nivel de vida, y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Él quiere salir adelante y poder también ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus estudios. Se está esforzando bastante para poder ayudar a las demás personas que puedan necesitar de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de sus materiales de estudios, como libros, folletos y demás insumo. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Armando is studying for a degree in Business Administration. He says that he is inspired to succeed and have a better standard of living. In addition, he wants to help his family.

Armando wants to get ahead and be able to help other people through his studies. He is striving to assist other people who may be in need of his expertise. Armando is requesting this loan so that he can invest in study materials such as books, handouts, and other supplies. He appreciates the opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to purchase study materials.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Francisca actualmente vive del negocio de comedor en un pequeño kiosko ubicado en las afueras de un banco, el cual trabaja junto a tres de sus hijos quienes también se apoyan de este negocio familiar. el crédito que solicita doña Francisca es para invertir en el negocio con productos como: granos básicos, verduras, aceite, carne, pollo, sazonadores entre otros que le permitan seguir adelante.
texts.en: Francisca’s small food stall is currently located outside a bank. Three of her children work in this family business. The loan she is requesting is to invest in products such as basic grains, vegetables, oil, meat, chicken, seasonings and other items that will allow her to continue.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, vegetables, oil, meat, chicken, and seasonings.

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES DE ORO” iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aydee es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cotillones, elaboración de tarimas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de pollos, librería, venta de golosinas, servicio de conducción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Aydee es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de artículos según la temporada; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente observaba a sus amigas la forma de comercialización de estos productos, con un pequeño capital adquirido en Pro Mujer emprende un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de paraguas por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Corazones de Oro" will begin their 24th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Aydee is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members work in are varied. Among them are party gift sales, stage building, food sales, weaving sweaters, selling chicken, a stationery shop, candy sales, and driving services.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small businesses of which Aydee is a member. She mentions that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for two years and was invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business in seasonal product sales. She says that she learned this business because she used to watch the way her friends sold these products. With a little capital that she acquired from Pro Mujer, she started an independent business.

The loan that they are taking out now will be used to increase capital (buy umbrellas wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto. She will then sell the items upon request. This type of work allows her to make an income to support her family as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas wholesale.

loans.name: Wagane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Wagane a investi dans l’élevage depuis plus de 5 ans. Il possède quelques bœufs et aimerait augmenter le nombre en sollicitant un crédit de 500 000F afin de pouvoir en acheter au moins trois ou  quatre petits pour les emboucher et les revendre au bout de 8 à 9 mois. Wagane vit au village, et le matin de très bonne heure, il sort ses bêtes et les envoie paitre jusqu’au soir. Revenus à l’enclos, il leur donne de l’aliment bétail et de l’eau. Wagane sait bien s’occuper de ses bêtes, car il a grandi dans un milieu où l’élevage fait parti des activités les plus pratiquées et les plus maitrisées dans cette zone.
Wagane est mariée et vit en grande famille où il donne sa participation pour la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Il a comme ambition d’acheter davantage de bœufs pour avoir un troupeau.
texts.en:
Mr. Wagane has invested in livestock farming for over five years. He has a few head of cattle and would like to increase the number by requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to be able to purchase at least three or four small ones to fatten and resell after 8 or 9 months. 

Wagane lives in a village, and he takes his animals out very early to the pasture each morning until evening. Back at the corral, he gives them food and water. He really knows how to take care of his animals, since he grew up where livestock farming would be one of the most common activities and is mastered the best in this area. 

Wagane is married and lives in a large family, where he participates in managing day-to-day expenses. His ambition is to purchase more cattle and to have a herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Sandra Katherine

texts.es:
Sandra Katherine tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío La Pilca, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de venta de ropa y plástico para entregar a tiendas de la zona, cuenta con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa y plásticos en stock para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera poder atender a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Sandra Katherine, 23, lives with her parents in Caserío La Pilca, a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires, a hot-climate town whose people work in agriculture, commercial sector and livestock breeding. The town is located in the province of Morropon belonging to the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells clothing and plastics to deliver to stores in the area. She has a steady clientele. She has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to purchase a large quantity of clothing and plastic to offer her clients. This way she can assist her clients and generate better revenue to support her parents

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of clothing to  sell to her clients.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 38 years old and lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Lilian has a business selling foods and a sari-sari store. She earns about 5,500 PHP each month doing this type of work.  Lilian has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients like kilos of meat and spices for her restaurant business. Lilian has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Lilian would like to have her own grocery.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like kilos of meat and spices for her restaurant business

loans.name: Jaliee

texts.en:
Jaliee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

Jaliee successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fish to souse (soak in salt water solution) and dry for sale.

NWTF is presenting Jaliee's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to souse and dry for sale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 6,300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Maribel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her husband to sustain the living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Perla Del Socorro

texts.es:
El olor a la fritanga cautiva desde el primer momento, el estómago se altera y guía rápidamente hacia el lugar de origen de tan delicioso aroma. Ahí es donde encontramos a Perla. Su trabajo diario consiste en cocinar enchiladas, repochetas y demás platillos nicaragüenses. También vende frutas y golosinas cerca de una estación de autobuses. Tiene cuatro hijos y con su arduo trabajo es como  los ha sacado adelante; quiere brindarles un futuro mejor. Ellos son su mayor apoyo.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para aumentar la producción de su capital. Necesita comprar granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, etc.) frutas y golosinas; de manera que pueda mantener sus dos negocios y lograr estabilidad económica. Deposita su fe en el préstamo que ofrece Kiva y Micrédito, quienes darán paso al cumplimiento de uno de sus sueños, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Definitivamente, su lucha demuestra que es una mujer emprendedora y apasionada
texts.en:
When the smell of fried food hits, the stomach begins to churn and quickly leads one to the place where the delicious scent originates. This is where Perla can be found. Her daily work consists of cooking enchiladas, “repochetas” (fried corn tortillas with melted cheese), and other Nicaraguan dishes. She also sells fruit and snack foods near one of the bus stations. Perla has four children and her hard work has allowed her to get ahead. She wants to provide her children a better future and they have been her greatest support.

Perla is requesting a loan in order to increase her production capital. She needs to buy basic staples (rice, beans, etc.), fruits, and snack foods. This will allow her to maintain her two businesses and achieve financial stability. Perla has placed her faith in this loan offered by Kiva and MiCrédito. One dream that she would like to fulfill is to provide better living conditions for her family. Perla has definitely shown that she is an enterprising and passionate woman.

loans.use: to buy basic staples (rice, beans, etc.), fruits, and snack foods.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 54 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village in Gegharkunik region. She has a vocational education and for many years she worked at a rest house (guesthouse) as a waitress. From 1984 till today Sona has worked at the kindergarten as a nanny and she is also engaged in farming. On her farm she has 3 cows, 2 bulls, 10 sheep and 7 lambs. All this farm cattle she manages to take care of properly, despite her other work. Sona is married and she has a daughter and a son.

Lately, Sona has had some health problems, particularly problems with her spine, and she is very upset that now, very often, she is not able to work as much and quickly as she used to work before. She asks for this loan in order to pass a proper course of examination and treatment, which will return her to an active and normal way of life.

loans.use: to pass a proper course of examination and treatment, which will return her to an active and normal way of life

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife have practiced farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and pineapples on their farm. Shem also has a job as an administrator.

The family lives in Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Located over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s highest towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname “the breadbasket of Kenya.”

Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests. These trees and other plants are important to bees. The people around Kitale have been beekeepers for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Shem has decided to start beekeeping and is excited about their potential in pollinating his crops. This 28,500 KES loan will be Shem’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Shem’s hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon which is an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Kitale was founded by European settlers in the early 1900s and grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests.  The area's residents maintain the tree cover to preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Eunice is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have farmed for twenty years and grow maize, beans, bananas and raise cattle. Eunice is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey.

This is Eunice’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Eunice’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon which is East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano.  The area's substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Stanley is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for six years and grow maize, beans, coffee and raise livestock. Stanley is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help to pollinate his crops.

This is Stanley's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his beekeeping project. Stanley's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married and has six children. For the past sixteen years he and his wife have practiced farming. They are currently growing maize and bananas, and they also rear livestock. He works as a mason as well.

The family lives in Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and peaks on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway.

The area around Kitale is forested, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Benjamin decided to start beekeeping and is excited about the bees’ potential in pollinating his crops. This 28,500 KES loan will be Shem’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his beekeeping project. Benjamin's hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life with his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya.  Kitale is located over 6,300 feet above sea level and is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, earning it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have planted bluegum trees which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeepers for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Stephen is a married teachers with four children. Both he and his wife farm. They have farmed for twelve years and grow maize, beans, and raise livestock. Stephen is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help to pollinate his crops.

This is Stephen’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Stephen’s hope for the future is to be stable in life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana es una vendedora de alimentos que observo que en su zona residencial no había ningún negocio de alitas picantes y decidió iniciar con su negocio, pero todo esto lo pudo lograr gracias a una liquidación y experiencia que obtuvo en sus diferentes trabajos dado que laboro como mesera, trabajo en un bar y tenía un pequeño puesto de comidas rápidas, su último trabajo fue en una empresa que abandono por un cambio de administración. Con el dinero de la liquidación monto su puesto de alitas picantes, negocio que ha sido muy bien acogido por sus vecinos personas aledañas al sector, su principal ventaja de mercado es que no tiene una competencia directa, es decir no hay otro puesto de alitas picantes, trabajo en un horario de 10 horas y 14 horas en fines de semana, junto con una persona quien le colabora, solicita el crédito para comprar unos utensilios que necesita y adecuar su negocio ya que posee ciertos problemas con el Invima (entidad reguladora de Colombia) y podría dejar de operar por esta situación y comprar surtido para seguir creciendo y lograr ser una vendedora reconocida en el sector lo que le generara más ventas y podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija
texts.en:
Ana is a food vendor. She noticed that there were no hot wing restaurants in the area where she lives and decided to start her business. She was able to achieve this thanks to the severance pay from her previous job and to the experience she has gained from working as a waitress in different places. She used to work at a bar and also had a small fast food stand. Her last job was with a company that she had to leave when they changed management. She used her severance pay to set up her hot wing stand, and the business has been very well received by the people in and around the neighborhood. Her main market advantage is that she has no direct competition, that is, there are no other hot wing stands around. Her work schedule is ten hours, fourteen on the weekends. She works alongside another person who helps her.

She is requesting this loan to buy the utensils she needs and to satisfy INVIMA requirements. (INVIMA is Colombia's food and drug regulation agency, and non-compliance could force her to go out of business). She will also buy ingredients in order to keep growing and become a well known local vendor. This will increase her sales and allow her to give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies to comply with Colombian food regulations.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. She has run a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Salma requests 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of cloth for the summer season.  She will consider the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 28-year-old man from Shienwe location in Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man with one child who is four years old.

He is a carpenter. He has been doing this for the last eight years and gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 for his struggle. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use for materials like timber. He will use the anticipated income and plow it back into the business.

He has a dream of developing his business so as to become more strong to help him support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, se está esforzando bastante por cumplir su meta de ser un profesional exitoso que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, que le permitirá abrirse camino, y luchar por cumplir con sus sueños y anhelos. Comenta que su principal fortaleza es su familia, que siempre ha estado a su lado para darle la oportunidad de estudiar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una computadora que le permitirá hacer sus trabajos de la universidad y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a very dedicated individual with regard to his studies. He is striving to accomplish his goal of becoming a successful professional who can help other people.

Cristhian is studying for a degree in Accounting, which will open doors and enable him to fulfill his dreams and wishes. He says that his main source of strength is his family, who has always been by his side when given the opportunity to study.

Cristhian is requesting this loan so that he can buy a computer, which will allow him to complete his coursework at the university. He will be able to continue studying in the same manner as before.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Centro Poblado de Huacapampa, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café y de esta manera ofrecer una mejor producción a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 68, lives with his wife and children in the center of town of Huacapampa, a rural are in the district of Cañaris. Its population is engaged in agriculture trade and livestock breeding. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically in coffee cultivation. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop so that he can offer his clients a better production and generate higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina, 43, is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it running well.

For this reason Zarina has applied for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kashf for her husband’s use to buy new tires and spare parts for his rickshaw. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zarina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a married man, 50 years of age, and living in a rural area with his family of 13 children; two attend school in different areas. He deals in local brewing business. He has an additional income from civil service. He started this business in 2000.

He wants the loan to boost the local brewing business by buying a heater that will speedily boil the brew to increase his efficiency. He has hopes of expanding into a large business, which can supply all the people around. 

His clients are traders from Kayamba and the surrounding fish landing sites. The challenge he faces is price fluctuation. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy a heater for his brewing business.

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad,  solo estudio hasta 2º grado,esta casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, sus hijos estudian bachillerato,solo él sostiene el hogar.


José  se dedica a la construcción y cuando viene la época de lluvia trabaja en la siembra de maíz,los trabajos lo aprendió de su padre el cual se lo inculco y también por la necesidad de mantener a su familia y darles educación. Su horario de trabajo no tiene, cuando tiene contratos de trabajo no tiene hora de salida.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono,fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y otra parte la utilizara para terminar de repellar su casa; ya que le hace falta y por supuesto la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El objetivo de José es seguir trabajando con credicampo y dales siempre la mejor educación a sus hijos y en el futuro ellos trabajen y se ganen la vida ellos solos.
texts.en:
Jose, 52, only studied until 2nd grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. His children are in high school and Jose is the only financial support for the family.
Jose works as a construction worker and in the rainy season he also works sowing corn. He learned these trades from his father, who also instilled in him the need to provide for his family and give them an education. He doesn't have a regular working schedule, when he is hired he doesn't have a departure time.
Jose needs the loan to purchase manure and fertilizers to sow corn. He will also use part of the loan to finish plastering his house, which the house requires, and this will fulfill his needs.
Jose's goal is to keep working with the lending partner, Credicampo, and to always give his children the best education so that in the future they can work and earn a living on their own.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers to sow corn and to finish plastering his house.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 40-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to people who live in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Rehana requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different cloths for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Zebun  Nissa

texts.en:
Zebun Nissa is a 55-year-old married woman.  

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past three years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of threads in different colors, as well as packs of zippers and buttons, to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors as well as packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cacao plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mundo De Colores Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora Lea de 20 años de edad, acompañada madre de un hijo de tres años, comercializa ropa de segunda calidad en su domicilio desde hace dos años, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas. Otra de las socias es la señora Bertha de 35 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, y señora Yahoska de 23 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda en su comunidad
texts.en:
This solidarity group comprises three successful members. 

Lea is the group coordinator. She is twenty years old and lives with her partner and their three-year-old son. She has been working selling used clothing from her home for two years, and is requesting this loan to buy more bundles of clothing. 

Bertha is another of the group's members. She is 35 years old and owns a grocery store, which is located in her home.

Lastly Yahoska, who is 23, also sells used clothing in her community.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Guard Barranco Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Sonia de 39 años de edad, acompañada y con dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 5 años, se dedica al destace de cerdo y de derivados del mismo como nacatamales, fritos, chicharrón, desde cinco años hace siendo la principal ayuda el esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra Cerdo en pie y compra de materia prima para la elaboración de nacatamales como hojas, mecates, leña, arroz, papa, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, etc. otra de las socias es la señora Sandra de 43 años la cual se dedica a vender ropa nueva en su domicilio y la señora Ileana 43 años comerciante de ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three female entrepreneurs.  One of the members is Sonia.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children ages 16 and 5. She works butchering pigs, and making pork products such as nacatamales, fried pork, and pork rinds.  She has performed this work for the past five years, with her husband being her main helper.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase hogs and to purchase raw materials to make nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) such as: leaves, string, wood, rice, potatoes, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, etc.

One of the other members, Sandra, 43 years old, works selling new clothing in her home, and Ileana, 43 years old, works selling new and used clothing.

loans.use: purchase hogs and ingredients to make nacatamales.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon’s farm is doing better after the loan. He used the money well and he was able to buy seedlings and fertilizers as planned.  Simon has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers to use during this planting season. He is optimistic that his farm will do well. He hopes to expand his business in the near future, and to uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Armando Juan

texts.es:
Armando Juan tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de verduras, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de su distrito, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su puesto donde ofrece verduras y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad cuando realiza sus ventas.
texts.en:
Armando Juan is 36 years old and lives with his wife in the district of Cayaltí, a community that works mainly in agriculture and trade. It is located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on Peru's northern coast.

He works selling vegetables. His business is located in the district market and he has been doing this for three years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to buy materials to rebuild his vegeatble stand so that he can work more safely.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to rebuild his vegetable stand.

loans.name: Yoyoya  Iram

texts.en:
Yoyoya Iram is 31-year-old vigorous married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years with the support of her husband. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es: La cuidad  en donde vive Jose se caracteriza por tener tierras buenas para criar ganado, comenta que él y muchas personas se dedican a esta actividad ya que  es una gran fuente de ingreso, Jose tiene 2 hijos , el de 21 ya trabaja y la de 16 está estudiando en el colegio. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona para tener una ganancia el momento de venderla. La meta de Jose es que así que con mucho esfuerzo educo a su primer hijo así mismo va a sacar adelante a su hija
texts.en:
The city that Jose lives in is known for having good land on which to raise cattle.  Jose states that he, along with many other people, works in raising cattle as it is a great source of income.  Jose has two children.  His 21 year old son already works, and his 16 year old daughter is in high school. 

He will use the loan to purchase a cow in order to make a profit once he sells it.  Jose's goal is to be able to educate and get his daughter ahead as he was able to do with his first son through a lot of effort.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en: Ruksana is a 29-year-old married woman, and the mother of six children. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) works in the construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. So, Ruksana requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for PKR 45,000 to grow her husband's business. Her husband will use this loan to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate in large quantities. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate in large quantities.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cuyes y gallinas, desde hace 02 años, se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para el arreglo del piso y pared de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, a community with a varied climate.  The residents of Cayaltí work primarily in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  Cayaltí is located in the Chiclayo province which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and chickens.  For the past two years, she has worked in this field to help her husband with the family's expenses.  She is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase material to fix the floor and wall of her home.  This way, they will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase construction materials to fix the floor and wall of her home.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 34-year-old married lady, and is running a small general store in her community for many years, with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Robina makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently. Robina wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, and flour.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en: Hripsime lives in Malishka village with her husband and 17-year-old son. Her family has been involved in agriculture for eight years. They keep livestock (cows, calf and chickens), as well as cultivate the land. Agriculture is the only source of income for this family, so it is very important for them to run their farm in a sustainable way. The requested loan of USD 2,400 will be a huge support for Hripsime to purchase a cow and also hire workers for land cultivation. The loan will improve their farming business, so Hripsime and her family wait for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Musa is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize and rearing livestock in their farm. Musa is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Musa’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Musa’s hope for the future is to see his children educated to university level and be independent.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complements the region’s natural forests and provides bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Philip is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables, and horticultural crops, and they rear livestock as well. Philip is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Philip’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Philip’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Daniel is married and has five children. He is a Church Elder. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize and beans and rearing livestock on their farm. Daniel is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income through the sale of honey.

This is Daniel’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children and provide for his family’s needs. Daniel’s hope for the future is to be fully independent in his business and farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations, and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

William is married and has three children. He is an officer in the Public Heath Office. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for thirty years now, and they are currently growing maize, bananas, and trees and rearing livestock in their farm. William is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is William’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family’s needs. William’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Señor Julio es propietario de un taller de zapatería además compra calzado para incrementar venta con más de 30 años de haber iniciado dicho negocio requiere el credito para la compra de sandalias y materia prima como cuero sintético, pega, hebilla, hilo, galleta, etc.
texts.en: Julio owns a shoe repair shop and also buys shoes to increase sales. He has over 30 years of experience and requires a loan to buy sandals and raw materials such as synthetic leather, glue, buckles, thread, light-colored leather, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and shoe repair materials

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is a 48-year-old, married woman from Gaza city.  She is a mother of two sons. Mervat has a beauty salon, which has been opened for five years. It is a good business and she has her loyal clients. Mervat would like to improve her business and expand it by opening new sections. She took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a steam machine for skin cleaning. By taking this loan, Mervat will be able to improve her business and expand it.  Mervat appears in the photo in her beauty center.

loans.use: to buy a steam machine for skin.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes referencias personales, muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que realiza, destazo y venta de carne de cerdo y es madre de tres hijos y 3 hijas.

María se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería y venta de carne de cerdo, con el paso del tiempo la señora consiguió trabajo en una carnicería del pueblo en el que se dedicaba a la venta de carne, y fue allí donde adquirió conocimiento y experiencia. Luego de un buen tiempo decidió independizarse y adquirió un crédito para poner su propio negocio con su esposo; el cual consistía en destazo de cerdos para la venta en su comunidad  y comenzó su negocio los fines de semana fue adquiriendo clientes y ahora se dedica también a la venta de pupusas todos los días de la semana por la tarde  a esta actividad se suma sus dos hijas mayores y su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores al destazo de cerdos.


Su horario en la venta de pupusas es de las 3 de la tarde a 8 de la noche y esta actividad es llevada a cabo con la ayuda de sus hijas y realizando esta actividad tiene una experiencia de 10 años, actividad que aprendió cuando estuvo prestando sus servicios en un comedor de su municipio donde ella puso empeño y fue muy atenta y mostro mucha disposición en aprender todo lo que se le enseñaba, aparte de la pupuseria que son sus principales fuentes de ingreso. Mientras que sus hijos se dedican al estudio en la escuela de su comunidad.


El dinero será invertido en comprar una plancha más grande para hacer pupusas, pues la que tiene es muy pequeña, y día con día la demanda de pupusas de parte de sus antiguos y clientes nuevos es cada día mayor y esto le hace presión a que adquiera un equipo mejor para realizar actividad con más agilidad, y también la implementación de una tienda ya que la primera tienda en su comunidad se encuentra a 1 km de distancia de su casa,  de esta manera tendrá mejores ganancias las que serán invertidas en mejoramiento de su vivienda, de esta forma mejorara su calidad de vida y tendrán una vivienda con mejores condiciones.


Las proyecciones que ella tiene a futuro son las de construir un nuevo local ubicado en otra zona de su comunidad que le permita desarrollarse con la pupuseria y montar otra tienda de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  ya que se acercara a ellos. Y con respecto a sus hijos anhela que salgan adelante ante cualquier obstáculo de la vida pretende apoyarlos con todas sus fuerzas hasta donde pueda y sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
María is 45 years, and is a person with excellent personal references.  She is very well known in her community for the work that she does, butchering and selling pork.  She is the mother of three sons and three daughters.  María was raised by her parents who worked In agriculture, livestock, and selling pork.  In time, she found a job in a local butcher shop where she worked selling meat.  This is where she gained her knowledge and experience.  

After a long time, she decided to branch out on her own, and she received a loan to open her own business with her husband.  This business butchers pigs to be sold in the community.  The business started out on the weekends, and she began to generate a customer base.  Now, she also sells pupusas everyday of the week in the afternoons, which her two eldest daughters help her with.  Her husband and her two eldest sons help butchering the pigs.  Her schedule for selling the pupusas is from 3pm to 8pm, and her daughters help her.  She has ten years of experience making pupusas, which she learned how to make when she was working in a restaurant in her town where she put in a lot of effort, was very attentive and was eager to learn everything that they were teaching her.  Selling the pupusas is one of her main sources of income.  Her children attend school in the community.

The loan will be used to purchase a larger grill to make pupusas as the one that she currently has is too small, and the demand from her old and new customers increases everyday.  This is making it urgent for her to purchase better equipment in order to perform her work more efficiently.  She also wants to open a store as the first store in her town is one kilometer from her home.  This will allow her to  generate greater earnings that will be invested in repairing her home so that they will have a better quality of life and a home in better condition.  

Her goals for the future are to open a new location in a different area of her community, and expand her pupuseria.  Opening a new location will help her to provide better service to her customers since she will be closer to them.  Regarding her children, she hopes that they will be able to get ahead, regardless of the obstacles.  She plans to support them with all of her strength so that they can be successful professionals.

loans.use: purchase a larger grill to make pupusas, and products to open up a store.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 47 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has a higher education and a specialty of electric-locksmith. For ten years, he worked at the local post office as a chief officer of the communications department. Here he did his work with great responsibility, but he greatly wished to work in his specialty.
