Finally, he found the work in which he was engaged, and until now works with great interest and pleasure. Now he works at a private company as an electrician-locksmith. He is just a crackerjack, and makes different iron gateways, bars and fences so nice and so cute that he always has a lot of orders. 
 
Aram is married, and he has two grown-up sons. His wife works at a furniture shop as a saleswoman.

Aram is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams, since his tools are worn out. Because he works with his own tools, he wants to buy new ones. He needs a new welding machine and some other equipment for his welding activities.

loans.use: to buy new tools, including a new welding machine and some other equipment for his welding activities.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro menores hijos en el distrito de Sallique, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno en los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de dos cabezas de ganado y de esta manera engordarlo para ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Hermes is 34 years old and lives in his own house constructed of rustic materials. He lives with his wife and four children in the district of Sallique, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade, and raising livestock located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. 
He earns his living breeding and selling cattle in the surrounding villages of his district. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,500 Peruvian soles to buy two cattle to fatten and sell at a higher price.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Clara Cecilia

texts.es: Clara vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 8, 11, 15 y 20 años, de los cuales el menor va a la escuela, los otros dos asisten al colegio y el de 20 cumplió el bachilleratoy se fue a trabajar para reunir dinero y poder ingresar  a la universidad  ya que por falta de recursos económicas no pudo hacerlo, Clara comenta que desde que ella pudo trabajar se dedica a la agricultura, a sembrar arveja y otros producto que se dan en estas tierras, el crédito lo va a invertir en  la compra de abono, fungicidas y pagar la mano de obra que le ayudan en sus cultivos, la aspiración más grande de Clara es  que su actividad crezca y se mejore para que sus hijos no se queden solo de bachiller sino que puedan asistir a la universidad  y lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Clara lives with her husband and 4 children ages 8, 11, 15, and 20 years. Her youngest attends elementary school, the middle two attend high school, and the 20-year-old graduated from high school and went to work to raise money to go to college but because of the lack of resources, he could not attend college. Clara says that since she could work she has been working in agriculture, planting peas and other products that do well on these farmlands. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, fungicides, and to pay laborers to help her with her crops. Her greatest aspiration is for her business to grow and improve so that her children can study past high school and attend college and become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay laborers

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda de 56 años de edad, es una persona muy educada y con excelentes principios morales que la han caracterizado como una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, es muy conocida en su comunidad.

Ella se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería ellos eran personas muy luchadores que dedicaron toda su vida a realizar esta actividad, mientas Ermelinda vivía con sus padres,  ella se dedicaba a estudiar por las tardes en la escuela de su comunidad y de esa manera alcanzo su nivel de estudio hasta el octavo grado, y luego se dedicó a trabajar con su madre en el destazo de cerdos, y a la venta de carne. A medida que transcurrió el tiempo adquirió experiencia y conocimiento en realizar esta actividad y decido formar su hogar con quien son padres de dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, y su hogar está formado por su esposo y sus dos nietas que son quienes les ayudan a realizar dichas actividades. 

Ermelinda continua trabajando en el destazo y venta de carne y también los días de semana hace tamales y pan para vender. Actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes fueron personas que dedicaron toda su vida a realizar esta actividad, ella tiene una experiencia de 16 años realizando esta actividad y ha decidido continuar en esta actividad motivada por las ganancias y porque durante mucho tiempo se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, lo que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y cubrir con las necesidades básicas de su hogar.  

El dinero será utilizado para la compra de cerdos para el destazo y algunos utensilios que necesita para llevar a cabo esa actividad, ya que la mayoría de ellos han dado su vida útil como lo son, mesa, cuchillos, recipientes plásticos,  y se le dificulta trabajar con ellos ya que están deteriorados, y de esta manera se la hará más fácil realizar sus actividades laborales dentro de su hogar

Ermelinda planea para un futuro tener un local de carnicería en el centro del pueblo y esto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y emplear a sus dos nietas que son las que le ayudan a la venta de carne de esta manera ayudara a que ellas puedan  alcázar su sueños, ya que una de ellas manifiesta que quiere se chef y maestra de cocina. 
Todo esto lo planea lograr con la buena inversión de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ermelinda, 56, is a well-mannered person with excellent moral values who is known for being a very tenacious and enterprising person.  She is very well-known in her community.  She was raised by her parents, who were farmers.  They were hardworking people who spent their whole lives farming and raising livestock.  When Ermelinda was living with her parents, she studied in the afternoons in a local school.  This is how she got an 8th grade education.  Later, she started working with her mother slaughtering pigs and selling their meat.  

Over time, Ermelinda acquired experience and knowledge in this occupation, and she decided to form her own household.  She has 2 children who are both now independent.  Now her household is comprised of her husband and her 2 granddaughters, who help them with the business.

Ermelinda is continuing with her work slaughtering pigs and selling pork meat, and on weekdays she also makes tamales and bread to sell.  She learned these activities from her parents, who spent their whole lives doing this type of work.  Ermelinda now has 16 years of experience, and she has decided to continue with these activities in order to earn income, because much of the time these activities have been her main source of income.  This is how she has fed her family and covered the basic expenses of the household.  

The funds from this loan will be used to buy pigs to slaughter, and also to buy some utensils that she needs to carry out this activity.  She needs to replace some items that have worn out, including a table, knives, and plastic containers, because it is difficult to work with them as they are so deteriorated.  This will make the work she does inside the home much easier.

For the future, Ermelinda plans to have her own butcher shop in the center of town.  This would enable her to have more income and employ her granddaughters, who are the ones who help her with the business.  In this way, she could help them to reach for their dreams, because one of them says that she wants to be a chef and a cooking teacher.  All of this can be achieved if she invests her profits well.

loans.use: to buy pigs and some utensils that she needs

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Monicah is married and has nine children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 20 years now and they are currently growing maize, bananas, vegetables and trees on their farm. Monicah is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Monicah’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Monicah’s hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Zeanat

texts.en: Zeanat is a 52-year-old, married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She is very experienced in her work, and makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Suomo Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of six successful members. The group is called Suomo. They are into the sale of material, lining, spare parts, cosmetics, jewelry, bags, and ready-made clothing.

The featured borrower is Gifty who is 34 years old. She is single and the mother of two children who are 12 and 9 years old. She sells cosmetics, jewelry and bags in the market. She is going to invest the loan in buying cosmetics, jewelry and bags to sell to her customers. She doesn't have anyone else who helps her. 

This is their first loan with ID-Ghana and the other group members are Patricia, age 24, who is a seamstress, Philip, age 29, who sells spare parts, Mariam, age 29, sells ready-made clothing, and Angelina age 32, who sells materials and lining.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewelry and bags to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Wilson is married and has three children. He is a tailor. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and bananas and rearing livestock in their farm. Wilson is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with honey for food.

This is Wilson’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to save up for his old age. Wilson’s hope for the future is to live a good life in his old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Banchawi

texts.en:
Banchawi lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Banchawi is married and has one child. He runs a motorbike transport business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and avocados and rearing cattle in their farm. Banchawi is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Banchawi’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Banchawi’s hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. Three years ago, Ahmad started his own business, which is a grocery store.  It is a good business and earns a good income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ahmad would like to improve his store. He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his sales, and improve the store conditions.  Ahmad appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to resell in his store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. Two years ago, Ahmad started his own business, which is an auto repair store. It is a good business and earns a good income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad would like to improve his store.
 
Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more repair parts for his store. by taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and improve the store conditions. Ahmad appears in the photo in his auto repair store

loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Osbaldo

texts.es:
Osbaldo tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío El Frayle del Distrito del Distrito Santo Tomas mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, vive en casa propia de material rustico, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro criollo, tiene cultivado 2 has en su terreno, tiene dos vacas que su esposa le apoya en el ordeño para posteriormente ofrecerlo mediante queso y venta de leche fresca, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Osbaldo is 60 years old and lives with his wife in the El Frayle hamlet in the Distrito Santo Tomas.  He has good relationships with the members of his community.  He lives in a small community that is essentially devoted to agriculture.  He lives in his own home made of rustic materials, located in the Cutervo province, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern Sierra.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing creole, hard, yellow corn. He has cultivated two hectares on his land.  He also has two cows that his wife helps milk to later sell in the form of cheese and fresh milk.  

He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase manure to care for his corn crops.

loans.use: Purchase manure to care for his corn crops.

loans.name: Sonia Dolores

texts.es:
Sonia de 44 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil tienen tres hijos una estudia  y los otros dos trabajan.


Sonia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, lo aprendió de su madre, ella también realizaba lo mismo; ya tiene varios  años de tenerlo vende todos los días a fuera de su  casa puesto que ya tiene sus clientes y su hija le ayuda en la venta de pupusas.            

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar quesillos, chicharrones,frijoles repollo, para elaborar las pupusas, el negocio mejorara  mas porque podrá a atender a sus clientes y la necesidad quedara sastisfecha. 

El objetivo de ella,  es seguir trabajando en su negocio,el cual le da mas ingresos y el préstamo le ayudara mucho el cual seguirá siempre trabajando con credicampo..
texts.en:
Sonia is 44 years old and she studied through 9th grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner works as a construction worker. They have three children; one studies and the other two work. 

Sonia makes a living by making and selling pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas]. She learned from her mother, who also made pupusas. She has had her business for several years. She sells the pupusas every day outside of her house, and she already has customers. Her daughter helps her to sell the pupusas. 

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to be able to buy quesillo cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, and cabbage to make the pupusas. Her business will improve because she'll be able to take care of her customers and their needs will be met. Her goal is to continue working on her business, which will provide her with more income. The loan will help her a lot, and she will continue working with CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy quesillo cheeses, fried pork rinds, beans, and cabbage to make pupusas

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Stella is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twelve years, and they are currently rearing livestock and growing maize, bananas, beans and vegetables on their farm. Stella is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Stella’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s needs and to pay school fees for her children. Stella’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a mother of four, has been farming for the last 34 years in Murang’a, Kenya. She gets by selling milk, eggs and tea produced from her farm. She also offers motorcycle transportation services to make extra money.

There is nothing she enjoys more that generating income from the work she puts in on the farm. Her biggest challenge to this day is unavailability of labour. She loves her cow that she named Karma.

Over the years, Joyce has come to appreciate the benefits of loans through Juhudi Kilimo agribusiness training sessions she attended. In her case, she will leverage her business to meet the farming inputs and equipment expenses. 

With your loan, Joyce is going to purchase irrigation pipes and generator. This will enable her plants to have year-round availability of water. This will boost yields, which will provide Joyce’s family more income by the end of the season.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation kit

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is vigorous 24-year-old lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. 

Naila intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons, creating a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations, and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Thomas is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables, and fruits in their farm. Thomas is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey. 

This is Thomas' first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Thomas' hope for the future is to have his children well educated and independent.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Charles is married and has three children. He runs a small business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty five years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, and vegetables, and rearing livestock in their farm. Charles is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Charles’ first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Charles’ hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Jeremiah is single. He is a farmer. He has been farming for three years now and he is currently growing maize and vegetables in his farm. Jeremiah is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Jeremiah’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy farm inputs. Jeremiah’s hope for the future is to buy his own farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Evans is married and has six children. He is a tractor driver. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for forty-seven years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and trees and rearing livestock in their farm. Evans is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Evan’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Evan’s hope for the future is to have all his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Joseph is married and has three children. He runs a motorbike transport business and does farming with his wife as well. They have been farming for ten years, and they are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables on their farm. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Joseph's hope for the future is to live a better modern life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Jacob is single. He just completed his high school education and he has embarked in farming. He has been farming for one year now and he is currently growing maize, beans, green grams, bananas, and vegetables. Jacob is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some money from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Jacob’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Jacob’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Zylpa

texts.en:
Zylpa lives in Ojawa, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Zylpa is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet, and vegetables in their farm. Zylpa is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to undertake at her age and it will earn her some income.

This is Zylpa’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s basic needs and pay school fees for her children. Zylpa’s hope for the future is that her beekeeping project will earn her good income so that she may have a better life and have her children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Ruth is single with three children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for three years now and she is currently growing maize, beans and bananas on her farm. Ruth is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Ruth’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Ruth’s hopes for the future are to have her children educated, and to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 34 años, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta casado con la Señora Noelia hace más de 14 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos, por quienes ambos están luchando para darles una vida digna.
Es una familia muy trabajadora que comenzó desde muy abajo, todos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante. Comenta que tuvo que viajar en España con su señora para trabajar y así montar un negocio propio. Estuvo en el extranjero durante 9 años, gracias a eso pudo hacer para su casa y montar una panadería con todas las infraestructura que orgullosamente hoy día tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina al por mayor para poder seguir trabajando en su panadería, y seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old. He is a very responsible and hard-working person. He has been married to Noelia for more than 14 years. They have 2 children, for whom both of them are fighting in order to give them a decent life.

The family is very hard-working and started from very far down. Everyone mutually helps each other in order to move forward. He notes that he had to travel to Spain with his wife in order to work and in this way start his own business. He was overseas for 9 years, and thanks to that, he was able to have his house and open a bakery with all of the infrastructure which it now proudly has.

He is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy wholesale flour in order to be able to continue working in his bakery and continue fighting as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour for his bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando tiene 35  años, es comerciante, su esposa es la señora Raquel de 34 años quien es docente, el matrimonio tiene 2 hijos, donde ellos son el mayor motivo de lucha de esta pareja.
Armando cuenta que se inicio en el mercado de ventas de repuestos de vehículos de la líneas japonesas y Coreanas con su concuñado ya hace más de 10 años, también comenta que su esposa siempre lo ayuda,  y que de esa forma han podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
El préstamo que pide es para poder comprar rotulas, amortiguadores, pastillas de frenos y lubricantes, y demás productos para la venta.  También agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Señor Armando is 35 years old. He is a businessman. His wife, Señora Raquel, is 34 years old and is a teacher. Their marriage has two children, and they are the major motivation for the efforts of this couple.

Armando relates that he began making sales in the market for auto spare parts for the Japanese and Korean lines with his brother-in-law more than 10 years ago. He also comments that his wife always helps him, and that in this way they have been able to improve their living conditions and those of their family. 

The loan that he is requesting is to be able to buy ball-and-socket joints, shock absorbers, brake pads, lubricants, and other spare parts to sell. He also appreciates the opportunity that he is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy ball-and-socket joints, shock absorbers, brake pads, lubricants, and other spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell at his store.

loans.name: Josefa Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Josefa Ramona es profesora de un centro de educacion publico desde hace 24 años impartiendo clases a niños de entre 10 y 14 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales a sabido darle una educacion de calidad, ademas de ser docente la sra. josefa Ramona posee un pequñeno negocio de venta de ropa nueva el cual le genera otros ingresos los que usa para el bienestar de ella y de su familia, en esta epoca de verano esta solicitando un credito para satifacer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Josefa Ramona has been a teacher in a public school for the past 24 years, teaching classes to children ages 11 to 14. She is the single mother of two children, to whom she has provided a quality education. 

In addition to being a teacher, Josefa Ramona also has a small new clothing sales business, which generates additional income that she uses for her and her family's well being. This summer, she is requesting a loan to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to stock her new clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana tiene 19 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su abuela de 65 años de edad. Ana trabaja en una finca cercana a su localidad desde hace cuatro años. Ella es una joven trabajadora  pero sobre todo responsable quien es muy conocida en su localidad por su integridad. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos dado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra dañado y desea repararlo antes que el invierno llegue.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old and lives in very humble conditions with her 65-year-old grandmother. Ana has worked on a farm close to her home for the past 4 years. She is a young hard-worker but, above all, is very responsible and well-known in the area for her integrity.

She wants to improve her living conditions, so she has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate, wood, and nails since the roof of her home is damaged and she would like to repair it before winter arrives.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Josue Isaias

texts.es: Josue tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de siete años y un año de edad. Josue se gana la vida mediante  la prestación de servicios de albañilería y junto a su compañera de vida que trabaja como empleada doméstica mantienen la economía de su hogar y dan a sus hijas lo necesario. Josue solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda el cual es de tierra actualmente.
texts.en:
Josue is 25 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, ages 7 and 1. Josue makes a living as a bricklayer and, along with his wife who works as a domestic employee, financially supports his household and provides the necessary things for his children.

Josue requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in his home. The floor is currently made of earth.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
La señora Jessy  socia de la alcancía comunal “madres ladereñas” es una madre soltera que tiene dos menores hijos de diez y once años, teniendo uno de ellos un problema de discapacidad. A sus 37 años esta señora ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia gracias a su negocio de venta de ropas y sabanas. Ella es el único sustento de su familia, teniendo que velar por la alimentación y educación de sus dos hijos que aun están en el colegio y por ella misma. En su negocio vende toda clase de prendas de vestir tanto para hombres mujeres y niños, además de vender sabanas. Ella trabaja solo 4 días a la semana, unas diez horas por día, ya que tiene que dedicarles bastante tiempo a sus hijos; sin embargo, a pesar de no trabajar todos los días, le va muy bien en su negocio. La señora Jessy  lleva ya en este negocio dos años. Ella cuenta que fue la necesidad la que la llevo a incursionar en este giro de negocio, ya que, al separarse de su esposo (hasta ese entonces solo había sido una ama de casa) tuvo que velar por las necesidades de sus hijos sola. Dos años después, la señora tiene un negocio  estable, con ventas diarias a entre 8 y 10 personas, y del que se siente orgullosa y muy agradecida ya que gracias a este ha podido darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y además ha conocido a mucha gente buena.
Con el crédito que ha recibido, la señora tiene pensado comprar más juegos de sabanas, que son los productos que más vende. Además, tiene pensado invertir parte del crédito en la medicina para su hijo con discapacidad. El sueño de la señora es llegar a tener un salón de belleza/spa bien implementado, ya que ha visto este giro muy promisorio y rentable. 
-La señora Jessy lleva ya dos ciclos con el grupo y refiere que hasta ahora todo ha ido de maravilla, y que se siente feliz de formar parte de este ya que tiene la oportunidad de socializar y compartir experiencias con otras madres como ella. Finalmente la señora comenta que se siente muy agradecida con los inversores extranjeros como KIVA que han hecho posible este crédito, y les hace la petición de seguir con esta loable labor de apoyo a gente necesitada con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jessy is a member of the communal bank, "Madres Ladereñas" and is a single mom with two children who are 10 and 11 years old, one of whom is disabled. At 37 years old, this lady has managed to raise her family thanks to her business selling clothing and sheets. She is the sole breadwinner of her family, having to ensure that her two school-age children have the food and the education they need, as well as looking after her own needs. 

Apart from selling sheets, Jessy also sells all kinds of clothing for men, women, and children. She works only four days a week, ten hours a day, since she has to devote a substantial amount of time to her children. However, even though she doesn't work every day her business is going very well. She has been doing this for two years and says that it became a necessity when she and her husband separated and she had to assume responsibility for her children by herself. Prior to that she had been a housewife. Two years later she has a stable business, selling to between 8 and 10 people every day. She is very thankful and proud of this because it has allowed her to provide a good quality of life for her children and, in addition, she has met many good people.

With the money from the loan Jessy is planning to buy more sheet sets, which is what she sells the most. She is also thinking of using some of the money for medicine for her disabled son. Jessy's dream is to have a well-appointed beauty shop/spa as she has seen that this can be a very promising and profitable business. 

Jessy has now been through two loan cycles with this group and states that up to now everything has gone very well. She is happy to be a part of it because she has the opportunity to socialize and share her experiences with other mothers like her. Finally, she states that she is very grateful to foreign investors like KIVA who have made this loan possible and requests that they continue with this commendable work in support of needy people who strive to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sheets, which she sells most of, and also to buy medicine for her son.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama a 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de vente de divers alimentaires et cela depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans. Elle fait le voyage elle-même pour aller chercher la marchandise. Elle possède une clientèle dans les environs où elle habite comme dans le marché où elle propose la marchandise à des commerçants qui vont revendre. Avec le crédit reçu, elle va acheter trois bidons d’huile de palme de 20 litres chacun, le reste servira à l’achat de balaies, jus de citron…
Mariama s’occupe des enfants et appuie son mari dans les charges domestiques. Elle compte un bénéfice de 30% environ après chaque vente. De cela, elle peut régler ses propres besoin.
Elle veut améliorer son commerce en augmentant la quantité de la marchandise, pour cela, elle a besoin d’avoir un capital plus stable.
texts.en:
Mariama is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has been selling various food products for more than 10 years now.

Mariama travels herself to look for merchandise. She has a customer base near where she lives and in the market where she offers her products to shopkeepers for resale. With this loan, Mariama is going to purchase three 20-liter containers of palm oil, and will use the rest to purchase brooms, lemon juice, etc.

Mariama takes care of her children and supports her husband with the household expenses. She expects to see a profit of about 30% after each sale. With that, she can see to her own needs.

Mariama wants to improve her business by increasing the quantity of merchandise; for that, she needs more steady capital.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell: palm oil, brooms, and lemon juice.

loans.name: Akouwavi

texts.fr: Akouwavi vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants de 02 enfants scolarisés à LOME. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Elle espère à l’avenir élargir son activité et assurer aux mieux les besoins de la famille.  Âgée de 45ans, elle a une ancienneté de 06ans dans l'activité.
texts.en:
Akouwavi lives with her husband and their children, two [of whom] attend school in Lomé. She sells cosmetics and is seeking a second loan to purchase merchandise.

In the future, Akouwavi hopes to expand her business and to ensure that her family's needs are taken care of. At 45 years old, Akouwavi has been in this business for six years.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Lucieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal Kuska LLankasun de Rumichaca Baja perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,distrito de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco


La socia Lucieta  se dedica al trabajo de profesora del nivel inicial,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,la socia trabaja desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
Lucieta is a member of the Communal Bank “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca Baja” which is located in the District of Urubamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. She is a primary school teacher, but she also has a business of selling beauty products such as lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes. Lucieta works from 3:00 P.M. to 8:00 P.M. and has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products.

Lucieta is requesting a loan in order to buy lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes. She is pleased with the loan and promises to submit her payments.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Meet Eunice, a mother of five living in Kisii, Kenya. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years. She makes a living selling milk, tea, and venturing into small businesses. She spends her free time weeding her farm. Her biggest challenges are persistent pests and diseases, and rapid climate change too. She loves her two dairy cows named Ayee and Junior.

Eunice joined Juhudi Kilimo to access low interest loans tailored for smallholder farmers. Through Juhudi Kilimo, she is seeking a loan from Kiva donors to purchase a hybrid dairy cow. A typical hybrid cow, by local standards, will produce 15 to 20 liters a day. Selling 15 liters every day will enable Eunice  to comfortably settle loan repayments and keep extra for personal use or savings. The additional income will enable Eunice to cover business-related expenses with ease. She will also be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre veterano de mil batallas que monto su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y legumbres hace 7 años por necesidad, pues a su edad ya nadie le daba empleo, añadido a esto también tiene una distribuidora de huevos que vende tienda a tienda en las mañas es una persona casada y junto con su esposa atiende el negocio y el solo vende los huevos de una forma empírica es decir no tiene un vehículo de transporte lo que significa una gran desventaja porque su edad dificulta todo el trabajo pero de alguna u otra manera tiene que hacerlo pues esto representa el sustento diario de su hogar, otro punto en contra es que tiene que vender muy barato ya que hay mucha competencia en el sector lo que les impide progresar y no pueden mudarse por falta de capital y lo ya nombrado problema de edad. Requiere un apoyo crediticio que invertirá en la compra de huevos para vender a un bajo costo y ganar más clientes, la otra parte del crédito será usado para la compra de abarrotes, grano, legumbres y dulces para darle variedad a su local, su sueño es poder tener un mini-mercado que pueda administrar y del que pueda vivir hasta el día que Dios le haga su llamado al cielo.
texts.en: Francisco is a man who has undergone many struggles that have lead him to his grocery and vegetable business 7 years ago, which began out of necessity. He also has a business where he distributes eggs store-to-store in the mornings. Because of his age, no one would give him a job. He is a married man. Along with his wife, he attends to his businesses. He sells his eggs in the only practical way he can, which is to say that he does not have a transport vehicle which means that he is at a great disadvantage because his age hinders his work. One way or another, he has to do it because this is his own livelihood for his home. Another downside is that he has to sell very cheaply because there is a lot of competition that prevents him from progressing. He cannot move because of lack of capital and the already mentioned problem of his age. He requires a loan for supporting his investment in the purchase of eggs to sell at a low cost to gain more customers. The other part of the loan will be used to purchase groceries, grains, vegetables, and sweets to give variety to his business. His dream is to have a mini-market that he can run and that he can live until the day that God calls him to Heaven.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Estefanía

texts.es: Estefanía en una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad que conoció del producto gracias a unas recomendaciones de su tía que la incito a probarlo y le genero efectos, motivada por estos resultados, se adentró más en la venta de estos, a conocer como podría ser una socia, de qué manera podía ella hace lo que su tía género en ella cambiar estilos de vida, por estilo de vida más nutritivos y sanos, asistió a capacitaciones nacionales e internacionales y hoy por hoy trabaja con un grupo determinado de personas en las tardes, dándoles a conocer la idea y de los beneficios que dicho producto, puntualmente Herbalife genera en sus cuerpos y vidas, solicita un apoyo económico para comprar unos productos una base, tal idea ya está estudiada y con un grupo de clientes que Estefanía maneja puede lograr comenzar su negocio de la mejor manera, esta ayuda es muy importante y significativa para ella pues quiere crear en las personas hábitos alimenticios para ser que su ciclo de vida se alargue y sea mas placentero
texts.en:
Estefanía, 19, is a young entrepreneur. She got to know these products thanks to her aunt’s recommendation. She convinced her to try them and they turned out to be good for her. These results motivated her to start selling these products; she asked how she could become a partner and how she could do what her aunt does, which is to change other people’s lifestyles, by eating better and healthier. She went to some local and international training sessions and works now in the evenings telling different groups of people about the products and the benefits they bring to their bodies and their lives.

Estefanía is requesting financial support to buy products to sell. She thought about this idea and will be able to start with her business because she has a fixed group of customers. It is important for her to receive this support, because she wants to help people to change their eating habits in order to live better and longer.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products and change people's lifestyles.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine keeps a small pharmacy in Vayk, in the Vayots Dzor region. She lives there with her husband, father-in-law, and four children.

The requested loan of $3,000 will greatly help Lusine to purchase new stock of pharmacy items needed for her clients. Lusine will be very grateful for lenders if they support her to meet her client's needs.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and pharmacy items to resell at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update her establishment and to buy supplies in order to continue the family business

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations, and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Reuben is married and has seven children. He is a mason. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, and vegetables, and rearing livestock in their farm. Reuben is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Reuben’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family’s needs. Reuben’s hope for the future is to live a better and more fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Solomon is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, and vegetables on their farm. Solomon is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food.

This is Solomon’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Solomon’s hope for the future is to advance his farming from subsistence to agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Lawi is single. He is a student as well as a farmer. He has been farming for ten years now and he is currently growing maize and vegetables and rearing livestock on his farm. Lawi is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating his crops.

This is Lawi's first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for his school fees. Lawi's hope for the future is to finish school, get a job, and be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small refrigerator and oven for his business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is 26 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. With this loan, she would like to buy more charcoal, flours and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be put toward savings.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Aquí Hay Esperanza se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene seis hijos, 5 de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y escuela. La mujer se dedica a las labores de la casa y en temporadas trabaja  limpiando pescado.
Don Carlos para llevar lo necesario a su hogar desde pequeño se dedica a las faenas de la pesca y al comercio, todos los días el se va hasta la playa a la madrugada a comprar lo que sus compañeros de la zona pescan para luego el limpiar con la ayuda de su mujer y revender a comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar para llevar el pescado a otras ciudades, el también en ciertos días a la semana sale a pescar, de esta forma el lucha día a día para darles lo mejor a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales de pesca, pescado y camarón que el revende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir los créditos. Sus deseos son que no les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group “Aquí Hay Esperanza” [Here There Is Hope] meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coast of this lovely spot.  The majority of residents here are very hardworking and do jobs related to the ocean.

Don Carlos lives in this place.  He is 36 years old and married.  He has six children from his marriage, five of whom still live at home and are elementary and high school students.  His wife is a homemaker and works seasonally, cleaning fish.

In order to get necessities for his home, from a young age Don Carlos has worked in the fishing industry and in trade.  Everyday he heads out to the beach at dawn to buy what his neighbors have caught fishing, to later clean with the help of his wife and resell to traders who come to this place in order to take the fish to other cities.  On some days, he also heads out to fish, and in this way he fights from day to day to give his family the best.

This loan is to buy fishing supplies, fish, and shrimp, which he will resell.  He has been in this credit group from the beginning and he likes the opportunity to get loans.  His desire is that his family wants for nothing.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies, fish, and shrimp

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 29-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives alone in a small, simple house in the city. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. 

Hani would like to improve himself and find a better job in the future. He would like to complete his study and take a BA degree. He is a student now, and he studies science.

Hani took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to do his homework and read articles online. 

Hani appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Vergine

texts.en:
Vergine is a farmer with 15 years of experience running a farm. She lives together with her husband as their children are married and live with their families separately. Vergine and her husband keep livestock (cows, calves and chickens) as well as cultivating barley, potatoes and grass. They work hard to run their farm in a sustainable way and gather enough income for their living.

The requested loan of 2,000 USD will be a big support for this hard-working couple to purchase three calves, fertilizer, forage and seeds (barley and wheat) needed for their farm. Please help Vergine and her husband to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, fertilizer, forage and seeds (barley and wheat).

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Loise is married and has nine children. She runs a small business of selling cereals. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for eight years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet, and soy beans in their farm. Loise is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project that she can manage at her age. 

This is Loise's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to expand her business and buy a cow. Loise's hope for the future is to expand her business and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Miguel Enrique

texts.es: Miguel es un humilde trabajador que ha dedicado toda su vida al campo, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y que ha ejercido en los últimos años más concretamente a la cría y venta de cerdos. Como se puede apreciar en la foto Miguel es un hombre muy humilde por no decir escaso de recursos, pero quiere crecer, tener más ventas, un mayor número de animales pues tiene el terreno pero no la mercancía, solicita un apoyo monetario para comprar cerdos los cuales alimentara, engordara para venderlos a un mayor precio y generar más ingresos pues este es el único sustento de su familia, lo único que pide Miguel es un apoyo este es su primer micro-crédito y quiere empezar de la mejor manera, quiere progresar quiere cumplir sus sueños de tener un mejor establecimiento, una mejor calidad de vida, darle un futuro a su hija de un año de edad.
texts.en: Miguel is a humble worker who has dedicated his whole life to the land. He learned this work thanks to his father's teachings, and in recent years he has more specifically raised and sold pigs. As you can see in the photo, Miguel is a very humble man, if not lacking in resources, but he wants to grow and have more sales and a greater number of animals, since he has the land but not the merchandise. He is asking for monetary support in order to buy pigs, which he will feed and fatten in order to sell at a better price and generate more income, since this is his family's only source of income. The only thing Miguel asks for is support. This is his first micro loan, and he wants to start in the best way. He wants to progress and achieve his dreams of having a better establishment and a better quality of life and giving his one-year-old daughter a future.

loans.use: to buy pigs in order to take better advantage of his space and be able to generate more income

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 39-year-old married Cameroonian woman.  She has six children, the oldest is eighteen years and attends high school, while the youngest is two years old.  

She has been in this business for over fourteen years which makes her very experienced and her business profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her profits from forty four thousands francs to ninety thousands francs.

loans.use: to buy a more performance computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Harley Daniel

texts.es:
Él es Harley Daniel, alumno de tercer semestre de ensamble y mantenimiento del instituto Campo Alto, no cuenta con experiencia laboral en ningún ámbito empresarial, por lo tanto agradece al instituto campo alto  por brindarle está  grandiosa oportunidad, la cual permitirá que se abran otras puertas  para conseguir el éxito.
Esta carrera le llama la atención porque  está orientado al conocimiento en las técnicas para el ensamblado y mantenimiento de computadoras, así mismo es una fuente para el crecimiento profesional, ya que, puede desempeñar el aprendizaje adquirido en cualquier campo empresarial o social.
Los planes para  el futuro es estudiar la ingeniería de sistemas y así  mismo costear la carrera como persona independiente. 
Desea el convenio kiva, ya que es una persona independiente, paga arriendo y en el momento no cuenta con todos los recursos económicos para el pago de las cuotas y transporte. El único apoyo que tiene en este momento es por parte de la madre.
texts.en:
This is Harley Daniel. He is a student in his third semester of assembly and maintenance in the Campo Alto institute. He has no work experience in the professional arena and so he is grateful to the Campo Alto institute for offering this wonderful opportunity. This will open other doors to him so that she can be successful.

This major got his attention because it is oriented towards assembly and maintenance techniques for computers. It is also a source of professional growth. He will be able to make use of his learning in any business or social arena. His plans for the future are to study systems engineering and pay for his education to become an independent person. 

He wants the Kiva agreement because he is an independent person. He pays his rent and at this time doesn't have the resources to pay for tuition and transportation. The only support he has at this time is from his mother.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Ankhbaatar

texts.en: Ankhbaatar is currently living with his wife and daughter in an old brick house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been rendering passenger transportation services to local people for fourteen years. Their son got married and is now living separately. He is requesting a loan of 2,900 USD to buy building materials such as shingles, cement, bricks and fiberglass for his house renovation, because, during winter time, the house loses its heat easily. After the renovation, his family will live in a more comfortable and warmer place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизе исполнилось 28 лет, она замужем и является матерью трехлетнего ребенка. Азиза по специальности экономист, уже 7 месяцев как она устроилась на работу в своем районе Шахритус. Она работает специалистом в местном банке в отделе денежных переводов. Муж работает вдали от семьи, в Российской Федерации. Азиза хочет купить себе компьютер. Она хочет улучшить свои навыки по работе с компьютером, однако дома у нее нет компьютера. Поэтому она просит кредит, чтобы реализовать свою цель. Она хочет самостоятельно освоить компьютер и стать продвинутым пользователем. В сегодняшний день это так важно хорошо знать компьютер. Поэтому Азиза надеется, что Вы дадите ей шанс реализовать свою цель.
texts.en: Hafiza is 28 years old.  She is married and the mother of a three-year-old child.  She is an economist by profession and she started a job in her own Shahrituz region seven months ago.  She works in the remittance department of a local bank.  Her husband is currently working in Russia, far from the family.  Hafiza wants to buy a computer.  She wants to improve her computer skills, but she doesn't have a computer at home, which is why she is taking a loan.  Hafiza wants to own a computer and become a proficient user, as this is such an important skill nowadays.  Hafiza hopes that You will give her a chance to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Milton Alexander

texts.es: Milton tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su su pequeña hija de 4 años. Milton trabaja como albañil desde hace mcuho tiempo y este oficio es el que le permite dar a su familia lo necesario. Milton solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Milton is 30 years old and lives in his own home with his spouse and 4-year-old little girl. He has worked as a construction worker for a long time, allowing him to give his family what they need. Milton is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel to install cement flooring in his home. He currently has a dirt floor and wishes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel de 57 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia.Israel solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus siembras, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Tomas is 57 years old. He is very kind and hard-working. He lives with his wife and their six children. He works very hard on his own parcel of land, where he plants corn and beans. His products are of very good quality. He sells them in the various markets that are near his place of residence. Tomas is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers, compost, and seeds, among other items that he needs for his planting, and to improve the land that the photograph shows in order to continue with his plantings. He is eager to increase his sales to be able to receive greater earnings and give his family a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers, compost, and seeds, among other items, and to improve his land

loans.name: Franklin Otoniel

texts.es: Franklin vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y su madre, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Franklin está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Franklin lives in his own home with his family consisting of his wife and mother and has had a body shop business located in their residence for several years. To get his work accomplished and cover some household expenses, Franklin is requesting a loan for the purchase of paint, varnish, oil, and other tools to continue his work and to get better profits to give his family a better quality of life without limitations.

loans.use: purchase of paint, varnish, oil, and other tools to continue their work

loans.name: Fanny Ramona

texts.es:
Fanny es una señora de 37 años, honrada, trabajadora, con muchos deseos de superación,  se dedica al comercio con la administración de un mini bar,tiene 17 años de operación, inicio con el sueldo de su esposo.

Se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos como gaseosas, jugos, arroz, frijoles, pollo, golosinas entre otros y de esta manera aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fanny is a 37-year-old woman. She is honest and a hard worker with the desire to get ahead in life. She makes a living by running a mini bar, which is located in Escuela Divino Pastor. It has been operating for 17 years. She began it with her husband’s wages, who works at FOMAV (Road Maintenance Fund).

She approached the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan for buying products such as soft drinks, juice, rice, beans, chicken, and candy. This will increase business for her.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, beans, rice, and chicken

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Consuelo es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad de 28 y 36 años. Esta señora es socia del grupo “de la mano con Jesús” desde hace ya tres años. En la casa de la señora viven ella con su conyugue, sus dos hijos, que trabajan y son independientes, y su nieta que también trabaja. La señora se dedica a confeccionar y re faccionar ropa, siendo las principales prendas con las que trabaja casacas y buzos. Ella le dedica a su negocio doce horas diarias de lunes a viernes. Incursionó en este negocio porque confeccionar fue una habilidad y a la vez pasión que tuvo desde muy chica, llegando a perfeccionarla en el instituto en donde estudio la carrera de corte y confección. La señora ya tiene mas de treinta años en este rubro, habiendo trabajado antes confeccionando el uniforme de un prestigioso colegio. La señora se siente orgullosa de su trabajo, y muy feliz de realizar un trabajo que coincida con su afición. Refiere que el aspecto que más le gusta de su trabajo es la constante innovación que tiene que hacer para diseñar nueva ropa. Sus principales clientes son los jóvenes que son quienes mas innovan a la hora de vestir, llegando a venderle ropa a unos 8 jóvenes en promedio cada día. La señora se siente tranquila con el préstamo porque sabe que va a poder pagarlo y refiere que utilizara el dinero de este en comprar más forros, hilos y cierres que son los materiales que más utiliza a la hora de confeccionar su ropa. A pesar de muchas veces no haber recibido el pago por varios pedidos que le hicieron, la señora ha sabido salir airosa de estos contratiempos. El sueño de la señora es el de algún día tener un taller grande y tener personal a su cargo. Estar en el grupo es una experiencia gratificante para ella ya que tiene la oportunidad de dirigir a otras personas puesto que es la presidenta del grupo. La señora se siente muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada por los inversionistas extranjeros como KIVA y solo les pide que no dejen de apoyar a la gente que desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Consuelo has two children aged 28 and 36. She has been a member of the group “De la mano con Jesús” [Holding Jesus’ hand] for three years. She lives together with her husband, her two children who work and are independent, and her granddaughter who also works. Consuelo makes and repairs clothes, especially sweaters and jackets. She works twelve hours per day, Monday to Friday. She started this activity because ever since she was a little girl she was good at it and wanted to be a dressmaker. She became even better when she studied dressmaking.

Consuelo has been doing this for more than thirty years and used to work for a prestigious school, making uniforms. She is proud of her work and feels happy to work doing what she likes to do. She says that what she likes the most about her job is that she needs to innovate constantly in order to make new clothes. Her main customers are young people, who are the most innovative when it comes to getting dressed. She has sold clothes to up to eight youngsters every day, on average. She is confident that she will be able to pay this loan and says that she will use it to buy covers, threads and zippers, which are the materials she uses the most when making clothes.

Despite not getting paid sometimes for some works she has done, she has been able to overcome such obstacles. Her dream is to be able to open a big workshop one day and have some employees under her charge. Being part of this group has been a rewarding experience for her, since she has the opportunity to direct other people; she is the group’s president. She appreciates the help given by foreign lenders such as those from Kiva and only asks from them that they never stop helping people to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials such as covers, threads, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is single and has six children, one of whom goes to school. Margaret doesn’t need to take care of any other additional family members. She has a business of selling roasted green bananas and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is investing in used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira is a smart woman. She began her own business in animal husbandry three months ago. She lives with her family in a rural area. Nodira is married and is raising three children. Her husband and son help her with managing the business. Nodira feeds cows for some months and then sells them in a local market. Nodira is going to develop her new business, and to get success, she is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy cows to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Hotamby

texts.en: Hotamby was born in 1961. She is divorced. Hotamby has three children, and she raised them by herself.  Fifteen years ago, Hotamby began her own business selling a variety of dishes. Hotamby sells dishes in a local market where she has her own selling place. Hotamby’s son Dasyor helps her with managing the business. Her business is her family's main source of income. She is going to develop the business and maximize profits. She is asking for a loan of 2100 USD to buy a variety of dishes like plates, cups, kettles, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a variety of dishes like plates, cups, kettles, etc

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik lives in Vanadzor city, Lori region with his wife, son and retired mother. His duty is to take care of all the financial problems of the family.
