He buys fruits and vegetables from Republic of Georgia (mainly citrus fruits) and from the villages of Ararat region. He organizes the sale of them from his own car, which he drives through his city. He has already been running this business for five years. Before, his mother used to help him with the sale of fruits and vegetables, but now Garnik manages all alone, since his mother is already old and it is not easy for her to work with her son all day long. Garnik is a very laborious person, but he needs some support to make his business get ahead.

Garnik greatly thanks Kiva for his first loan, which he used to buy citrus and tropical fruits. Now, he asks for this loan in order to buy a new assortment of fruits and vegetables. He also wants to buy new tires for his car. He hopes to receive the second loan in order to develop his fruit and vegetable trading business.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of fruits and vegetables, and to buy new tires for his car.

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en:
Alex is a 30-year-old married man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group, a village bank where members guarantee each other whether they take a loan or not, because they are all small business owners operating in the same localities.

Alex deals in selling fresh foods like tomatoes, cabbages, and cassava to sustain his family. Theft in his region is a major threat to his business. 

Alex is asking for a loan to buy building materials like timber and cement.
The extra members in the group are also group members who save and guarantee one another but have not taken a loan this time.

loans.use: to buy building materials like timber and cement.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 47-year-old man. He has a retail shop that sells general merchandise in Masindi,Uganda. Patrick started the business so as to meet his family's needs. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of seven children, all of whom attend school. 

Patrick wishes to educate his children, but he is challenged by inadequate capital. He is asking for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 30-year-old, divorced woman from Tbilisi city. She lives alone and has an income from working as a nurse. Tea takes care of one child and gets 400 GEL monthly. For better living and to progress in life, she decided to get involved in a parallel activity. 

Tea requested money and was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. She will use this money to purchase all merchandise and equipment needed for starting a cake-baking business, and after that, make distribution them to local stores. The new business initiative will give Tea the chance to have financial stability and increase her monthly income. She will be very grateful, as she can more effectively meet all daily costs and also make savings for the future.

loans.use: to start baking cakes and distribute them to stores.

loans.name: Ángel Luis

texts.es: Angel ha sido una persona muy dedica a su trabajo, creció en el campo y ha desarrollado actividades agropecuarias enfocadas en la cría de cerdos, actividad que desempeña todos los días con la que no ha tenido ningún problema pues es su propio jefe e impone su ritmo de trabajo y modo de operar, trabaja independientemente y requiere un micro-crédito para la compra de cerdos, para ampliar su negocio y poder abarcar a sus clientes pues en reiteradas ocasiones le solicitan uno de sus animales y no puede aceptar e negocio ya que no tiene le número suficiente para abarcar la demanda, por ende con este crédito quiere expandirse poder agarrar más pedidos lo que le generaría crecimiento principalmente como empresario sin olvidar sus raíces, quizás un proceso que demore años pero que ya dio el primer paso generando emprendimiento, formando una empresa creando necesidad a los clientes, conceptos que quizás Angel no maneje pero que los usa en cada venta, esa venta que significa un progreso para Angel que significa un empujón para llegar más rápido a su meta generar más ingresos, tener un negocio perdurable en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Ángel has always been a hardworking person. He grew up in the countryside and has worked in agriculture, raising pigs. He works every day and has not had any problem because he is his own boss and sets his own working pace and methods.

He works independently and needs a microloan to buy pigs to expand his business and be able to sell to more customers. Many times, they have needed pigs from him and he has not been able to sell them because he does not have enough of them. This is why this loan will help him to grow and take more orders, which would result in his professional growth, always staying close to his origins. This process has taken some years, but he took the first step as an entrepreneur. He started a company and without knowing, he is applying concepts such as “induced demand” when he sells. Each sale represents progress for him and creates momentum to reach his goal of increasing his profits and have a long-lasting business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and increase his profits.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi and her husband have two children, 23 and 21 years old.Armenuhi and her family also run a farm. They keep three cows, chickens and some oxen. The family also has some limited cultivation of wheat. Realizing how important agribusiness for the family is, Armenuhi applied for this loan of USD 3000. She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase forage for the livestock and seeds for cultivation. The loan is very important for Armenuhi to continue developing her agribusiness and she hopes for the lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is an Iraqi single woman who is 32 years old. She lives with her parents and she works to help her father with the family and living expenses.
Hala is a seamstress and has her own modest workshop at home. She learned tailoring in 2009 by attending tailoring classes. In 2009, she started providing tailoring services from her house for living purposes. She gained a great amount of experience in this field. She provides children’s clothes and women's cloaks of good quality at great prices.

Hala is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to buy a specialized sewing machine. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits to educate her younger nephews who are showing with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida was born in 1976. She is married and lives with her family, which consists of her husband and four sons and daughters at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. One of her daughters is married. Her husband is a government employee. 

Khalida has been working in sewing for seven months. She is doing great with her project. But she still needs to buy new fabrics and a sewing machine to raise her productivity and income to support her husband in covering their children's needs. She also started selling cosmetics and is planning to buy a larger collection of them.  She currently doesn't have enough money to buy them, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics and a sewing machine in addition to cosmetics

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga de 36 años de edad,  es una persona con excelentes principios morales y espirituales, muy dedicada al servicio a los demás, se creció con sus padres que se dedicaban a la agricultura y a la prestación de servicios de trasporte con un microbús, y fueron sus padres los que le inculcaron esos valores que son los que la han llevado a salir adelante y a ser una persona de bien.

Ella ayudaba a su padre a los trabajos agrícolas por las mañanas y por la tarde se dedicaba a estudiar en la escuela y así fue como logro alcanzar sus estudios de 9º grado en la escuela nacional de su comunidad.

 Con el paso del tiempo adquirió mucha experiencia y conocimientos sobre la agricultura y prestación de servicio de transporte y comenzó a trabajar a tiempo completo con su padre, ya que ella era la mayor de sus hermanos  fue así como se fue independizando y conoció a su esposo, con quien decidió acompañarse y ahora son padres de 5 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

Dominga cuenta con una experiencia de 15 años en realizar oficios domésticos y de trasporte,  ya que fue una actividad que aprendió de su padre quien le heredo el microbús con el que actualmente continua trabajando con ayuda de su esposo  motivado por las ganancias y por el compromiso que tiene de dar lo mejor a su familia y los días que no hay trabajo con el microbús se dedican a los cultivos de maíz y frijoles de los cuales le sirven para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, los días que más se dedica a la prestación de servicio son los días sábados y domingos días en los que trasporta personas a los diferentes cantones y caseríos personas que salen de compras al mercado.

El dinero será utilizado en reparación de la trasmisión del microbús,  ya que ultimadamente ha tenido una buena demanda por parte de los usuarios de servicios y con las reparaciones y ajustes que le haga al microbús podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le generara más ganancias que posterior mente serán invertidas en solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar  


Las proyecciones que tienen para el futuro son las de haber cancelado el préstamo y adquirir uno de mayor monto para la compra de una nueva unidad de trasporte, ya que con la que cuenta actualmente se está presentando algunas dificultades debido a que ya está viejo, y apoyara a sus hijos en la educación hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Dominga is 36 years old and a person with excellent moral and spiritual values, dedicated to serving others. She was raised by her parents who worked in agriculture and also provided transportation services with their minivan. It was her parents who instilled those values in her and who helped her to get ahead and become a good person. In the mornings she helped her dad with the farming, and in the afternoon she went to school, managing to finish 9th grade in the local school. 

With the passage of time, she was able to acquire much knowledge and experience about farming and transportation services, and began to work full-time with her father. As the eldest of her siblings, this is how she became independent and met her husband with whom she now has five children. They study at the local primary school. 

Dominga has 15 years of experience in transportation and doing household work. She inherited the minivan from her father which she is currently using to provide transportation services with the help of her husband. She is motivated by the money she earns and by her commitment to provide the best for her family. On days when her transportation services are not needed, she tends to her corn and bean crops which help to feed the family. Saturdays and Sundays are the busiest days for transportation, when she gives rides to people from different areas who go shopping at the market.

The money from the loan will be used to repair the transmission on the minivan. Lately there has been increased demand for her service, and the repairs and adjustments will make the minivan more reliable and allow her to provide better service to her customers, resulting in more income. The income generated will be used to cover basic household expenses. 

In the future she plans to pay back the loan and take out a larger one to buy a new vehicle since the one she has is old and is having some problems. She also plans to support her children with their education until they become successful professionals.

loans.use: to repair the transmission on the minivan.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: El señor trinidad, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Lleva aproximadamente año y medio de tener su propio negocio de una joyería y relojería donde vende relojes y repuestos como baterías, brazaletes, pines y otros, vende también anillos, aretes de plata y cadenas. Este negocio lo tiene en un local donde alquila. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar repuestos como baterías, brazaletes, pines etc. para reparar y vender relojes. Su sueño es lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y tener siempre surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 43 years old and is married with four children. He lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortés. Trinidad has had his own jewelry and watch store for a year and a half where he sells watches and parts including batteries, watchbands, pins and other items. He also sells rings, silver earrings and chain necklaces. He has his business in a rented locale. 

The loan that he is requesting is his third and is for 7,000 lempiras. With this, he will buy parts including batteries, watchbands, and pins to repair and sell watches. His dream is for his children to finish their studies and to keep his business well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy parts including batteries, watchbands, and pins to repair and sell watches.

loans.name: Katwebumbe Youth Group

texts.en:
Prossy, a new member of the group, was inspired by the other members' progress in joining Ugafode and decided to be a part of the group. She is a single mother and is applying for a loan to pay tuition for her daughter whose exams are due in two weeks. 

She hopes this will help her daughter to be able to sit for the exams and proceed with her studies. Prossy thanks the group for accepting her and Kiva for partnering with her. She is hardworking and diligent.

The other two extra members who signed the waiver are not taking this current loan.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Janat is a 33-year-old resident of Muhororo Town in Uganda, who has three children. Since 2005, she has been selling fresh foods and agricultural produce  in order to diversify her sources of income.
She has approached Ugafode for a loan through the group so that she can buy a fridge, which will help her to keep her perishable foods and fruits in good condition. Her dream is to educate all her children but she also says that she is challenged by a lack of capital. 
Janat describes herself as hard-working lady. She thanks Kiva lenders, Ugafode and the group members for partnering with her.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Kyeicumu Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Solome is the featured borrower in the Kyeicumu Twekambe Group. She is 45, married and has four children aged four, six, fourteen and seventeen years, all of whom attend school. She operates a retail shop but faces the challenge of poor transportation in the area, which affects her suppliers.

To supplement her income Solome also farms. Her group has applied for a 2,000,000 UGX loan, a portion of which she will use to buy organic manure for her vegetable garden. She expects the use of this manure will increase her yields and income in the long run.

Solome’s plan for the future is to expand her farmland, as well as convert her shop into a wholesale enterprise. She feels the demand from the residents of Kyeicumu is there.

Seated on the ground is the group chairperson who is not taking a loan this season. She signed the client waiver form, however.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is requesting a new loan to buy building stone (quarry) to sell to customers. This investment would give a better image to his products, increase his inventory to better cover the needs of his customers, and allow him to keep selling stone to his customers. 

Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to expand his business, improve sales and increase his income. He has repaid all of his debts and has financial stability, providing his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: To buy building stone (quarry) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 31-year-old Dansoman resident. He is an enterprising and active young man. Samuel earns his living by working at the market. He sells shoes at the market located in the central part of the city. This business allows him to generate sufficient income to support himself. 

With the intent of strengthening his business and fulfilling his dream of expansion, Samuel is requesting support to buy shoes in bulk. As a result, he will be able to offer his customers a choice of a variety of clothing. With this loan he will see an improvement in his income, which would allow him to enjoy a better quality of life over time.

loans.use: To buy shoe inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire clean cooking gas using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Luis Cortes

texts.es: Con 72 años de edad Luis no se cansa de trabar y luchas por mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Luis habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 22 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado como jornalero y es así como le da su familia lo necesario. Con el fin de mejorar sus humildes condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra dañado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera pode contar con este financiamiento dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso pero si cuenta con la capacidad para cancelar las cuotas mensuales que el crédito implica.
texts.en: At 72 years of age, Luis is nonetheless tireless in working hard and striving for better living conditions for his family. He lives in his own home with his life partner and 22-year-old daughter. He has worked all his life as a day labourer, and this is how he provides for his family's needs. With the aim of improving their humble living conditions, he is seeking this loan via FUSAI, which he will invest in repairing the roof of their home, which is currently in a damaged condition. He will use the money to buy galvanised metal sheeting, wood, and nails. He hopes that he will receive the loan as he does not have the necessary financial means to make the initial outlay, but he is able to make the necessary monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
La señora Irma, madre de cinco hijos de 30, 28, 22, 15 y 8 años se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya ocho años. Esta socia del grupo “mujeres buscando un futuro” vive con sus cinco hijos y una hermana. Ella no es el único sustento de su familia ya que sus hijos mayores le apoyan con los gastos del hogar.
Ella vende comida todos los días y dice que se siente muy orgullosa de lo que hace. Ella se dedica a esto por herencia familiar puesto que su mamá también vendía comida. La señora piensa invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de los insumos para preparar su comida, y en nuevos utensilios para su puesto. El sueño de esta madre es tener más de un puesto de venta. 
La señora se siente feliz de pertenecer al grupo y de recibir la confianza de las otras socias. Ella solo tiene palabras de agradecimiento para los inversionistas extranjeros como KIVA y les desea mucha suerte en su labor.
texts.en:
Irma, a mother of five children who are 30, 28, 22, 15 and 8 years old, has been working selling food for eight years now. This borrower, from the Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro (Women Seeking a Future) Group, lives with her five children and a sister. She is not the only source of support for her family now that the older children help her with household expenses.

She sells food every day and says she feels very proud of what she does. She works at this because it is in the family, since her mother also sold food. She intends to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of supplies to prepare the food and in new utensils for her stand. This mother's dream is to have more than one vendor stand.

She feels happy to belong to the group and receive the trust of the other members. She has only words of gratitude for the foreign lenders like KIVA and she wishes them the best of luck in their work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora María auxiliadora, se dedica a la costura, tiene su propio taller en donde realiza diferentes tipos de costuras, ella trabaja para mantener sus gastos, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad, pues no tiene responsabilidad alguna. Solicita el crédito para invertir en materiales para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, por el cual se ve afectada cuando llueve en el invierno.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora works as a seamstress. She has her own workshop where he does different sewing works. She works in order to cover her expenses, since her children are adults and she does not have more responsibilities.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials to improve the roof of her house, since she suffers the consequences of the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and beams, and pay for the labor needed to fix her roof.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 27-year-old married mother of 2 children.  In 2012, she started her business by opening her own shop for vending accessories, cremes, perfumes using her special selling skills and providing a high quality of products.  She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality. 

Today, Batoul is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to increase her shop's inventory to meet the needs of her clients and boost her income. She is very proud as she was able to develop her business in a short time and hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and lives in the Kisumu region of the western part of Kenya. He is married with two children, 2 and 4 years old.

He is a carpenter and has been doing this work for the last six years. David earns a monthly income of KES 19,000. He has applied for his third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase lumber and other materials. He will use the anticipated income to reinvest into the business.

He has a dream of developing his business to become a stronger supporter of his family.

loans.use: to purchase lumber and other materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 37-year-old resident of Shienwe in Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports seven people in his family and is married to Mideva, who is also a business lady.

Jackson operates Agro-Forestry, a business he has been running for the last nine years. It generates a monthly income of KES 16,000. He is requesting his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase seeds and a wheelbarrow. Jackson will use the anticipated profit to reinvest into the business.

His dream is to have a good life and be able to educate his children and build a good house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Wyclife

texts.en:
Wyclife is a 41-year-old resident of the Kakamega region located in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports seven people in his family. He has five children, ages 15, 14, 10, 7, and 2 years old.

He operates a motorcycle transport, a business he has been running for the last 12 years. Wyclife earns a monthly income of KES 4,000. He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase another motorbike. He will use the anticipated income to expand his business.

His dream is to own more than three motorbikes.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antes la vida de Antonia era sedentaria,  no poseía  ninguna meta o ilusión que la motivara. Ella se dedicaba a cuidar la finca de uno de sus hijos.  Sin embargo, su vida dio un giro distinto. Hace tres años abrió una pequeña pulpería en su comunidad.  En su negocio ofrece arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos básicos  que requieren los hogares. 
Este pequeño negocio le dio un nuevo sentido a su vida, ya que se siente motivada e inspirada, y lo quiere ver crecer  aportando parte de su capital y a través de préstamos. Por lo tanto, solicitó un financiamiento  en KIVA MiCrédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sal, café, entre otros productos y  ofrecer una amplia  variedad de productos a los clientes que la visitan diariamente.  Las ganancias de Antonia serán destinadas para mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia previously lived a sedentary life. She did not have any goals or dreams to motivate her. Antonia was taking care of a farm for one of her sons, but then her life took a different turn. Three years ago, she opened a small grocery store in her community. Her business offers rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other basic products for household use.

Her small business brought new meaning into her life. She now feels motivated and inspired. Antonio wants to grow with the use of her capital and with the help of loans. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito in order to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, coffee, and other products. By offering a wider array of products, her customers will visit on a daily basis. Antonia will use her earnings to make gradual improvements to the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. Karen has a vocational musical education and for 20 years has worked at the Stepanavan Musical School as a teacher of the musical instrument kamancha (Armenian national musical instrument) while also working at the Stepanavan Art School as a lecturer. Beside kamancha, he expertly plays violin and guitar. He also gives private lessons at his house. He says music is the only thing that makes him happy when he is sad, gives him hope and inspires him when he is hopeless, and makes his life colorful and interesting. 
Karen is married and has two daughters who are married and live with their families. His wife is unemployed and she takes care of her elderly mother-in-law.
Karen asks for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to buy a new kamancha to replace one that is worn-out. He also wants to buy a computer that will help him find interesting information connected with his occupation.

loans.use: to buy a new kamancha (musical instrument) to replace one that is worn-out and also to buy a computer that will help him find interesting information connected with his occupation

loans.name: Baby Lyn

texts.en:
Baby Lyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall.

In the future, Baby Lyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a 32-year-old Ugandan married to John  and she has three children, ages 13, 10 and 4. They are residents of Kyomukama, a rural area near Kagadi.
Teddy is a teacher by profession and teaches at a government school. She also operates a retail shop to supplement her salary.
She has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy merchandise to restock her shop.
Her main challenge is competition for the same customers from other shops in the area. She is a hard-working and honest woman who will soon overcome the challenge through the financial boost from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy salt, soap, sugar, and corn flour, among other items, to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, red oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.ru:
Эрика живет в Берегово. Она работает на заводе. Вместе с супругом и двумя детьми живет в собственном одноэтажном доме, не утепленном. 
Эрика давно хочет установить теплоизоляцию в горнице в целях экономии в отоплении. Для того, чтобы провести соответствующий ремонт ей необходима сумма в 8 000 гривен. Сохраняя тепло в доме она сможет создать оптимальные и комфортные условия проживания для семьи. 
Примечание: на фото Эрика вместе со своим сыном
texts.en:
Erika lives in Beregovo and works in a factory. She lives with her husband and two children in a one-story house that is not insulated.

Erika has wanted to insulate the house in order to save on heating. She needs 8,000 hryvnia to make the necessary repairs. Retaining heat in the house will create ideal, comfortable living conditions for the family.

Note: The photo is of Erika and her son.

loans.use: to insulate her house

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей — предприниматель из Дрогобыча. Он занимается торговлей, продает мужскую одежду, в частности, мужские костюмы. В этой сфере работает уже 17 лет. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 8 000 гривен нужны Сергею для того, чтобы закупить товар, а именно, мужские костюмы и брюки для реализации в весенне-летний период. Лето — время свадеб и торжеств в Украине, а, значит, костюмы будут пользоваться спросом и у Сергея будет неплохая выручка.
texts.en:
Sergei is an entrepreneur from Drogobych who sells men's clothing. He primarily sells men's suits and has done so for 17 years. 

He needs 8,000 hryvnia to purchase goods, namely men's suits and trousers, for the spring and summer seasons. Summer is the time for weddings and celebrations in Ukraine, so suits will be in demand and Sergei will make decent profits.

loans.use: to purchase suits and pants to sell

loans.name: Sene

texts.en:
"Sene is 30 years old and a married woman with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas, yams, etc. that she can sell in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years.

Sene needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives,chainsaw,metal filing, and axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. She will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's standard of living and for her children's education."

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, metal filing and axe

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca este año termina sus estudios, ya que está entregando su tesis. Ella vive con sus padres, trabaja en una casa de cobranzas. La carrera que está siguiendo es la de ser profesora de educación inicial. Su meta como persona es llegar a enseñar en una escuela. Ya que le gusta estar con los niños. Es por eso que decidió seguir esta carrera y llegar a recibirse. El año que viene su objetivo es llegar a obtener un rubro de docente y así llegar a ser profesora de alguna escuela.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que está a punto de terminar la carrera y quiere poder cubrir esos gastos que son elevados.
texts.en:
Francisca finishes her coursework this year and will be delivering her thesis. She lives with her parents and works for a collection agency. Her degree will enable her to become an early childhood educator. Her goal is to teach at a school since she enjoys being around children. For this reason, Francisca has decided to continue with her degree so that she can receive it. Her goal for next year is to obtain her degree in Education so that she can become a teacher at a school.

Francisca is requesting this loan so that she can cover her certification expenses. Now that she’s at the point of finishing her degree, Francisca wants to be able to cover her expenses which are much higher.

loans.use: to pay her certification expenses.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es: La sra Norma Patricia labora como profesora docente de un colegio publico de una comarca del municipio de leon desde hace 24 años impartiendo clases a niños de 10 a 14 años todos los dias de lunes a viernes de 7:00 Am hasta 1:00 pm, la sra Norma Patricia necesita el credito para cubrir unos gastos de consulta medica y de compra de medicamentos
texts.en:
Norma Patricia works as a teacher at a public school in a region of the municipality of Leon. For 24 years she has been teaching classes every day, Monday through Friday from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm, to children 10-14 years-old. 

Norma Patricia needs the loan to cover expenses from a medical consult and purchasing medicine.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac used the money from previous loans to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

Isaac has applied for his sixth loan from Vision Fund Kenya and will use the money to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do better after investing this loan.

He hopes to get a bigger loan in the future to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old married woman from Nyandarua. She and her husband have six children aged between three and 20 years old.

Mary has been running a farming business for two years. She has applied for her fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and also to boost her grocery business.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 50-year-old married man. He and his wife have four children who are aged between two and 26 years old. 

David has been running a farming business for many years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides to use on his farm.

He hopes to improve his livelihood and business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina appreciates the support for her previous Kiva loan that helped improve her living standards. In addition to her fish-selling business, Amina operates a cereal business. She is requesting a loan to purchase beans and maize for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a repeat customer who previously benefited from Kiva, describes himself as "a smart farmer who grows passion fruit and sugarcane." The previous loan enabled him to increase his production, enabling him to repay the total loan before the due date.

Moses has applied for another loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Ugafode to help him construct a structure on which to grow his passion fruit so that they don't  rot on the ground before ripening. Moses is proud that this partnership will enable him to be a big supplier of fruit to the city traders.

His dream is to construct a good home and have a family. He is a hard worker.

loans.use: to expand his passion fruit orchard, by paying workers and buying mulch.

loans.name: Tsakhkanush

texts.en:
Tsaghkanush lives with her three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country where he tries to find well-paying jobs and support his family.

Tsaghkanush runs a farm to sustain her family. She keeps livestock (cows, sheep, chickens and calves), and grows wheat. Her two elder daughters help her with the farm.

She has requested loan of USD $1,200 to buy seven piglets and calves, as well as feed. Please help this hardworking woman to maintain her farm.

loans.use: to buy seven piglets, calves and feed.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 58-year-old married woman from the village of Gamarjveba. She lives with her husband and two daughters. One of her daughters is a saleswoman at a local store and the other works at a laboratory. 

Leila also works at a local store as a saleswoman and has a fixed monthly salary of 350 GEL. However, this income is barely enough to meet all the daily expenses and rising needs of her family. 

Leila has requested a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to produce yogurt to sell at the store where she works. Leila will have loyal costumers for her high-quality product. This will be an additional source of income for her. Leila will be grateful for help in developing her agribusiness. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to produce yogurt for sale.

loans.name: Tapoti

texts.en:
Tapoti is in her forties. She and her husband earn money either by working on betel farming or in a tea stall at Kolkata. Due to poverty, her only child is also compelled to work at a tea stall in Kolkata. 

Tapoti is associated with “Nabanita” Self Help Group (SHG) of Sabuj Sangha and is actively involved in the SHG activities. She has taken loans from the NGO eight times and repaid them each time. 

A betel farm consists of bamboo put in multiple lines that act as a support to the betel saplings. They cover the farm with hay at the top, as the leaves dry up due to scorching heat.

Over the years, the bamboo became worn out and needs to be replaced. Tapoti needs a loan of INR 25,000 to strengthen her farm by buying more bamboo, hay, fertilizers, etc. The couple has enough experience in cultivating betel leaves.  

She hopes that the enhanced income will let her have her son back home and repair her house. She dreams to set up a shop for her son in the locality and set up a bigger betel farm in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, hay, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna, 36, lives in Kailashpur village, South 24, West Bengal. She has completed her education until sixth grade. Her husband is a paddy cultivator. Their cultivatable agricultural land is only an acre, so a betel leaves business is their only source of income. 

Child marriage is defined as a formal or informal union of an individual before reaching the age of 18. The majority of those affected by this practice are girls, most of them belonging to poor socioeconomic background. Aparna was one of them. She was 17 when she got married and came to Kailashpur. She was from a little bit affluent family, but after her marriage she faced financial crisis. She has three daughters, and this also kept her at home nurturing her children. Aparna is a member of “Papiya” self-help group.

Five years ago she started her bird business (parakeet birds). Although Aparna failed initially, she managed to get a grip on the business, and is running it well. She is asking for a loan to construct a similar shed as seen in the picture for badri (parakeet) bird chicks and to buy feeding pots and their feed.

Her husband works as a laborer in Pondicherry in a factory producing spare parts for cars. He is away for 9-10 months a year. Aparna is a strong woman, taking care of the family and running the business alone. 

She hopes for the fulfillment of her golden dream of having a big shed with 500 birds, and to run the business on a larger scale and put an end to the poverty. She wishes to send her daughters to a good college in Kolkata.

loans.use: to construct a shed for her birds, and buy their feed and feeding pots.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana is a 35-year-old woman living in Kailashpur village, South 24 Paraganas, West Bengal. The family consists of seven members including her in-laws. Her father-in-law is 97 years old, ill, bedridden, surviving on liquid food and the medical expenses are very high. Her husband has completed his graduation in science and works in school as a science and mathematics teacher. He also works as a translator for foreign visitors. The couple has four daughters. Since he knows the value of education, he is ensuring his daughters are educated. One daughter is studying nursing, two are in 12th and 4th grades and the smallest one is a new born.

They have 4-5 acres of land on which they cultivate paddy, betel leaves and sunflower. They also have cows that provide milk.

Archana wants to improve her income by improving her betel leaf farm. For this reason, she seeks a loan of INR 15,000. The loan will be used to buy wood, bamboo, straw, fertilizer and saplings for strengthening her betel farm, which consists of 11,000 saplings. She plans to sell betel leaves directly to the wholesale market at Kakdwip village and get some profit. She and her husband have had good experience for 5-6 years in betel cultivation. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the coming years. She is saving to send her children to college at Kolkata and to buy a van for transporting the goods.

loans.use: to buy wood, bamboo, straw, fertilizer and saplings for her betel farm

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya lives in Mahabbatnagar village under Mathurapur II Block of South 24 Paraganas district, West Bengal. As the river flows close to the village, the area has mostly agricultural land and the major plantation is a betel plantation.

Though she is 50 years old, Sandhya is a tough, confident woman with a strong willpower who used to work as a daily laborer, helper in paddy farms as well as with her husband in cold storage to earn some extra money to run her large family. Now she is completely engaged in betel (Bangla Pan) cultivation and wants to undertake some training to enhance production and improve the quality of the yield. She wants to install a hand pump near her house, as she currently has to travel more than a kilometer to fetch water for drinking and cooking.

Sandhya has been associated with the local NGO “Sabuj Sangha” and in the past, has taken a loan about nine times starting with Rs. 500 and has successfully repaid the loan every time. This time she is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 to prepare a new betel vine plantation and use the money for purchasing bamboo, wood, string, nails, saplings, manure, pesticide etc. Most of her family members are also familiar with betel cultivation and with their help, she hopes to improve her income to Rs. 50,000 per annum.
  
Sandhya was the first women in her village to build a toilet in her home, which inspired villagers to follow. She is proud to have started the change.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, wood, string, nails, saplings, manure, and pesticide

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is 26 years old and married with four school-going children. She lives in Kailashpur village in South 24 Paraganas, West Bengal. Mamata has been a member of ‘Papiya’, a self-help group, since 2008.
 
She owns a betel farm with around 5,000 saplings, which she has been cultivating successfully with her husband through hard work and dedication. The major challenge is the weather, since during monsoons the heavy rains in the Sundarbans area causes floods and cyclones that severely impact her income. Still, she is fighting the harsh weather and unavailability of financial resources to realize her dream of providing a good living for her family. She wants to construct a pacca house (good and stable) for her family and provide a good education for her kids. They currently live in a house made with a mud and hay roof.

Mamata is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000 to purchase bamboo, straw, wood, fertilizers and saplings for her betel farm. Betel leaves are consumed all over India. Kolkata pan is very famous. It’s made out of betel leaves packed with herbs, spices and sometimes sweetener too. Mamata sees a growing demand for it and wants to double her betel farm by planting another 5,000 saplings that would provide her a good income within the next two years as her current income is not sufficient to meet all her expenses.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, straw, wood, fertilizers and saplings for her betel farm.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 25-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin called Anzeh. He lives with his family in a small house. Mahmoud has worked as a farmer on his land for the past three years. He plants olive trees and sells the olives and oil to local traders. Mahmoud would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to improve his business and increase productivity. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 21 year old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Tareq is a student in the university where he studies Elementary Education. He would like to finish his studies and find a job as a teacher. 

Tareq took a loan from FATEN to help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Tareq will be able to do his homework and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 21 year old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Abdallah is a student in the university where he studies Nursing. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future. 

Abdallah took a loan from FATEN to help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to do his homework and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives in Talin with her parents. Both her mother and father are retired and Nune is the only worker in the family. 
Nune runs a farm. She keeps livestock (cows, sheep, piglets and chickens) and cultivates grass as forage for the livestock. Nune was a little girl when she learned how to run a farm. Now with her parents retired, she is perfectly capable of running her family's farm. 
The requested loan of 3,000 USD will help her to purchase five calves, forage for the livestock, and piglets needed for her farm. She asks Kiva lenders to support her with this loan and give her an opportunity to develop her farm.

loans.use: to pay for five calves, forage for the livestock, and piglets

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos desde hace 2 años, también se desempeña como jornalero agrícola, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos pequeños y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 46 years olsd. He lives in the district of Cayalti, a community whose residents work mainly in agriculture and trade. It is located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on Peru's northern coast.

He has been working raising and selling pigs for two years. He also works as a farm laborer. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy young pigs and balanced feed in order to fatten them. This will allow him to sell them at a higher price and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and balanced feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º, esta casado, su esposa tiene un negocio de pupusas; tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno reside en EE.UU y el otro esta acompañado y tiene su propio hogar; nadie mas vive con él; solamente dependen de él su esposa y su mamá. 

Pedro se dedica al trabajo de agricultura; además trabaja con ganado y lo ha hecho por mucho tiempo, lo aprendió de su papá y decidió trabajar antes de casarse y así poder tener como alimentar a su propia familia y no depender de nadie; además cultiva maíz de color amarillo, negrito y cultiva yuca, la cual es para negociar, la distancia de su casa al lugar de trabajo es de 1 ½ km y viaja a veces a pie y a veces en carreta halada por bueyes; nadie le ayuda con sus trabajos, no tiene horario de trabajo ya que lo hace por su cuenta hasta que el cuerpo aguante.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando es para pagar el alguiler de un terreno para la siembra de maíz y maicillo y además comprara insumos agrícolas, el préstamo le mejorara su negocio ya que tendrá seguro el terreno donde podrá trabajar y así tener mas granos básicos y por lo tanto le ayudara en su calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es de tener seguro el terreno donde trabajara.

Sus sueños son poder tener su propio terreno para trabajar y en cuanto a sus hijos que sigan siendo personas de bien y que les inculquen valores a sus hijos. Le ayudara mucho el préstamo ya que tendrá seguro el terreno donde trabajara; sus ganancias las utiliza para ir pagando su préstamo, y así salir muy bien con el compromiso para que le sigan prestando.
texts.en:
Pedro, 58, studied until the 6th grade. He is married. His wife has a business selling pupuas. He has two children, one of which resides in the U.S. and the other who is married and has his own home. There is no one else living with them. His wife and his mother depend on him.
Pedro earns his living in agricultural work. He also works with cattle and has done this work for a long time. He learned from his father and decided to work before his marriage so he could feed his own family and not have to depend on anyone. He also grows yellow corn and cassava. He works 1 1/2 kilometers from his home and he travels sometimes on foot and sometimes in carts pulled by oxen. No one else works with him. He has no work schedule, he does it on his own until he drops. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay rent on the land for his corn and sorghum and also to buy agricultural inputs. The loan will improve his business and secure the ground where he works. Therefore, he can grow more which will help his quality of life. The unmet need he has is to have the land where he can safely work. 
His dreams are to have his own land to work and that his children will remain food people and instill values in their children. The loan will help a lot because it give him a secure land to work. His earnings will be used to pay off his loan. He will do well so he can continue to borrow.

loans.use: para pagar el alguiler de un terreno para la siembra de maíz y maicillo y además comprara insumos agrícolas.

loans.name: Bethseba

texts.en:
Bethseba lives in Ojawa, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Bethseba is a widow with two children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for fifteen years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, green grams, millet, oranges, and pawpaws in her farm. Bethseba is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income and the bees will aid in pollinating her crops.

This is Bethseba's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family's basic needs and pay for her children's school fees. Bethseba's hope for the future is to have her children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Elza Antonia

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario del mismo, este Cantón es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su variedad de flora y fauna silvestre, en los feriados de carnaval que se realizan todos los años aquí en este Cantón toda su gente se dirige a la cascada del amor a pasar un momento agradable en familia.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Elza una mujer luchadora de 59 años ella es viuda de esta relación tuvieron 3 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos por lo que no pudo prepararse ella tiene un restaurante, aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia al mismo negocio le dedica un promedio de 15 horas al día en el mismo recibe la ayuda de uno de sus hijos en las tardes.
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando activos para incrementar su clientela, con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida, la señora Elza agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a hot, humid climate.  It is full of kind and hardworking people who traditionally celebrate festivities for the establishment of their canton.  This region is a tourist attraction, often visited for its wild flora and fauna.  During the Carnival holiday, which happens every year, everyone in this region heads to the Cascada de Amor [Waterfall of Love] to spend a pleasant time with their family.

Señora Elza lives in this area and has a business.  She is a woman, age 59, who is a fighter.  She is a widow who has three children from her marriage, all of whom are now grown up.  She comes from a family with limited financial resources, so she couldn’t educate herself.  She has a restaurant; she learned this business on her own.  She works an average of 15 hours a day in the restaurant.  She has the help of one of her children in the afternoon.

She is asking for this loan to invest in her business, buying assets to increase her clientele.  With this new investment they can improve their income and quality of life.  Señora Elza is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities they have given.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
The group consists of three successful members of the group called Baloon Bay. The featured borrower is Christiana, a 35-year-old married mother of one child, aged 15. Christiana sells plates and vegetables from house to house, and will use her portion of the loan to buy more plates and vegetables. 

This is the group's fourth loan from ID-Ghana; the other members are Evelyn, aged 40, who sells gari (cassava flour), maize, palm oil and beans, and Cynthia, aged 36, who sells provisions and wigs.

loans.use: To buy more plates and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Víctor un hombre de 59 años es felizmente casado esa relación tienen 7 hijos ya todos mayores de edad el mayor tiene  36 años y el ultimo tiene 18 años, el se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería en la finca produce cacao y leche, la esposa le ayuda en la finca en la recolección del cacao y en el ordeño de las vacas, aprendieron de esta actividad en su niñez ya que fueron criados en una finca y sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, al negocio le dedican un promedio de 8 horas diarias entre el ganado y el cacao.
Ellos viven y tienen el negocio en el recinto playas del rio blanco un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, a este recinto llegan turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de los maravillosos paisajes y sitios de descanso que encontramos en la vía.
El señor Víctor solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio del cacao comprará abono para continuar con la producción, con esta inversión mejoraran los ingresos económicos y mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia, el señor Víctor agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Víctor is a happily married, 59 year-old man. They have seven children, all of which are grown up. The eldest is 36 and the youngest is 18 years old. Víctor works in farming and raising cattle, producing cacao and milk on the farm. His wife helps him with harvesting the cacao and milking the cows on the farm. They learned this trade during their childhood as they were raised on farms and their parents worked in this business. Between the cacao and the cattle they dedicate an average of eight hours a day to the business.

They live and have their business in the area of Playas del Rio Blanco, a place with a warm, humid climate, full of friendly and hard-working people. Domestic and international tourists come to this area to enjoy the wonderful scenery and places of leisure found on the road.

Víctor is requesting this loan to invest in his cacao business. He will buy fertilizer to continue with production. With this investment his income and his family's quality of life will improve. Victor is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for their support and for offering this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and continue with production.

loans.name: Claris Maribel

texts.es:
Claris de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado,es madre soltera sus dos hijas estudian una bachillerato y la otra noveno grado; por lo tanto ella sostiene su familia para darles una mejor educación.


Claris se dedica a vender tortillas, el negocio lo inicio debido a que ella sola ha crecido a sus hijas, sus hijas le ayudan,  el horario de la venta es de  8:00 AM a 12:00 PM y de  4:00 PM a 7:00 PM

El préstamo lo utilizara para arreglar su casa, puesto que ya viene la apoca lluviosa y el techo necesita reparación,de esa forma lograra su objetivo y ella y sus dos hijas estarán mas protegidas. 

El objetivo de Claris es que sus hijas estudien para sacar su carrera y pueden valerse por si mismas.
texts.en:
Claris is 42 years old. She has a fourth grade education. She is a single mother of two daughters who are both in high school. She is the only one supporting her household and trying to give them a better education.

Claris works selling tortillas. She started her own business because she needed a way to raise her daughters. Her daughters help her. Her business hours are from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm and from 4:00 pm to 7:00 pm.

She will use this loan to repair her home, because the rainy season is approaching and the roof is in disrepair. This loan will allow her to achieve this goal and her two daughters will be better protected.

Claris' goal is for her daughters to stay in school so that they can earn a degree and become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 2 Group

texts.en:
Reina is one of our businesswomen. She sells seafood in her community, which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains. Reina started her business around seven years ago with her personal savings. She sells all kinds of seafood such as squid, fish, crabs, and shrimp. Reina lives near Bahia, in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone. She has two children who still live at home and she lives with her long-term partner, who is the children's father.

Reina’s most important challenge is to live according to God’s will. Reina is requesting her 11th loan from Esperanza International. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment from each loan. She has had the opportunity to improve her life and family and expand her business to get more clients. Reina would like to save her profits to renovate her house and give her children a safer home. In the future, she wants to become a successful and professional businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy seafood to resell

loans.name: Shirley Rosana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio.
Doña Shirley es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para sentirse útil y así lograr sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, hace 4 años instalo un negocio de internet y cabinas telefónicas en su casa, en su local presta estos servicios y vende helados, sodas jugos, golosinas, tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras. Ella también vende productos de catalogo como perfumes, cremas, bisuterías entre otras cosas, vende tanto en su local o puerta a puerta. Así tiene muy buenos ingresos por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para pagar el servicio de internet y telefonía y para comprar helados, golosinas y cosméticos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora aun más su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its vast diversity of traditional products like the straw hats that are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the "Mujeres Por El Progresso" [Women for Progress] communal bank meet there every 15 days.

Shirley, 35, lives here. She is married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 9 years old. Her two oldest attend secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband works in the city of Jaramijo.

Shirley is a fighter who likes working to feel useful and in that way earn her own income for the good of her family. Four years ago she installed public internet access and a phone booth service in her home. She started a business to sell these services and ice cream, soft drinks, juices, snacks, phone cards and air time recharges for all telephone operators. She also sells catalogue products such as perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, among other things. She sells both from her home and goes door to door. She earns a very good income for the good of her family.

This loan is to pay for the internet and telephone service and to buy ice cream, snacks and cosmetics. She has been in  the communal bank for 3 years and likes it because she improves her business even more with these loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to pay for internet and telephone services and to buy ice cream, snacks and cosmetics

loans.name: Arely De Jesus

texts.es: Arely de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo quien posee una sastrería, ella tiene una pequeña farmacia ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Arely está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicamentos por mayor para poder surtir mas su farmacia y así atender mejor a sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Arely, age 52, lives in her own home with her son and husband, who runs a tailor shop. She herself runs a small pharmacy out of her home. She has a large customer base thanks to the quality of her products and her low prices. With what she earns from her sales and with the help of her husband, they are managing to stay ahead of the household expenses. Arely is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more medicines at wholesale prices and stock her pharmacy. This will let her serve her customers' needs better, earn more income, and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase medicines to stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric, needle, thread, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones. Actualmente vive junto con su familia, ella es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. La clienta  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella  seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client, age 25, is a responsible woman who meets her obligations. She currently lives with her family, and she is very hard-working, always doing what needs to be done with happiness and enthusiasm. She is a farmer, and plants her crops every year with the staple grains of the area, corn and beans. The client wants to increase her sales, so she came to the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan that will help her to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and more. She hopes she can rely on the requested assistance as she has no other source of income. With the loan, she can continue to earn her household's daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and more.

loans.name: Dianca Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios trabajadores y coordinado por la señora Olga de 51 años de edad, casada, dependiendo de ella un hijo de 14 años, ofrece el servicio de comida de lunes a viernes y por encargo a los trabajadores de la zona franca cercana a su vivienda y solicita el credito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, papa, zanahorias, remolachas, tomates, estc. Otra de las socias es la señora Jesenia de 27 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos AVON y el señor Josué de 28 años comerciante de zapatos en los departamentos del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is composed of three members coordinated by Olga.She is 51 years old, married and has a 14 year old son who is dependent on her. She offers food services from Monday to Friday, on order for the workers in the free trade zone close to her house. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

The other members are Jesenia who is 27 years old and sells Avon cosmetics and Josué who is 28 years old and sells shoes in the departments of the country.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, a motorcycle rider, thanks the Kiva lenders for lending for his previous loan. He was able to buy a motorcycle and has even increased his income. He works 9 hours a day, six days a week to maximise his income. Being a small-scale farmer, he has now approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy seedlings to plant as well as pay for labour to clear the gardens. He believes he will have a bounty harvest once they have grown and therefore increase his income.

His dream is acquire more land and another motorcycle and also to have a family. He says the major challenge he faces is the poor road network. He is a hardworking person who wants to prepare for his family a good foundation. In the picture is Edward and the motorcycle he acquired.

loans.use: To buy improved maize seedlings

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de menestras en el interior del mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marianela, 52, lives with her spouse and children in the Morropón district, a community with a hot climate located in the province of the same name in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people earn their living in agriculture, sales, and ranching.   

Marianela sells stew inside the market in her area.  She has requested a loan for 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a variety of products to expand her business so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Es originaria de Managua, llego a Bilwi desde hace 15 años con el propósito de establecer su propio negocio en conjunto con sus hermanas, tiene 46 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y la menor de 20 años que cursa su quinto año de secundaria. Desde hace 10 años estableció su pequeño de negocio de venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos, queso, crema y huevos. Con las ganancias percibidas y con un primer crédito que obtuvo en Pana Pana, pudo comprar un tramo en el mercado y diversificar sus productos. Solicita un segundo crédito para  comprar en Managua mercadería para su negocio: anteojos, planchas, CD de videos de películas y músicas, control remotos, abanicos, cocinas, radios y lámparas. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en: She is a native of Managua. She arrived in Bilwi 15 years ago with the idea of establishing her own business along with her sisters. She is 46 years old. She is married, with 5 children, of whom 4 are adults and independent, and the youngest, who is 20, is in his fifth year of secondary school. Ten years ago she set up her little business of selling tortillas, cooked beans, cheese, cream, and eggs. With the earnings she obtained and with her first loan from Pana Pana, she was able to buy a section in the San Jerónimo market and diversity her products. She is applying for a second loan to buy merchandise in Managua for her business: glasses, irons, movies and musics CDs, remote controls, fans, cookers, radios, and lamps. Her dream is to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua for her business: glasses, irons, movie and music CDs, remote controls, fans, cookers, radios,and lamps

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Ларисе — 52 года, она живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на местном рынке женской одеждой. Торговое место у нее собственное. Опыт работы — 17 лет. 
Сумма в 10 000 гривен нужна для закупки партии товара на весну-лето, а именно приобрести ассортимент кофточек, блузок, юбок и прочего под реализацию. Большой опыт и усердие в работе помогают Ларисе успешно вести свой бизнес и видеть потенциальные возможности его дальнейшего развития.
texts.en: Larisa is 52 and lives and works in Melitopol. She sells women's clothing at the local market. She has her own shop and 17 years of experience. She needs 10,000 hryvnia to purchase spring and summer clothing: an assortment of tops, blouses, skirts, and other clothing items. Larisa's extensive experience and her diligence will help her successfully run her business and potentially expand it further in the future.

loans.use: to purchase blouses and skirts for seasonal sales

loans.name: Ervin Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Ervin Manuel es un joven maestro dedicado a la educacion primaria en unos de los colegioos publicos de nicaragua que esta ubicada en unas de las comarca de la ciudad de leon desde hace 3 años impartiendo clases a niños de entre 10 y 14 años, este joven esforzado necesita el credito para la compra de una computadora la cual le servira para seguir aprendiendo y asi mismo seguir enseñandole a sus estudiantes todo los avances que existen en la educacion.
texts.en: Ervin Manuel is a young man who works as an elementary school teacher in a public school in Nicaragua, located in one of the regions in the city of Leon. He has taught 10- to 14-year-olds for three years now. This hard-working young man needs a loan so that he can buy a computer, which will help him continue to learn and also continue to teach his students about all the advances that are happening in education.

loans.use: buy a computer to help him teach primary school.

loans.name: Elsa Mirian

texts.es: Elsa de 33 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Elsa  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Elsa, age 33, is very friendly and hard-working. She lives with her two children in their own home. She works very hard on her parcel of land, where she grows corn and beans. Her produce is of very high quality, and she sells it in various markets near where she lives. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she has the money needed to invest in the purchase of various agricultural supplies, including fungicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, and other things that she needs for planting. She is eager to expand her sales so that she can earn more money and provide her family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: buy fungicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 14 años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia. Ana está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Ana is 33 years old and has worked in agriculture for the past 14 years.  She plants beans and corn and with the sales made from her harvest she is able to pay for household living expenses.  She is a responsible, honest and hard-working woman.  She lives with her family group in her own home.  Ana is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy products for her crops such as the following: fertilizers, plant feed and seeds.  What she currently earns does not enable her to cover all of her expenses, so these products will help her make a more profitable harvest and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, plant feed and seeds.

loans.name: Jasmina Del Socorro

texts.es: Jasmina es una mujer emprendedora, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con  12 años de laborar, es casada con 2 hijos a su cargo a quien le da el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente esta señora está presentando  una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda atravez de la  construcción de un baño, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para la Compra de cemento, puerta, azulejos y mano de obra, la que le vendrá a dar las condiciones necesarios para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida, ya que atravez de los financiamientos a logrado realizar dichas mejoras ya que ha solicitado 7 créditos los que han sido de gran impacto en el desarrollo socioeconómico
texts.en: Jasmina is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is a teacher by profession with 12 years of experience.  She is married with two children in her care who she gives the necessary support for their development.  Currently she is in need of improving her home through the building of a bathroom.  For this reason she visited the offices of Kiva partner Ceprodel in order to request a loan to buy cement, a door, tiles and manual labor.  This will help her to improve her quality of life, since with the loan she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She has requested 7 previous loans and they have made a great impact on her socioeconomic development.

loans.use: To buy construction materials including cement, a door, tiles and manual labor.

loans.name: Allans José

texts.es: Allans es un señor esforzado en la actividad en que se desempeña como transportista de carga pesada, del cual es propietario, es casado con 2 hijos a su cargo a los cuales le da todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico, actualmente está presentando una necesidad como es mejorar el tren de Rodaje para su camión, por tal razón se presento a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de 4 llantas las que tiene en mal estado, de esa manera prestar un mejor servicio en el traslado de la carga que realiza de manera interdepartamental, del cual tiene 5 años de tener dicha actividad económica y que le permitiría mejorar sus condiciones familiares. ya que este es el segundo financiamiento recibido por este señor.
texts.en:
Allans is a hardworking man who works transporting heavy freight. He runs this business, is married and has two children under his care. He gives his children all of the support needed for their academic development.

Right now he needs to fix the running gear on his truck, which is why he is came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy four tires that as those he has are in poor condition. This will allow him to offer better service in transporting freight, which he does across departments. He has been at this business for five years and it has allowed him to improve his family's quality of life. This is the second loan this man has received.

loans.use: to buy four tires.

loans.name: Orfa Noemy

texts.es: Orfa de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su  hogar. Vive en casa de un familiar con sus hijos. Orfa  solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Orfa is 48 years old, and has worked selling tortillas from home for several years, monday through sunday. She has many customers because she's so hardworking and friendly. With the profit she earns she's able to pay the household expenses. She lives in a relative's house with her children. Orfa is requesting this loan to purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime to continue making tortillas and boost her profits to give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, iron, beams, and cement blocks and to also pay for the labor.

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
