Dau is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuations as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor  Manuel se dedica a laborar arduamente como maestro de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio   en una comunidad del municipio donde habita, es casado con 2 hijos a los que tiene proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades del señor Manuel atraviesa hoy en día es  de embaldosar  y repellar su vivienda. Ya que el  piso que tiene actualmente es de tierra. Por  lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar esta obra. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel  para solicitar su crédito  número 2 para compra de materiales de construcción tales como: Cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.
Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo y su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel works arduously as an elementary school teacher at a small school in a community in the municipality where he lives.  He is married and has two children for whom he needs to provide the conditions needed for their development.

One of the needs that Manuel is now experiencing is to tile and whitewash his house.  This is because he currently has a dirt floor.  Therefore, he has made the wise decision to start this job.

That is why he comes to CEPRODEL in order to request his second loan.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement and sand.  He will also pay for the labor.

Through this work he will provide better living conditions for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and sand and to also pay for the labor.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: René de 58 años de edad, posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; él es un hombre muy emprendedor con muchas ganas de  salir adelante, está dispuesto a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas, aceite,  etc.  René tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
René is 58 years old. He has a shop where he sells everyday goods. 

Lately, he has had a lot of customers because he always has what people need, with products of excellent quality at really accessible prices and with unequaled service. He is a very enterprising many with a strong desire to get ahead. He is ready to make his business grow, and that's why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy staple grains, instant food products, deli meats, sweets, drinks, oil, etc. 

René has confidence that with his dedication, he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, instant food products, deli meats, sweets, drinks, oil, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling avon products. Analyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional scrap materials to sell through her buy-and-sell scrap materials business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one is underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lavdije

texts.en:
Lavdije runs a small fish farm where she raises trout. She is now requesting a loan to buy fish food. 

Seen in the photograph is one of the reservoirs with fish in the first stage (1-3 months) of growth; Lavdije also has another reservoir for the last stage (4-9 or 12 months). The reservoirs are built adjacent to her house, and her clientele consists of the area villages, including local restaurants.  

Lavdije’s village is built in craggy mountains; women in this village have had their traditional handmade, embellished red and white costumes, for generations. Older women even dress up in such costumes daily. While the soil is not good for growing vegetables, it supports livestock including cows, sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy food for the trout she raises in a reservoir built in her backyard.

loans.name: Ymer

texts.en:
Ymer wants to pay for his son’s education fees, and the amount of the loan he is requesting is 100,000 Albanian Lek. 

He is 50 years old and a married father of three children; 24, 23 and 22; all of them are studying in the university. Ymer practices agriculture/livestock as a means of making a living. He’s got one cow and six sheep and he sells the raw milk to the market. 

He also has plum and cherry trees, and in addition to selling the fruits, he makes jam and an alcoholic drink from them called ‘raki’. To transport these products to the local market he uses the horse he has.
 
In Ymer’s village, almost every household has plums and cherries and they also plant small red potatoes, beans, onions and garlic in large quantities that they sell dried to wholesale buyers.

loans.use: to pay his son's educational fees (master's degree).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry-bush-meat, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Juan Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es  un hombre  emprendedor, debido a la poca oportunidad de empleo, opto por crear su propia Micro Empresa, de la cual ya tiene 12 años de funcionamiento teniendo buenos resultados ya que mantiene el mercado establecido, siendo  su actividad económica el Hornear maní que compra a los recolectores de Residuos de  cosecha que queda en el campo y lo procesa,  es casado, también su esposa con su hija tienen un negocio de venta de Ropa en Managua como otra alternativa económica.
Actualmente este señor visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de 200 qq de maní, como una oportunidad de negocio,  los cuales   vendrán a incrementar  sus ingresos y de esta manera estabilizar su producción  y mantenerse en el mercado ya que lo vende empacados en bolsitas pequeñas con algunos aditivos de sabores, y de esa  manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar is an enterprising man, due to the small employment opportunities; he opted for creating his own business, which has been operating for 12 years with great results since he keeps the market he has established. 

His economic activity is roasting peanuts that he buys from people who gather up the harvest leftovers and he processes them. He is married, and his wife and daughter also have a clothes selling business in Managua which is an additional source of income.

Recently he came to Ceprodel to request financing to use in buying 200 quintals of peanuts, as a business opportunity. It will come into play in increasing his income and through this manner stabilize his production and allow him to stay in the market. He sells it packed in little bags with a few flavour additives, and thus he will improve his living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 200 quintals of peanuts

loans.name: Rafaela Del Socorro

texts.es: Rafaela Es una señora esforzada para darle lo mejor a su familia, es soltera con 2 hijos uno de ello ya trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, esta señora labora como conserje en un colegio de la localidad donde vive y también cuida a un niño en los tiempos libres, esta señora se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento en que utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, pilares, clavos, cemento, arena y mano de obra, para mejorar cocina y techo donde de esa manera mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, agradeciéndole a ceprodel por la oportunidad de mejorar lo antes mencionado, atravez del crédito otorgado para ser efectiva el objetivo de su inversión.
texts.en: Rafaela is a woman who works hard to give the best to her family.  She is single and has two children, one of whom works and helps her economically.   She works as a janitor at a school in the city where she lives and she also takes care of a child in her free time.  She came to Kiva partner Ceprodel to ask for a loan in order to buy construction materials: zinc, pillars, nails, cement, sand and manual labor.  She will use these to improve her kitchen and roof and thereby offer better living conditions to her family.  She thanks Ceprodel for the opportunity to improve her home via this credit which will make her objective possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: zinc, pillars, nails, cement, sand and manual labor.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 45 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Andresa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Andresa has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Gemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorgiena

texts.en:
Lorgiena is 36 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Lorgiena works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, candies, biscuits, etc. In the future, Lorgiena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and to construct a cow shed

loans.name: Lotis Grace

texts.en:
Lotis Grace is single and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Lotis Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Lotis Grace has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Lotis Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 44 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Eden has borrowed and paid back 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a mother of 4, has been a mixed farmer for 34 years! She lives together with her family in Murang’a, Kenya. Her primary income sources are eggs and tea produced at her farm. She enjoys making profits from selling her farm production. Her biggest challenge is the unavailability of labor. 
Mary has been to various financial and agricultural training sessions. She came to appreciate loans as stepping stones to succeed.  Mary looks for loan providers with favorable interest terms, such as KIVA, that will not strain her budget: She is already encountering high farm input expenses. 
Mary is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will expand the poultry operation she has going and generate more income to repay the loan. The family will enjoy increased income once the loan is fully serviced.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, other vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, other vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Smiling

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30 year old Smiling  from Gokwe. She is married with three children and two are attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Smiling  runs a retail business selling groceries, cooking oil, sugar, flour, and washing powders. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge being faced is the high levels of competition. Smiling has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase stocks hence profitability. In the future Smiling  plans to grow her business into a supermarket/service shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy farm equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, rubber tubs, buckets, baskets, pans, bowel, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Panajot

texts.en:
Panajot is 48 and a father of two school-aged children. He is involved in agriculture for a living, more specifically apple orchards and grapevines. He sells the fruits to wholesale buyers. Panajot will use this loan to buy pesticides for the trees.

A bit about his village, which is a part of a coastal commune: half of the village is built in a field area and half on a hill. Agriculture and livestock are both pursued by villagers.  Wheat, corn, potatoes and onions are largely planted among all households, and cows, sheep and goats are their preferred animals. 

Most of all, Panajot’s village is known for their chestnut trees. They produce large quantities of chestnuts and they supply 1/3 of the Albanian market. The traditional cooking here includes the baked apples and chestnuts, compote with dried plums and the pie or ‘lakror’, as called in the local language, that is baked in a very primitive way.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his apple orchards and grapevines.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий — из Хуста. Он занимается заменой кровли.  Василий — прекрасный специалист, с богатым опытом и тщательным подходом к делу. Заказы принимает дома и по интернету, в основном по рекомендации тех, у кого уже работал, перекрывая крышу. 
Сумма в 15 000 гривен нужна Василию, чтобы закупить материал для выполнения заказов, в основном это металлические листы, бляхи, а также приобрести инструменты, а именно шуруповерт и дрель. Полученные от реализации заказов средства Василий планирует вложить в последовательное развитие бизнеса и улучшение условий проживания своей собственной семьи. В будущем хочет сохранить стабильность бизнеса и передать навыки профессии своему сыну.
texts.en: Vasiliy is from Khoost and repairs roofs. He is an expert with a lot of experience and a thorough approach to his business. He takes orders at home and online, mainly through recommendations from people whose roofs he has repaired. Vasiliy needs 15,000 hryvnia to purchase the materials needed to fill his orders, such as metal sheets, metal plates and tools, including a drill and electric screwdriver. He plans to use the profits from filling orders to invest in developing his business and improving his family's living conditions. In the future he wants to maintain a stable business and teach his son the skills of the profession.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and tools for his roofing business

loans.name: Juana Mirey

texts.es: Juana es una señora ejemplar preocupada por el desarrollo de su familia, es casada con 3 hijos a su cargo, actualmente trabaja en un núcleo educativo, desempeñándose como secretaria ejecutiva con 25 años de laborar, además tiene un negocio con su marido como es la venta de sorbetes eskimos en el sector donde vive,  debido a la oportunidad de negocio por la época de semana santa se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de conos y galones de Eskimos, para incrementar el inventario de mercadería y abastecer la demanda existente y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida familiar
texts.en: Juana is an exemplary woman concerned for the development of her family.  She is married with three children in her care.  Currently she works in an educational setting, serving as an executive secretary.  She has 25 years of experience, and she also has her own business with her husband, which is selling ice cream in the area where they live.  Due to the opportunity for business around the Easter season she came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan which will be used to purchase cones and gallons of ice cream in order to increase inventory and supply the existing demand.  In this way she will improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cones and gallons of ice cream

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es: La señora luz es una mujer emprendedora, casada no tiene hijos a su cargo, de profesión Repostera, dicha actividad económica es la fabricación de repostería de toda clase negocio que tiene  15 años de ejercerla con buenos resultado `por la calidad de sus productos, esta señora tiene la necesidad de asegurar su vivienda con la construcción de una tapia, por esa razón visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra cantera, hierro corrugado, hierro liso, arena, cemento y mano de obra, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Luz is an enterprising, married woman with no children to take care of.  She is a pastry cook by profession, which means she makes all kinds of baked desserts.  She has been in the business for 15 years with good results because of the quality of her products.  Luz needs to secure her home by building a wall.  She visited Ceprodel to request a loan so she can pay for construction materials such as quarry stone, smooth and corrugated iron rods, sand, and cement, as well as labor.  This will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials such as quarry stone, smooth and corrugated iron rods, sand, and cement, as well as labor

loans.name: Ma. Diodivina

texts.en:
Ma. Diodivina is 50 years old and married with three children. She  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like biscuits, noodles, sugar, laundry soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Ma. Diodivina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like biscuits, noodles, sugar, laundry soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and has eight children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Teresita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Martha Jacinta

texts.es: Martha es una señora de 58 años de edad ella es viuda y tiene 6 hijos pero de ellos ya todos son independientes y ya no viven con Martha, la menor de todos tiene 30 años, Martha cuida a un nieto mientras que la madre del niño trabaja, Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que se dedica a criar chanchos y a negociar toda clase de granos como arveja, frejol, maíz entre otros, el crédito lo va a invertir comprando chanchos, la aspiración de Martha es seguir trabajando para cubrir sus gastos y dice que lucha por salir adelante y no le gusta molestar económicamente a sus hijos.
texts.en: 58-year-old Martha is a widow who has 6 grown-up children who have now left home. Her youngest child is a 30-year-old daughter and Martha looks after her grandson while his mother works. Martha is a very hardworking woman because she breeds pigs and trades in all kinds of grains such as peas, beans, and corn among other things.  She will use the loan to buy pigs.  Martha's ambition is to continue working so as to cover her expenses and she says that she strives hard to get by and that she does not like to harm her children financially.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: En una ciudad donde se dedican a la ganadería vive Clara una señora de 60 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 8 hijos pero ya  ninguno de ellos vive con ella, Clara y su esposo trabajan juntos cuidando ganado y también se dedican a la ganadería, Clara se siente contenta con su negocio y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un ternero para aumentarlo en los demás terneros que tiene, Clara aspira que de este negocio pueda sacar una utilidad que le permita crecer e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is a 60-year-old woman who lives in a city that is known for livestock breeding. She is married and has eight children, but none of them live with her. Clara and her husband work together by taking care of their cattle. They also devote time to breeding these animals.

Clara is pleased with her business. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of calf so that she can increase her existing herd. Clara aspires to grow and increase her business so that it will be proven to be useful.

loans.use: to buy a calf to add to her herd.

loans.name: Henderson

texts.es: Henderson nació y vive con su madre y hermana en Lima, proviene de una familia de padres separados, el trabajo de su madre vendiendo periódicos es la única fuente de ingresos familiares, por lo que continuar con sus estudios seria imposible sin el apoyo económico de los prestamistas de Kiva. Su sueño es poder concluir su carrera técnica y trabajar para ayudar a su madre y hermana y salir adelante. Mas adelante le gustaría convalidar sus estudios en una universidad para poder profesionalizarse en el ramo industrial. Henderson agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le otorgan a el y a todos los jóvenes, convencido de que no existe mejor inversión que la educación para el desarrollo de los pueblos.
texts.en:
Henderson was born in Lima, where he lives with his mother and sister.  His parents are separated.  His mother's business selling newspapers is the only source of income for the family, and so Henderson would not be able to continue with his studies without the financial support of the Kiva lenders.  His dream is to be able to complete his technical degree so that he could work to get ahead and help his mother and sister.  In the future, he would like to get university credit for his studies, so that he can become a professional in the industrial sector.  

Henderson thanks the Kiva lenders for the support that they are providing to him and to all of the young people.  He's convinced that there is no better investment than education to promote development.

loans.use: to finance his technical studies in industrial electronics

loans.name: Noe De Jesus

texts.es:
Para Noé  ser vendedor ambulante no es motivo de vergüenza. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser  un hombre esforzado. Todos los  días recorre en su moto distintas calles con su mercancía. Gracias a este oficio ha podido mantener a su familia por catorce años.  Ya conoce los gustos de los clientes y sus  preferencias. Sin embargo, las distintas  rutas que transita a diario se hacen más incomodas por el peso de sus productos. 
Todas las personas del mundo poseen ilusiones y Noé no es la excepción. El sueña con tener su propia tienda en el mercado de su ciudad. Para ello necesita contar con un mayor capital, más del que actualmente cuenta. Ya dio su primer paso, solicitar un financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito  para la compra de  lámparas de manos, relojes, carteras y fajas.  Su meta es que su negocio crezca ofreciendo productos variados,  de esa forma obtendrá  ganancias para beneficio de su familia y lograra construir su casa.
texts.en:
Noé is a street vendor who has no shame. He has always been known for being a hardworking man. Every day he travels through different streets on his motorcycle carrying his merchandise. Thanks to his trade, he has been able to support his family for the past 14 years. He is already familiar with the likes and preferences of his customers. However, the different routes that he has to travel each day are made more uncomfortable because of the weight of his products.

Everyone in the world has dreams and Noé is no exception. He hopes to have his own shop at the market in his city. Noé is in need of a large amount of capital, more than he currently has. He has taken the first step of requesting a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. Noé will use the money to buy flashlights, watches, wallets, and belts.

His goal is to grow his business by offering various products. This will generate income that will benefit his family and allow him to build a house.

loans.use: to buy flashlights, watches, wallets, and belts.

loans.name: Luis Oscar

texts.es: Luis es un veterano de mil batallas que desde muy joven, tuvo que abandonar sus estudios en busca de un sustento para su hogar, ya que su estado económico no era el mejor y requería que el hombre de la familia saliera a buscar un alimento en su casa, inexperto pero con ganas de salir hacer las cosas de la mejor manera, salió una mañana junto con su primo quien era un pintor de fachadas, interiores entre otros, aprender del oficio. Poco a poco Luis iba adquiriendo experiencia y comenzó hacer sus propios trabajos, quería ser independiente demostrar que era una persona auto-suficiente sin olvidar a quien le debe lo que es hoy en día, un reconocido pintor en su pueblo cabe aclarar. Luis ya realizaba acabados, pintaba interiores entre otras cosas y se comenzó en la fabricación de pinturas, específicamente bases para manera o arreglos florales, solicita un micro-crédito para la compra de un compresor que le ayude y le facilite el desarrollo y creación de este producto el cual le traerá un cambio radical en su trabajo pues tendrá lo tan esencial y elemental para cualquier tipo de empresa; un material de trabajo que hoy en día carece de este por falta de capital. Luis tiene un sueño y es generar trabajo, poder aportar un grano de arena en su pueblo, este sueño tan humilde y sencillo, un sueño que caracteriza la buena cultura colombiana de ayudar a su semejante como tantas veces  lo repiten las citas bíblicas.
texts.en:
Luis is a battle-hardened veteran who had to abandon his education at a young age in order to support his household.  His financial situation was not the best and required a head of household to go out in search of food to put on the table.  With no previous experience but a determination to do things as well as he could, one morning he went out with his cousin who was a painter of inside and outside walls, so he could learn the trade.

Little by little, Luis acquired experience and began doing his own jobs.  He wanted to be independent and prove that he was self-sufficient without forgetting who helped him become who he is today, a well-known painter in his village.  Luis already worked on finishings and interior paint jobs, among other things, when he began making his own paints, especially base coats for floral arrangements or designs.

He is requesting a mini-loan to buy a compressor to help develop and create this type of product which will bring a radical change to his work, since he will have the most basic equipment for any type of company: working equipment which he does not have now because of a lack of capital.

His goal is to generate employment and give back to his community.  It is a dream so humble and simple, but which characterizes the fine Colombian culture of wanting to help one another as much as the Bible says.

loans.use: To buy a paint compressor.

loans.name: Bienvenida Milda

texts.es:
Con mas de 30 años de experiencia, Bienvenida se dedica a la cria de aves de corral (pollos) para venderlos a las tiendas del pueblo.
Bienvenida vive en una comunidad de la parroquia borbon, donde por su ubicacion es facil dedicarse a la cria de aves de corral. 
ella vive con su esposo, una de sus hijas, su yerno y un nieto de 5 años que va regularmente a la escuela.
ella comprara 100 nuevos pollos y su respectivo alimento, para crecer en las ventas de aves y posteriormente, acondicionar el lugar y abrir la posibilidad de generar empleo a los jovenes de su comunidad.
Bienvenida se considera una mujer muy activa en procesos de desarrollo de su comunidad, le gusta compartir momentos de cultura con los niños y jovenes de las escuelas y colegios.
ella quiere tener un galpon mas grande y tener muchos pollos para la venta.
texts.en:
With over 30 years of experience, Bienvenida raises poultry (chickens) to sell at the stores in the village.  Bienvenida lives in a community in the Borbon parish.  Due to her location, it is easy to raise poultry.  She lives with her husband, one of her daughters, her son-in-law, and a five year old grandson who goes to school.

She will buy 100 new chickens and feed for them.  She will do this in order for her bird sales to grow and to later upgrade the place.  This will lead to the possibility of generating employment for young people in her community.

Bienvenida is considered to be a woman who is very active in the development process of her community.  She likes sharing cultural moments with the children and young people from schools.

She wishes to have a bigger chicken coop and to have a lot more chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens, balanced feed, and vitamins for birds.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
JULIO  es un morador de un recinto muy pobre de Borbon, donde todos viven de la agricultura, julio tiene 20 años y es quien trabaja para llevar el sustento a casa de sus ancianos padres, quienes viven con el y con su esposa.
desde niño, ha deseado ser comerciante mayoritario de cacao seco de aroma.
el compra este cacao en baba y dia a dia lo seca con el sol, cuando ya esta seco, vende una parte y la otra la procesa y vende como pasta para la la elaboracion de chocolate casero.
con estas ventas, sustenta a su familia y pagara las letras del credito.
texts.en: Julio lives in a very poor precinct of Borbon, where everyone makes a living from agriculture. He is 20 years old and is the one who works to put food on the table for his elderly parents, who live with him and his wife. Since he was a child, he has wanted to be a wholesale trader of dry aromatic cocoa. He buys this cocoa as fresh pulp and dries it day by day in the sun. When it is dry, he sells part of it, and processes and sells the rest as paste for making homemade chocolate. With these sales, he supports his family and will make his loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy cocoa

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 22 años, tiene un hijo de 1 año a quien le agradece su felicidad, martha se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo masivo en su tienda de alimentos, donde invertira este credito, comprando : frejol, lenteja, fideos, leche, arroz, azucar y otros productos que nesecite para su tienda.
Martha fué abandonada por el padre de su hijo hace casi un año y desde entonces penso en un negocio que le ayudara a solventar los gastos de ella y su pequeño hijo.
su tienda esta hubicada en un buen sector ya que son pocas las tiendas en la comunidad donde ella vive.
Martha espera con este prestamo, surtir mas su tienda y ofrecer a sus vecinos mas productos.
ella esta convencida que en 5 años tendra una casa propia donde vivir con su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha is a 22 year old woman. She has a one year old son who appreciates her happiness. Martha is dedicated to selling consumable products in her grocery store where she will invest this loan buying beans, lentils, noodles, milk, rice, sugar and other products that she needs for her shop. Martha was abandoned by her son's father about a year ago and since then she thought the business would help her pay her bills and for her small son.

Her shop is located in a good area since there are few shops in the community where she lives. Martha hopes, with this loan, to stock her store more and offer her neighbors more products. She is convinced that in five years she will have her own house where she can live with her son.

loans.use: to buy beans, lentils, rice, sugar, noodles, oils.

loans.name: Mayra Isabel

texts.es: Mayra es una señora que le gusta luchar por su familia, ella tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo que es chofer y sus 4 hijos de 16, 14, 10 y 8 años de los cuales 2 asisten a la escuela y 2 al colegio, Mayra se dedica a vender jugos en el mercado de su localidad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, leche, pastas, buñuelos y para pagar del arriendo del puesto, comenta que le va bien en este negocio y que ella se esfuerza para sacar a sus hijos adelante y que si le gustaría verles en un futuro hechos todo unos profesionales.
texts.en: Mayra is a woman who likes to work hard for her family. She is 34 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a driver, and their four children, ages 16, 14, 10, and 8, of whom two are in secondary school and two in primary. Mayra sells juices in the local market. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of fruits, milk, pastes, and doughnuts and in paying the rent for her stall. She comments that it is going well for her in this business, that she is striving to raise her children, and that in the future she would like to see them all become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo, 2 hijos y 2 hijas en la via a Esmeraldas, ella se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos. el presente credito sera utilizado para la compra de cerdos y comida para cerdos, sus hijos sueñan con ser asafata, administradora de empresas,mecanico y policia. ella se dedica mucho a su familia y a sus animalitos, los cuales vendera en poco tiempo y comprara mas con las ganacias.
este credito sera de mucha utilidad ya que por falta de capital no se podia trabajar en este sector y la banca tradicional no brinda las facilidades de credito como lo hace FODEMI y KIVA.
desde ya se agradece por el apoyo que se da a traves de estas organizaciones.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old. She lives with her husband, her two sons, and her two daughters along the road going to Esmeraldas.

Margarita raises and sells pigs. This current loan will be used to buy pigs and food for their diet.

Her children dream of becoming a flight attendant, a business manager, a mechanic, and a police officer. Margarita is very devoted to her family and to her animals. She sells a few animals at a time and will buy more with her profits.

This loan will be very useful since she lacks the capital that is required for this type of work. A traditional bank would not provide the same type of credit services offered by FODEMI and Kiva. Margarita is grateful for the support that has been given by these two organizations.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Sonia Liliana

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 años y la otra de 12 años que asisten a la escuela, Sonia se dedica a  criar  ganado desde hace 8 años, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para incrementar su negocio ya que le va bien en este negocio porque les cuida con adecuadamente a su ganado, su esposo se dedica a trabajar de chofer, Sonia aspira que su dos hijos estudien para que saquen un título profesional y tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en: Sonia is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children, one is 6 and the other is 12, they both go to school. Sonia has been breeding animals for 8 years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of a cow to increase her business as it is going well because she takes care of her livestock adequately. Her husband works as a driver. Sonia wishes that her 2 children study so that they have a professional degree and have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Aida Rita

texts.es: Aida es una señora responsable y cuidadosa, es soltera con 2 hijos pequeños a quienes cuida y apoya  como toda madre que adora a su familia, esta señora trabaja como conserje en un organismo de desarrollo social en la zona donde vive, del cual tiene 10 años de laborar, actualmente está solicitando el primer financiamiento que utilizaría en la Compra de Litera y colchón, el que le vendrá a dar mejores comodidades a su familia
texts.en:
Aida is a responsible and caring woman. She is single with two small children who she takes care of and supports like all mothers who love their families. She works as a caretaker at a social development organization near where she lives. She has worked there for ten years.

Currently, she is requesting her first loan, which she will use to buy a bunk bed and mattress, which will provide better comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy a bunk bed and mattress.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer activa en sus gestiones familiares, preocupada por el bienestar de su familia, es casada con 2 hijos a su cargo a los que apoya para su desarrollo académico, actualmente se desempeña como subdirectora de un núcleo educativo rural de la zona donde vive, esta señora está presentando un problema  por motivos de salud y educación, de cancelar unas obligaciones pendientes, por esa razón visito ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y resolver esa necesidad, dicho financiamiento le vendría a oxigenarse de manera emocional y económica ya que en este caso le permite abonar de acuerdo a sus condiciones económicas y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an active woman in her familial duties; she is worried for the well-being of her family. She is married with 2 children under her care that she supports in their academic development.  She is currently employed as a vice-principal of a rural education center in the zone where she lives. 

This lady is presenting a problem due to reasons of health and education, of canceling one of her pending obligations, for this reason she came to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan and to resolve that necessity.  Said loan, will come to relieve her emotionally and economically since in this case it will permit her to pay according to her economic conditions and in this manner improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her credit card debt for medical and school expenses

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 34 ans, Madame ASSETOU est mariée et mère de 4 enfants  résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et ses enfants à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Madame ASSETOU après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, elle s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente d'huiles alimentaires et des spaghettis depuis plus de deux  ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits qui sont achetés en gros et les revendre en détail. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux  ans, elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel et  les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Vue son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame ASSETOU vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce cinquième prêt 10 bidons d'huile et 10 cartons de spaghettis de qualités différentes auprès des grossistes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Assetou is married and a mother of four children. She lives in a large, traditional extended family with her husband and children in Kaboïla II, one of the popular neighborhoods in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Assetou, after having tried many types of work without success, started buying and selling edible oils and spaghetti more than two years ago. She runs this business from her home. She is highly sought after for her quality products, which she buys at wholesale and then resells at retail.

To satisfy her customers, who continue to grow in number, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. She is now on her fifth individual loan, and all her previous loans have been repaid correctly.

With her experience in this business, Assetou sells her goods for cash and credit to generally female customers. With this fifth loan, she plans to buy 10 cans of oil and 10 boxes of spaghetti of different quality from wholesalers. She hopes to earn an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which she will use to increase her business funds, help with her family's expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy oil and spaghetti

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages Polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Wassa ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali)   et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de kalaban coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures, légumes, boissons et œufs. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs commerces, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 paires de chaussures de tous les âges à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-Coro et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
For the most part married in polygamous households, the four members of the group Wassa average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the seat of the Commune, in Cercle de Kati (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members known one another through ties of kinship, friendship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban Coro market. And they work in small-scale commerce selling plastic shoes (men’s and women’s) of all sizes, vegetables, beverages, and eggs. 

With the goal of increasing their commerce, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Awa (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of plastic shoes (men’s and women’s) of all sizes. She intends to use her loan to purchase 200 pairs of shoes for all ages in Bamako. The sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kalaban-Coro and by going door to door. 

With this loan, Ms. Awa is planning on an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting the various needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes

loans.name: Milena Merarda

texts.es:
Milena es una señora esforzada, de profesión Licenciada en Biología y se desempeña como maestra de educación  secundaria de un colegio de la comunidad donde vive,  con 22 años de laborar, es soltera con una hija a quien apoya para sus estudios universitarios.
Esta señora visito a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: Playcen, Plywood, reglas, clavos y mano de obra.
Con los que realizara las mejoras como son el mejoramiento del techo y cielo raso, siendo este el primer crédito recibido el que le permitirá realizar la obra tan deseada y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Milena is a zealous woman who has a degree in biology and works as a secondary school teacher at a school in the community where she lives. With 22 years of working experience, she is a single mother with a daughter, who she helps support to go to university.

Milena visited Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials such as Playcen, plywood, rulers, nails, and to pay for labor.

With these materials, she will make improvements to the roof and level the ceiling. This is her first loan, which will allow her to complete the work she needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as Playcen, plywood, rulers, nails, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal el Triunfo está conformado por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos hombres, madres y  padres responsables, con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Dora y  tiene por actividad económica el servicio de bar y restaurante en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica  a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: carne, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, tomates, pepino, gaseosas, jugos naturales, para la preparacion de ricos platos caseros de comida y tener varidad y agradar a sus clients para  que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El triunfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Triunfo" is comprised of nine members, seven women and two men.  The are responsible mothers and fathers, with fifteen children under their care. They are originally from Malpaisillo which is located in the north of the region and are characterized by being hardworking, responsible, wanting to improve themselves.

Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources, they could not pursue a career and saw the need to work to help with household expenses. Today, they struggle every day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed, Dora is the coordinator and her business is running a bar and restaurant in her home. She devotes to her business about twelve hours daily offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business for the purchase and sale of food products such as meat, rice, beans, sugar, tomatoes, cucumber, soft drinks, fresh juices, and homemade a variety of homemade dishes to please her clients so that in the near future she will have better income. El Triunfo is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva investors provide for poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua so as to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her bar and restaurant business with edible products such as meat, rice, beans, sugar, tomatoes, cucumber, soft drinks and fruit juices.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Las asociación comunal  los Ángeles está conformada por trece integrantes diez mujeres y tres hombres, cabezas de familias, responsables de veinte hijos. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado  en la zona de norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar a temprana edad. en la actualidad luchan día a día para bríndales un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Ramona y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, azúcar, detergente, maíz, galletas, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Los Ángeles agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Los Ángeles” consists of 13 members, 10 women and 3 men. They are the heads of their households and are responsible for 20 children among them. The members are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study for a degree and were obligated to work at an early age. At the moment, they strive each day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to move forward, Ramona was appointed the group coordinator. Her business is a small store where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, beans, detergent, corn, cookies, and juices. She devotes about 12 hours a day to her business by offering her products. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “Los Ángeles” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Barra

texts.fr:
Barra est un jeune homme ambitieux, qui évolue dans le secteur du carrelage de bâtiments depuis plus de 10 ans. Il a d’abord pris le temps d’apprendre le métier pendant des années en accompagnant son patron dans les chantiers qu’il allait exécuter. Au bout de quelques temps et avec l’appui de l’IMCEC, il a pu avoir un fond pour démarrer un commerce de carreaux. Il achète des carreaux pour le revendre ; et quand il a un chantier, il utilise son produit pour le vendre à celui à qui appartiennent les travaux. 
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, Barra peut payer sa location et augmenter son stock de marchandises. Il a   aussi pu acheter un terrain. L’ambition de Barra, est d’ouvrir son propre magasin de vente de carreaux, voire voyager et aller acheter le produit lui-même.
texts.en:
Barra is an ambitious young man who has been laying tile in buildings for more than 10 years. He took time to learn the profession, accompanying his boss to construction sites for several years. After a while, with the support of UIMCEC, he had a base on which to build a tile business. He purchases tile for resale and, when he [is working on] a construction site, he sells his products to the site manager.

With the profits, Barra can pay his rent and increase its stock of goods. He was also able to buy land. Barra's ambition allows his to open his own shop selling tiles, and even travel to go buy products himself.

loans.use: To purchase tile to sell to construction sites.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catherine is 27 years old and has one child, who is currently in school.

Catherine has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Catherine requested a 11,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Catherine has been in this business for 2 years. Catherine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Meet Grace, 52, a farmer with 20 years’ experience in farming. She lives together with her daughter in Murang’a, Central Kenya. She earns income selling milk and tea produced at her farm.

She is in the business to generate income to take care of her family. Capital is her biggest challenge so far. She spends a lot of time attending to her dairy cow named Muiru.

She came to learn the importance of taking loans to boost business through Juhudi's training sessions.

Grace is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. These inputs are essential for the success of the crops. Grace strives to make more income to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Marthe Marie

texts.fr: Marthe Marie est une  femme de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 20 et 31 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a également à sa charge une autre personne. Elle fait la teinture à son domicile des vêtements de toutes sortes qu'elle revend depuis 11 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne à merveille grâce à la bonne qualité de ses services et à son expérience dans ce domaine elle a acquise une clientèle considérable.Mais le souci est qu'elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de cette clientèle à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter les produits en détails pour satisfaire une vague et attendre qu'elle soit payée par celle-ci pour pouvoir satisfaire l'autre vague. D'où la nécessité de ce crédit qui l'aidera à acheter son matériel en gros pour travailler et lui permettra de satisfaire toute sa clientèle,d'augmenter ses bénéfices.Elle économisera une partie de ce profit pour ouvrir une boutique avec le temps et l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marthe Marie is a 54-year-old woman. She is married and has four children between the ages of twenty and thirty-one. Three of her children are still in the school system. She also takes care of another person.

For eleven years already, she has been dying all sort of clothes from home to resell. Her business has been doing wonderfully: thanks to the high quality of her services and her experience, she has acquired a sizable clientele. Unfortunately however, she doesn't manage to meet the demand from her clients because of her small working capital, which forces her to buy retail products so as to satisfy one wave of clients, then to wait to be paid by them to be able to go on to the next wave.

This loan is therefore necessary to help her buy wholesale supplies, which will allow her to work, satisfy her clientele, and increase profits. She will save part of the profits to open a store in time, and the rest will help her deal with the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fabrics and dyes.

loans.name: Jazmin

texts.es:
Jazmin está estudiando y quiere poder terminar su carrera para ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, que le abrirá las puertas.
Desde pequeña ella se ha sacrificado y está mejorando bastante gracias al esfuerzo que está haciendo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Jazmin is studying and wants to finish her degree so that she can help her family and loved ones. She is studying for a degree in Business Administration, which will open doors for her.

Jazmin has made sacrifices from a young age and is improving thanks to the efforts she has made. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es:
El  Tule Sur está conformado por ocho integrantes, madres solteras con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron  obligadas  a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Nidia tiene por actividad económica una  pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El Tule Sur agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The El Tule Sur group is made up of eight members, single mothers who have five children under their care. They are originally from Sauce, a place which is located in the northern area of the region. These members are characterized as being hardworking, responsible and with a keen desire to better themselves. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to pursue a degree and were forced to work from a young age to help with the family's outgoings. They are currently fighting every day to give their children a better future.

Thanks to her effort, and her desire to get ahead in life, the coordinator [Nidia] runs a grocery store as her source of income. It is a small store which sells food stuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs juice and fizzy drinks. She spends around 12 hours every day in the store selling her goods so that in the not-so-distant future, she can have a better income. The El Tule Sur group is grateful for the help that the Kiva loan lenders are giving people with scarce resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and provide the business in the purchase and sale of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, break, eggs, juice and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Ivania Lissette

texts.es:
Ivania es una mujer ejemplar preocupada por la salud de los demás principalmente de los niños, de profesión médico pediatra, labora en un centro  de salud  del poblado donde vive,  con 11 años de ejercer dicha labor, es casada   con 1 hijo al que le da el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, esta señora tiene una necesidad de mejorar su baño por eso llego a las oficinas  de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica, inodoro, lava mano, arena, gabinetes y mano de obra.
Para efectuar dicha obra la que le permitirá crear mejores condiciones familiares.
texts.en: Ivania is an exemplary woman who is concerned with the health of others, in particular children's health.  Professionally, she is a pediatrician.  She works in the town health center where she lives, and has worked in this profession for eleven years.  Ivania is married and has one son.  She gives him the support he needs to grow and develop.  This lady needs to improve her bathroom, which is why she came to the Ceprodel offices.  She is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement, ceramic tile, a toilet, a sink, sand and cabinets and to pay for labor. Getting this work done will create better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, ceramic tile, a toilet, a sink, sand and cabinets and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Guadalupe Concepcion

texts.es: Guadalupe de 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; Guadalupe es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, ella tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 56 years old and earns a living selling clothes. Being in this business for many years has given her much experience which allows her to earn higher profits. The business is located in her home. She has many customers because people know that it is all high quality, affordable and with unparalleled service always to the order and the preferences of the customer.

Guadalupe is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her job and hard working. She puts in the maximum effort day in and day out in order to have a better life and be a great success in the future. In the past few weeks the demand has increased and she wants to take advantage with a new investment but does not possess sufficient capital to back it. 

This is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to purchase clothes wholesale. She has good payment references and high moral character. She affirms that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time hopes to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Atignon

texts.fr: Afin de louer une boutique pour son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Mr Atignon sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des appareils électroniques(ampli, portables...). Le gain tiré de la vente lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Il a démarré son activité en 2008 et s'approvisionne généralement dans la zone portuaire. Père de famille avec 02 enfants en charge, il est âgé de 35ans.
texts.en:
Atignon started his business in 2008 and generally purchases his supplies from the harbor district. A father with two dependent children, Atignon is 35 years old.

In order to rent a shop for his business and to meet the needs of his family, Atignon is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase electronics (amplifiers, cell phones...). The income he earns from his sales will allow him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase electronics (amplifiers, cell phones, radios...).

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a upholstery business in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 52 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos que ya son independientes. Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 25 años, inicio vendiendo ropa y después decidió fabricarla. Los últimos 10 años, se ha dedicado a fabricar ropa para mascotas, para complementar sus ingresos también vende electrodomésticos.
Gabriela esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar más tela, cierres, hilos para la fabricación de ropa para mascotas que despúes vende por mayoreo y menudeo. También fabrica disfraces para los festivales de las escuelas.
Ella dice que gracias a su trabajo ha logrado crecer su negocio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 52 years old, widowed, and has five children who are independent. She has been a merchant for 25 years. Gabriela started out selling clothes, but later on she decided to make them. For the past 10 years, she has been producing pet clothes. In order to supplement her income, she also sells household appliances.

Gabriela is requesting a loan in order to buy more fabric, zippers, and thread for making pet clothes, which she will then sell wholesale or at retail price. She also makes costumes for school festivals.

Thanks to the work she has accomplished, Gabriela says that she has been able to grow her business and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, and thread for making pet clothes.

loans.name: Wetisa

texts.en:
Wetisa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wetisa is 65 years old and her six children are in school.

Wetisa has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials, like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc., for her business.

Wetisa has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials, like shells, wire and nylon thread, for her business.

loans.name: Kaslum

texts.en:
Kaslum is a 55-year-old mother of seven children. While she completed only the ninth grade, she has always been determined to move her family forward. She has a successful falafel stand. She is known for her excellent items, fresh salads and wonderful taste. Kaslum wants to open a café area within her falafel stand.

She needed this loan to invest in a professional coffee maker, juicer and materials.

Kaslum wants the expansion to succeed and wants to add baked items in the café. She wants to invest in her children’s and grandchildren’s education, specifically the girls. She wants to make sure all of them complete school and go on to college and not have anyone have to drop out like she had to when she was in school.

loans.use: to invest in a professional coffee maker, juicer and materials.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Geraldine has been in this business for two years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Reymunda Juliana

texts.es: La señora Reymunda  es madre soltera y comerciante en el ramo de venta de ropa de toda categoría y tallas. Es una señora emprendedora, con la cual ha formado a sus hijos, bajos sus esfuerzos, ha logrado formarlos hasta su independencia,   Desde que inició su negocio, la Señora Reymunda desde hace varios años que ejerce esta actividad comercial, ha logrado mantener la línea de mercado ya que sus ventas son ambulantes, donde ella visita la zona y donde tiene su clientela cautiva en su actividad, la necesidad de doña Reymunda es de  mejorar su vivienda, como es el cambio de techo  y repello de la misma., por eso tomo la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento, y poder lograr el objetivo percibido el que utilizará para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc , cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. Esta señora se encuentra muy agradecida con nuestra institución, ya que con este financiamiento es el número 8, donde las cuales  les han servido para ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reymunda is a single mother and a merchant in the area of selling clothes of all categories and sizes. She is an enterprising lady, which is how she raised her children. Through her efforts she managed to raise them till their independence.  Since she started her business, Mrs. Reymunda has for various years worked in this commercial activity. She has been able to maintain the sales line since she is a street vendor, where she visits the zone and where she has her captive clientele in her activity. 

Mrs. Reymunda’s necessity is to improve her house, for example to change the roof and the plaster. That is why she made the decision to visit Ceprodel to get a loan and be able to achieve her perceived objective which she will use to buy construction materials like zinc, cement, sand, and to pay the manual labour. 

This lady is very thankful with our institution, since with this loan it will be number 8, all of which have helped her in improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like zinc, cement, sand, and to pay the manual labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as: bricks, cement, sand and iron and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Beatriz Elisa

texts.es: La señora Beatriz tiene 29 años, casada tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 9, 11 y 5 años,  ella se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado lechero como también gallinas  para la venta de leche, queso y huevo, ella vive en la zona de Villa Salome, este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Beatriz va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado lechero mejorado para tener una mejor producción de leche,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la producción de leche, la señora Beatriz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, la señora Beatriz va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y para compra de forraje para su ganado, la señora Beatriz desea para su negocio crecer en la producción d queso y venta de leche.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz is 29 years old, married, and has three children (ages 9, 11, and 5). She raises dairy cows in order to sell milk and cheese. Beatriz also raises hens for producing eggs to sell.

She lives in the District of Villa Salome. This is the first loan she has requested from Emprender. Sra. Beatriz will use the loan to buy a dairy cow so that she can have better milk production. Her reason for requesting this loan is because she wants to improve milk production.

Sra. Beatriz faces challenges, such as improving her business and achieving a better quality of life. She will utilize the benefits of increased profits by purchasing fodder for her cows. Sra. Beatriz wants to grow her business by producing and selling more milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with two children. She is 36 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for eight years. 

Janeth requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, noodles, cereals, etc., to sell.

Alma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, noodles, cereals, etc.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, noodles, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for five years. She also earns additional income from vegetable and charcoal vending.

Cristina requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with three children. She is 35 years old and her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Conchita has a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. She requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber for resale.

Conchita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber for resale.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Melodina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, snack foods, and canned goods. 

Melodina requested an 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stock like bread, coffee, sugar, snack foods, and canned goods to sell.

In the future, Melodina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like bread, coffee, sugar, snack foods, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Tibursia

texts.en:
Tibursia is 60 years old and the widowed mother of six children, one of whom is in school. 

Tibursia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tibursia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tibursia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Genette

texts.en:
Genette works hard to support her family. She is married and has a peanut vending business in the Philippines.

Genette requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more peanuts and seasonings for her business. She has been in this business for five years now.

Genette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and seasonings for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
