Gina is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Gina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 61 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. 

Angeles requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock for resale. She has been buying and selling livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Angeles would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Peniel (2) Group

texts.en:
Virginie is a single mother who has her own pastry-making business. She makes French treats, such as madeleines, cakes and brioches, and also sells homemade juices. As part of the community bank group PENIEL (2), Virginie wants to take a loan of 250,000 CFAs ($500) to purchase additional ingredients with which to make pastries, such as milk, sugar and flour. 

Leading a sub-group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Congo, Virginie is currently on her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She hopes to start traveling in the future to other countries like Côte d’Ivoire and Senegal, to purchase goods there and then sell them in Brazzaville. Virginie also has big dreams for her 17-year-old son and wants to help him finish is BAC and then continue his studies abroad.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, and sugar for her pastry-making business.

loans.name: Peniel (1) Group

texts.en:
Françoise is a member of the group PENIEL (1) and has a small business selling drinks in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. A mother of three, Françoise hopes to grow her business by taking out a loan of 300,00 CFA ($600) to purchase chairs and umbrellas so her clients can relax while they have a drink. Françoise is a savvy businesswoman who draws in her clients by providing a television for them to watch or music to listen to.

Helping lead a sub-group of ten other micro-entrepreneurs, Françoise is currently on her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. In the future, she dreams of being able to take a trip abroad and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and umbrellas for her drink stand.

loans.name: Divinite (1) Group

texts.en:
Bernice is the mother of two children, ages seven and five years old, and she owns a small stand selling food, fruits and vegetables. Price fluctuations in the markets of Brazzaville, Republic of Congo, where Bernice lives, are a common problem. Bernice hopes to combat these challenges by reinforcing her stock, purchasing water and juice in bulk, containers of oil and dried fish. 

In order to do this, Bernice wants to take out a loan of 400,000 CFA ($800) from HOPE Congo. She is a member of the community bank group called DIVINITE (1) at HOPE Congo and helps lead a smaller group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs. 

In the future, Bernice hopes to move on from her small shop to sell food goods in bulk, open a butcher’s shop and even dreams of expanding to open a drink stand and perfume shop. Through improving and expanding her business, Bernice hopes to have enough money to buy her own piece of land on which to build her family a home and even purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase water and juice in bulk, containers of oil and dried fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Divinite (2) Group

texts.en:
Edith is a member of the group DIVINITE (2), and leads a group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. Edith sells charcoal for a living and wants to use a 200,000 CFA ($400) loan from HOPE Congo to purchase additional bags of coal to sell at the market. By purchasing in bulk, she will be able to avoid coal shortages and increase her savings.

Edith dreams of being able to start a new business - selling clothing she purchases on business trips. In addition to starting this new clothing business, Edith hopes to save enough for a vacation to another country.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of coal to sell at the market.

loans.name: Ma Foi (1) Group

texts.en: Audrey leads a group of seven micro-entrepreneurs in the group MA FOI (1). A mother of three with two of her children still in school, Audrey sells cookies, candy and homemade cold sweet drinks. Now on her fifth loan cycle with HOPE, Audrey plans to use this loan of 200,000 CFA to purchase additional cookies, candy, flavoring for her drinks and sugar to create her products. In the future, she would like to open a butcher’s shop and dreams of being able to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase items for her stall, including cookies, candy, flavoring and sugar.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Meet George, a father of two who has been practicing farming for the last seven years. He lives with his family on family-owned land in Murang’a, Kenya. 

George grows food crops for a living. He also ventures into other small businesses for extra earnings and keeps a cow he named ‘Kimani.' He faces the challenge of marketing his farm produce. 

George joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinancier that provides both training and financing to smallholder rural farmers. He learned about loan management during the training sessions. 

He is now seeking financing for farm implements from Kiva donors to make his work in the field easier. With your loan, George will be able to tackle the high farm inputs expenses that are beyond his abilities at the moment. This is the only thing standing in the way for him to achieve quality yields. 

With the additional income from the loan, George will comfortably complete his loan repayments. He wants to improve the standards of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo thanks the Kiva lenders for contributing towards his previous loan. His profits increased with the loan because he was able to buy plantains cheaply in bulk and this helped his to make more profits and also to pay the loan on time. He is applying for another loan in order to buy more plantains, since he now has customers in the city. He is hard working and looks forward to strengthening the partnership.

loans.use: to buy plantains for resale.

loans.name: Ma Foi (2) Group

texts.en: Marianne is a member of the group MA FOI (2), which stands for My Faith, and is the leader of a group consisting of seven other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. At 63 years old, Marianne is currently on her third loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She has three children and also supports two grandsons, who live with her, through her market stall selling vegetables, fruit and other food. Marianne has been selling in the market for ten years and is well acquainted with the difficulties of sudden changes in price, but manages to draw in clients by continuing to be warm and welcoming. With this loan of 200,000 CFA, Marianne will purchase additional dried fish, corn and other vegetables to sell. Eventually Marianne hopes to be able to build a house on a small piece of land and help send her grandchildren to study in Canada.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish, corn and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean his 1500 cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plumbing supplies and pay for labor to modernize the water system in her home.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is 36 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of spices and vegetables to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and married with ten children. With six children currently in school, Juana works very hard to provide for them.

Juana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise, like shampoo, coffee, soft drinks, sugar and detergent soap, to sell at her store.

Juana has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, coffee, soft drinks, sugar, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Juana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, like shampoo, coffee, soft drinks, sugar and detergent soap, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Veronica has a hammock-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business.

Veronica has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her hammock-making business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a 12,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Catalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dedita

texts.en:
Dedita is a married woman with three children. She is 53 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. 

Dedita requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the university studies of his daughter: monthly fees, lodging, food, transportation, and school supplies

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: María es una señora dedicada al desarrollo de su hogar, de profesión licenciada en español, se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria en un instituto de la zona donde vive, con 16 años de laborar, es soltera con una hija ya independiente, esta señora quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio por la época de semana santa, por ese motivo visito ceprodel para solicitar  financiamiento el que invertiría en la Compra de productos como: arroz, pollo, frijol, jabón xtra, semolina, aceite, cigarros, azúcar, huevos, pan, gaseosas, papel higiénico, para incrementar el inventario existente y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en la zona, lo que le vendría a tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is a woman dedicated to the growth of her home. She is a teacher of Spanish and works as a teacher in a high school in the zone where she lives. With 16 years of teaching, she is single with a grown daughter. This woman wants to take advantage of the opportunity for business during the Easter Holy Week, so she visited Ceprodel to seek financing that she will invest in the purchase of products such as rice, chicken, beans, soap, ground wheat, oil, cigarettes, sugar, eggs, bread, soda pop, and toilet paper in order to increase her existing inventory and meet the demands of her customers. These increased sales will enable her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, chicken, beans, soap, ground wheat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jioconda Esperanza

texts.es: Jioconda es una señora luchadora, es viuda con 1 hijo al que está apoyando en sus estudios, esta señora tiene un negocio de venta de frijoles cocidos y venta de leña, con 10 años de ejercerlo y tener una clientela cautiva por la calidad y comodidad del producto, esta señora se presento a ceprodel para solicitar crédito para la Compra de 13 qq de frijoles y 11 viajes de  leña, en esta fecha antes que entre el invierno por la afectación de los caminos de acceso de traslado del producto, y almacenar para no caer en el encarecimiento de los mismos, y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jioconda is a hard-working woman. She is a widow with one son who she supports in his schooling. She has a business selling cooked beans and firewood, with 10 years of experience and a steady clientele for her quality and ease of product. She approached Ceprodel to seek a loan to buy 13 quintales of beans and 11 large bundles of firewood prior to the winter impacting the access roads used to move the products, and stocking up so as not to be short of product. With these sales she will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beans and firewood

loans.name: Ginia María

texts.es: La señora Ginia se dedica a laborar como maestra en una comunidad,  atendiendo niños de  preescolar  y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación. Además tiene su propio negocio  como otra alternativa económica  para mejorar sus ingresos .Esta señora  Visito  Ceprodel porque tiene la  necesidad de mejorar su vivienda como es la construcción de un baño y hacer  divisiones de cuartos, y de esa manera crear mejores condiciones en su hogar, dicho financiamiento es el numero 7 y lo utilizara en la compra de materiales de construcción como puertas, ventanas, bloques, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra. Agradeciéndole a  ceprodel por darle la oportunidad de ser beneficiada y lograr subsanar la necesidad prioritaria de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ginia works as a teacher in her community, working with preschool children. Her main concern is educating these children because they are the future of the nation. Also, she has her own business as another source of money to improve her income. She visited Ceprodel because she needs to make improvements to her home by building a bathroom and making room dividers. This will create better living conditions in her home. This is her seventh loan and she will use it to buy construction materials such as doors, windows, blocks, cement, sand, zinc, and to pay for labor. She is grateful to Ceprodel for giving her the opportunity of receiving this loan to make primary improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as doors, windows, blocks, cement, sand, zinc, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Marta Filomena

texts.es: La Señora Marta  preocupada por el estado de su vivienda, se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlin, Cemento, Arena y Mano de Obra, para realizarle mejora al techo de su vivienda el que está en mal estado, y en esta época de invierno no quiere pasar crisis de penetración del agua por no tener las condiciones ideales, ella es maestra de educación primaria de multigrado con 30 años de servicio y labora en un colegio de la zona, es soltera sin hijos a su cargo, debido a esa necesidad se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar crédito y lograr cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en: Señora Marta, worried about the state of her house, presented herself to CEPRODEL to apply for financing that she will use to purchase construction materials such as zinc, purlins, cement, and sand and to pay for labor to make improvements in the roof of her house, which is in bad condition, and in this winter season she doesn't want to experience a crisis of water coming in because she doesn't have ideal conditions. She is a primary teacher for various grades with 30 years of service, and she works at an elementary school in the zone. She is single with no children in her care. Due to this need, she presented herself to the offices of CEPRODEL to apply for the loan and accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials such as zinc, purlins, cement, and sand and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maura María

texts.es:
La Señora Maura María es originaria del municipio san Rafael del sur Nicaragua, es comerciante venta de ropa usada en su casa de habitación tiene un espacio donde coloca su mercadería. 

Es una señora luchadora, mayor de edad, pero le gusta estar siempre entretenida sentirse útil.
 No le gusta depender de nadie, le gusta trabajar y saber que tiene sus propios ingresos para sufragar sus gastos y necesidades del hogar.

Tiene tres hijos mayores de edad casados y le ayudan para su alimentación. Uno de ellos vive en su casa y una nieta.
 Tiene  casa propia pequeña  humilde pero con mucho calor humano.

se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel y kiva por todos los financiamientos que me han brindado y ayudado muchísimo en su crecimiento como comerciante
texts.en: La Señora Maura María is originally from the San Rafael municipality in southern Nicaragua. She has a business selling used clothing from her home where she has a space to show her merchandise. She is an older,  hard-working woman who likes to always enjoyed feeling useful. She doesn't like to be dependent upon anyone. She likes to work and to know that she has her own income to meet her expenses and household needs. She has three grown married sons and they help her with food. One of them lives with her and a grandchild. She has her own small home that is humble yet welcoming. She is thankful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the financing that they have provided her and have helped her very much in her grown as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy various types of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Zoyla Pastora

texts.es:
Zoyla es casada, con 3 hijos a su cargo, y se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la zona donde vive, con 24 años de laborar.
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para  solicitar un financiamiento por que quiere seguir mejorando su vivienda  como es la construcción de un cuarto de habitación y  de esa manera brindar mejores condiciones y  nivel de vida en su hogar. Dicho financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, bloques, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Zoyla is married with three dependent children. She works as a primary school teacher at a school near her place of residence. She has been a teacher for 24 years.

Now, this lady has come to the Ceprodel office to request funding because she wants to continue improving her home by adding a bedroom. In this way she will provide better living conditions and a better standard of living for her household. She will use the funds to purchase construction materials, such as iron bars, blocks, cement and zinc and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as iron bars, blocks, cement and zinc and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Bernarda Del Socorro

texts.es: Bernarda es una señora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es maestra de educación de pre-escolar en un núcleo educativo rural  con 5 años de laborar, mostrando buenas relaciones con los niños y compañeros de trabajo, es madre soltera con 3 hijos a quienes apoya en su desarrollo académico, esta señora tiene la necesidad de construir un cuarto, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar la obra que le dará mejores condiciones a su familia , ya que este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe y le han sido de gran importancia por las condiciones misma que presenta en la actualidad.
texts.en: Bernarda is a woman who wants to improve her living conditions. She is a pre-school teacher in a rural education center with 5 years of experience, demonstrating good relations with the children and her fellow workers. She is a single mother with three children whom she supports in their academic development. This woman needs to construct a room. For this reason, she visited the offices of CEPRODEL to apply for financing and complete the work that will give better conditions to her family. This is the second loan that she is receiving, and they have been of great importance to her because of the same conditions that exist now.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials such as bricks, cement, zinc, iron, a door, and a window and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Daysi Georgina

texts.es: Daysi es una señora enfocada al desarrollo socioeconómico, es maestra de educación de pre-escolar de un núcleo  educativo de la zona donde vive con 24 años de ejercer tan noble labor, también se dedica al alquiler de cuartos a estudiantes universitarios como otro ingreso económico, pero para eso necesita del apoyo de financiamiento, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada para invertirlo en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, ladrillo, arena, piedrín, zinc y perlin, los que le permitirán realizar dicha obra, ya que con este es el segundo crédito que recibe y le han sido de gran importancia en el avance del objetivo perseguido y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida .
texts.en: Daysi is a woman who is focused on socioeconomic development. She is a preschool teacher in an education center in the zone where she lives, with 24 years of doing this noble work. She also rents rooms to university students as another economic income, but to do this she needs financial support. For this, she visited CEPRODEL so that she can invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, iron, bricks, sand, gravel, zinc, and purlins, which will allow her to complete this work. This is the second loan that she is receiving, and they have been of great importance to her in advancing the objective she is pursuing and in this way improving her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials such as cement, iron, bricks, sand, gravel, zinc, and perlins.

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita, age 57, is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with ffour children.  

Lordita joined PMPC, and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability to make delicious food snacks, in order to sell it all out. 

Lordita is now trying to expand her resources, so she decided to engage in swine production. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project, and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000.  

She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. 

In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfy life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Sarah will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Sarah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria Wilma

texts.en:
Maria Wilma is 46 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Wilma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maria Wilma has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with three children; she is 57 years old, and has one child who is still in school. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and  is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes has been in this business for five years. 

Lourdes requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is 60 years old, married, and has 13 children.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Peregrina is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her buying and selling fish business.

With your help, Peregrina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.

 In future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is twenty six years old and has two children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. However, her business and family home were wiped out. Marilyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Marilyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover via her food vending business. With your help, Marilyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jeannisa

texts.en:
Jeannisa works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jeannisa has been in this business for five years now.

Jeannisa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Reina works very hard to provide for them.

Reina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Reina has been in this business for 19 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Reina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
María  es una joven con visión de futuro, soltera, Lic. En administración de empresas y se  desempeña como cajera bancaria con 3 años  de experiencia.
Esta joven se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento que lo utilizara  en la  compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloques, hierro, cemento, perlines, arena, zinc, piedrín y  pago de mano de obra. Para mejorar su cuarto en su casa de habitación, el que ha venido mejorando atravez  de su  salario.
Es importante destacar que por medio  de la realización de esta obra le proporcionara mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a young, single woman with a vision for the future. Having a degree in business administration, she works as a bank cashier with three years of experience.

This young woman came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan in order to purchase construction materials, such as blocks, iron bars, cement, purlins, sand, zinc and gravel and to pay labor costs. She wants to upgrade a room in her home, which she has been gradually improving through her salary.

It is important to emphasize that implementation of this project will provide her with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as blocks, iron bars, cement, purlins, sand, zinc and gravel and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is 62 years old, married, and has nine kids.  Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family.

In 2011, she applied for her membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans on a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 14,900 for additional capital for fish selling. She wants to to buy more kilos of fish to sell. 

She makes use of  teared foam in their fish vending, and hopes to buy new ones. 

Through this project, she believes she can raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business.  Rosa has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business, and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Annabelle has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, juice, etc. 

Annabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is twenty nine years old and married with three children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.  Rosalina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosalina has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosalina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is widowed, and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and works hard to support her family.

Rodelia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

In the future, Rodelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Teonita

texts.en:
Teonita is fifty-seven years old and married with eight children. One child is in school. Teonita works very hard to provide for them.

Teonita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Teonita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Teonita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sabina is 45 years old and has five children who are in school.

Sabina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sabina requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Sabina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sabina would like to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is fifty-two years old and has three children. Romualda is married and has one child who is in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Romualda is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her business buying and selling shells.

With your help, Romualda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María es una señora con vocación de servicio a los demas, de profesión maestra de educación secundaria, actualmente se desempeña como directora de un instituto del sector donde vive, es soltera sin hijos, actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivien da atravez de la construcción  de un cuarto,  por eso se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que  utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, bloque,  cemento, arena, clavos, zinc y mano de obra, ya que atravez de los financiamiento a logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con este financiamiento seria el numero 8 con ceprodel los que han sido de gran utilidad en el desarrollo
texts.en:
Maria is a woman whose vocation is service to others. Her profession is in teaching at the secondary level. Currently she is the principal of an educational institution in the area where she lives. She is unmarried and does not have children.

At present she needs to upgrade her home by adding a room. Consequently she approached Ceprodel to request funding that she will use to purchase construction materials, such as iron bars, blocks, cement, sand, nails and zinc and pay for labor costs. Through previous loans, she has been able to improve her standard of living. This will be her eighth loan from Ceprodel.  

The loans have been very helpful to her progress.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as iron bars, blocks, cement, sand, nails and zinc and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Sherlita will be able to rebuild her devastated life faster.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 4 years.

Jeanilyn requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing  business.  She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing  business.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nanette is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nanette has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nanette requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business.

Nanette has been in this business for four years. In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Dilma

texts.en:
Maria Dilma is forty eight years old, married, and has three children, one of which is in school.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Maria Dilma is taking out a housing loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Maria Dilma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, gravel, anti-corrosive paint, ceramic tile, and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to construct a floor in her home, such as tiles, cement, sand, gravel, wood preservative, and labour.

loans.name: Osduar Francisco

texts.es: El joven Francisco de 22 años de edad, casado, es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, departamento de Chinandega, se caracteriza por ser un joven trabajador, responsable, emprendedor, amante ala labor que realiza, se desempeña como trabajador en el Ministerio de Educación del Municipio San Francisco del Norte, actualmente se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para el pago de aranceles de módulos y optar al titulo que lo acredite como Ing., en Sistemas y así lograr su sueño de ser un profesional
texts.en:
Francisco is 22 years old, married, and a native of the municipality of San Francisco del Norte, department of Chinandega. He is known for being a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising young man who loves the work that he does. He is a worker in the Ministry of Education of the Municipality of San Francisco del Norte.

Currently, he came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan for the payment of unit fees and to go for the degree that he will earn as a Systems Engineer, and in this way achieve his dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay for unit fees in order to go for his degree.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra.  Nubia es casada, tiene 50 años, es originaria municipio de san Rafael del sur Managua, es comerciante tiene ocho años de experiencia,  su negocio es  atendido por ella misma en su casa de habitación, ubicada al oeste del estadio municipal.   Ofrece  una variedad de productos básico en la alimentación diaria,  como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pollo, carnes, queso. Leche, embutidos, entre otros, ha ido creciendo en su negocio  gracias a los financiamientos que ha obtenido de ceprodel y kiva ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado
texts.en: Nubia is married. She is 50 years old and is originally from the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. She is a shop owner with eight years of experience. She looks after her business herself and it is located in her house in the western part of the municipality.  She offers a variety of staple food products, such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, chicken, meat, cheese, milk, and cold meats. Her business has grown thanks to the loans she has obtained from CEPRODEL and Kiva, and she has managed to stay in the market.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, staple food products, cosmetics, soft drinks, and cold meats

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business vending food and vegetable in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients and vegetables to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years. Teresita earns more income from a general store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jocelyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jocelyn has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jocelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Almera

texts.en:
Almera is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Almera is 38 years old and has one child who is in school.

Almera has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines. Almera requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Almera has been in this business for six years. In the future, Almera would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.

She has been in this business for four years now.

Cirila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
The group finally made their payment to MUK on time. We heard many stories from the field. Most of them succeeded in breeding their pigs. The pigs grew well and were free from disease. They sold the pigs for a satisfactory price and the group earned some profit. 

Ni Wayan is raising pigs to fatten. She sold the pigs after managing them for five months. She said thank you to all the lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support. Now she can improve her income and support her husband. Ni Wayan has a dream of renewing her house when she has enough profit to do that. That’s why she's saving now.

After successfully paying off the last loan, they proceeded to the next period with the purpose of improving their businesses. One member already successfully manages her pig business and is continuing with her own money, so she was replaced by a new member. Ni Wayan, head of the group, coordinated the purchase of piglets so that all members got good piglets. With the loan, she bought three of the local species of piglets for pig barbeque ("Babi Guling" in Bahasa), which are sold after two months. From the results of this effort, she hopes to buy floors for her home since the floors are still cement.

loans.use: to buy three local species piglets

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Sameun

texts.en:
Sameun, 31, is married to a humble man and together they have three children who are attending school. They live in a small house located in Ta Lou, Bakan district, Pursat province. Sameun and her husband have inherited a few pieces of land from parents on both sides of the family for subsistence agriculture. They have developed their farm to increase their rice products from year to year. The primary crop of her family is rice, which is harvested and sold in the markets in the province.

Sameun needs this financial support in order to improve water and sanitation for her household. She realizes that these play an important role for healthy living conditions. The loan will be used to dig a pond to ensure an adequate water supply for daily consumption. She is hoping that she won’t face a water shortage in the future or need to spend as much time collecting water from distant areas so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income for her family. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to dig a pond to ensure enough water for daily consumption.

loans.name: Inés Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Inés Carolina, es madre de dos hijos y  labora como docente en un colegio rural desde hace dieciséis años,  sale de su casa de habitación 6:00 inicia sus labores 7:00 am  finalizando  a las 1:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,   Por la tarde  dedica dos hora para la planificación de la clase del día siguiente,  ella  realiza esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.   

Doña Inés Carolina solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para compra bloque, cemento, arena y hierro ya que tenía la necesidad de asegurar su vivienda con la  construcción de una tapia.
texts.en:
Ines Carolina is the mother of two children.  She has been working as a teacher in a rural school for 16 years.  She leaves home at 6:00 am and starts work at 7:00.  She finishes at 13:00, from Monday to Friday.  In the afternoon she spends two hours preparing classes for the following day.  The income she earns allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron which she needs to strengthen the walls in her house and make it safer.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Efrén Gerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Efrén Jerónimo, labora como docente en un colegio  de la ciudad de León desde hace veintitrés años, donde inicia sus labores a las 7:00 am y finaliza a las 1:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, es padre de dos hijos y realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.   

El crédito que solicito Don Efrén  a Ceprodel lo utilizó para la Compra de cemento, arena y cerámica  para remodelación de su vivienda y así darle más comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Efren Jernonimo has been working as a teacher in a school in Leon for 23 years.  He starts work at 7:00 am and finishes at 13:00 pm, from Monday to Friday.  He is the father of two children and his work allows him to provide for his family.

He is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy cement, sand and tiles so that he can refurbish his home and make it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Eveling De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La Señora Eveling de los Ángeles,  labora  en un colegio  de la ciudad de león, desempeñando el cargo de docente, Sale de su casa de habitación a las  12:00 pm  para iniciar sus labores a las 12:30 pm finalizando a las 5:00 pm de lunes a viernes  en este mismo horario,  realiza esta labor para ayudarle a su esposo a los gastos del hogar. Es madre  tres  hijos de los cuales dos son de  edad escolar. 

El crédito que solicito a Ceprodel lo utilizó para la Compra de cemento, bloque, arena y azulejos  para construcción de un baño y así tener mejor comodidad ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Eveling de Los Angeles works as a teacher in a school in Leon.  She leaves home at 12:00 pm to start work at 12:30 pm and finishes at 17:00.  She works from Monday to Friday.  The income she earns allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  She is the mother of three children who are all of school age.

She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy cement, blocks, sand and tiles so that she can build a bathroom and make her home more comfortable for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Augustin, il est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il évolue dans le commerce d’habillements, chaussures, vêtements pour bébé, divers. Elle a démarré en faisant l’ambulant, petit à petit, il a pu ouvrir une cantine et stocker quelques marchandises. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un appui financier afin de pouvoir acheter des chaussures, des ensembles et revendre. Du bénéfice qu’il tire de son activité, il entretient sa famille et épargne petit à petit afin de pouvoir réaliser un jour son vœu le plus cher qui est de construire une grande maison, d’y installer sa famille et y développer son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Augustin. He is 40 years old, married, and the father of three. He works in the commerce of clothing, shoes, baby clothing, and more. He started off by going door to door. Little by little, he was able to open a stall and stock a few goods. 

Augustin is here for the first time to request financial support to be able to purchase some shoes and some outfits to resell. With the profits he makes from this business, he cares for his family and saves a little at a time, so as to realize his most cherished wish, to build a big house one day and settle his family in it, as well as to develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and baby clothing to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with nine children, three of whom are in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of leso (women's wrap) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase leso (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is Fatuma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Neydi Magali

texts.es:
la joven Neydi Magali es originaria del municipio de condega, ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, es una joven felizmente casa y con dos hijos en edad escolar primaria. esta joven reside en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos siendo una persona muy conocida como trabajadora y de buenas relaciones.
Neydi Magali es una maestra de primaria que da clases en una escuela en el área rural de condega a unos 20 km al este del municipio, ella viaja a diario desde muy temprano para impartir sus clases, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso familiar.
Ella se presentó por segunda vez a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para poder comprar láminas de zinc ya que necesita mejorar parte del techo de su vivienda, ya que sus ingresos son muy bajos como para sumir por cuenta propia el gasto.
Ella espera que el crédito le sea aprobado ya que se acerca la época lluviosa y quiere está preparada, de esta manera ella pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida dándole un techo digno a su familia
texts.en:
Neydi Magali is a young woman from the municipality of Condega, about 35km to the north of the city of Estelí. She is happily married and has two children of primary school age. She lives in her own home with her husband and children, and is well known as a hard-working person with good interpersonal relations. 

She is a primary school teacher, and works in a school in the rural part of Condega, around 20km east of the town. She travels there very early every day to give her classes, and this is her family's main source of income. 

Neydi Magali attended the CEPRODEL offices for her second time in order to seek a loan to buy zinc sheets, which she needs to improve part of the roof of her home. Her income is very low and she cannot afford to make the outlay by herself. 

She hopes that she will receive the loan as the rainy season is approaching and she wants to be ready for it. She dreams of improving her family's living conditions by giving them a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: José Reyes

texts.es:
El señor José es comerciante de frutas y verduras como tomates, cebolla, chiltomas, papas, plátanos, melón, sandía, entre otras cosas.
Tiene once años de tener su negocio en el mercado municipal de san Rafael del sur, Managua. Donde obtiene recursos económicos para el sustento de su familia.
Antes de tener su propio negocio se dedicaba a la siembra de maíz y frijoles en su comunidad, y con ahorros propios y espíritu emprendedor puso su propio punto de venta en donde las condiciones de su familia han mejorado.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien también trabaja en su negocio atendiendo a sus clientes.
Su actividad comercial requiere de un préstamo para diversificar los productos que ofrece y de esta manera atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose sells fruit and vegetables, selling tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, potatoes, bananas, melons, watermelons and other things like that.

He has been doing this for 11 years and has his business in the main market in San Rafael del Sur, Managua.  This job allows him to earn an income to support his family.

Before he started his own business, he harvested corn and frijoles beans in his area.  With his own earnings and an enterprising attitude, he set up his own stall and since then, he has been able to improve the standard of living of his family.

He is supported by his partner who also works on the stall and helps him serve the customers.

For his trade, he needs a loan to buy a wider range of products so he can satisfy his customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Mayelquiyahosca

texts.es:
La señora Mayelqui es originaria de San Rafael del sur, Managua, y desde los dieciocho años es comerciante de tortillas suaves y tostadas, la tortilla es un producto a base de maíz que ella misma produce de forma artesanal, y que constituye un producto importante en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Es una joven de veinticuatro años de edad, muy trabajadora, tiene una hija de dos años de edad y es un agente económico en la economía de su hogar.
Necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para comprar maíz, materia prima de primera necesidad para producir la tortilla.
texts.en:
Mayelqui comes from San Rafael del Sur, Managua and she has been making tortillas since she was 18.  Tortillas are made from corn and she makes them herself using traditional methods, providing her customers with one of the staple foods in Nicaragua.

She is 24 and has a two-year-old daughter.  She is very hard-working and contributes to the household expenses.

She needs some funding to buy corn, the principal ingredient she needs to make her tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Dominga De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Dominga es una microempresaria que se dedica a vender granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, verduras y otros productos de consumo.
Con esfuerzo propio y el de su esposo lograron poner su propio negocio en el que ha venido mejorando significativamente, necesitan de una fuente de financiamiento para ampliar su local y ofrecer variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella empieza atender a sus clientes desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Dominga has a small business selling basic grains such as rice, frijoles beans, corn, vegetables and other food products.

Thanks to the effort she has put in and the help of her husband, they have managed to set up their own business, which has been steadily improving.  She needs some funding to expand the shop and to be able to offer a wider variety of products to satisfy customer demand.

She opens for business at 6:00 am and closes at 21:00, working with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Madame Yacine est une dame âgée de 50 ans, qui s’active dans la vente de sel. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Depuis des années, elle travaille en collaboration avec les chercheurs de sel d’un lac pas loin de chez elle. Elle achète le sac à un pris dérisoire qu’elle revend dans le marché. Seulement avant de le commercialiser, elle effectue une opération d’iode pour toute la quantité achetée ; ce qui rendra le prix de vente plus cher que celui d’achat. Yacine appuie dans la gestion des charges de la maison, elle met aussi un peu d’argent de coté pour les imprévus.
Elle veut mettre ses enfants à l’abri du besoin et leur préparer un bel avenir.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacine is a 50-year-old woman who is active in selling salt. She is a married mother. For years, she has worked in collaboration with salt dealers at a lake not far from her home. She buys by the sack at a ridiculous price and resells the salt at the market, except that, before she markets the salt, she treats with iodine the entire purchased amount. And this make the sale price higher than the purchase price. 

Yacine helps to manage household expenses. She also puts aside money for a rainy day. She wants to shelter her children from need and to make a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase salt to resell

loans.name: Xavier Antonio

texts.es:
Don Xavier es un microempresario que tiene seis años de tener una tienda de zapatos de todo tipo en el mercado municipal de san Rafael del sur.
Antes de poner su tienda era vendedor de frutas y verduras, y con ahorros propios tiene la iniciativa de apertura de mercado en zapatos.
Sin embargo necesita comprar un lote de chinelas playeras, y requiere de un préstamo para dar respuesta a la demanda de chinelas.
Es una persona honesta y trabajador.
texts.en:
Xavier is a small-time businessman who has had a shoe shop for six years.  He sells all types of shoes from his stall in the main market of San Rafael del Sur.

Before he set up his shop, he sold fruit and vegetables, and with his own savings and initiative he set up his shoe stall in the market.

However, he needs a loan to buy a selection of beach sandals to satisfy customer demand.

He is an honest and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy beach sandals.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Amadou est un jeune célibataire de 39 ans qui s’active dans la vente de cartes de crédit des différents réseaux qui se trouvent dans le pays, tels que Orange, Tigo, Expresso. Il a démarré cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Amadou, a commencé avec 50 milles et voyant que cela marchait, il veut augmenter la quantité du service qu’il offre.
Amadou est célibataire mais cela ne l’empêche pas d’avoir des responsabilités au sein de la famille car il participe à la dépense quotidienne.
Amadou a comme ambition un jour, de diversifier ses activités et de faire du commerce de divers : denrées alimentaires, alimentation général, si son capital augmente.
texts.en: Amadou is a young man, unmarried, and 39 years old. He is active in selling cards of phone minutes for different networks found in the country such as Orange, Tigo, and Expresso. He started off this business over ten years ago. He began with 50,000 and seeing that it went well, he wants to increase the amount of service he offers. Amadou is unmarried but still has responsibilities within the family, since he helps with day-to-day expenses. His ambition is to diversify his business one day and to do commerce in various goods: provisions and general merchandise, if his capital goes up.

loans.use: to purchase phone minutes cards (Tigo Expresso, Orange) to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and some thread to resell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Marbelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Marbelly es originaria de San Rafael del Sur, Managua, y desde los veintitrés años es comerciante de tortillas suaves y tostadas, la tortilla es un producto a base de maíz que ella misma produce de forma artesanal, y que constituye un producto importante en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Tiene veintiséis años de edad, muy trabajadora,  y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo contribuye para los gastos básicos de su hogar.
Necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para comprar maíz, materia prima de primera necesidad para producir la tortilla.
Su estado civil es acompañado, y su pareja es de oficio agricultor de trigo.
texts.en: Marbelly is from San Rafael del Sur, Managua. Since she was 23 years old she has made and sold tortillas, both soft and toasted. Tortillas are made from maize and are an important part of Nicaraguan food. Marbelly makes them in the traditional way, by hand. She is now 26 years old and is very hard working, and with the effort she puts into her work she is able to contribute to basic household expenses. She lives with her partner, who is a wheat farmer. She needs a loan in order to buy maize, the most important raw material for making tortillas, as well as firewood and a new griddle.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, and a griddle.

loans.name: Sandra Maris

texts.es:
Doña Sandra es originaria de san Rafael del sur, municipio de Managua, es comerciante de venta de pan, producto que ella misma produce de forma artesanal en su casa de habitación.
En la fotografía sale a la par de un horno, en donde es procesado el pan.
Su forma de venta es ambulante en la comunidad donde vive, y el producto que ofrece lo vende rápido por la calidad y el gusto que le da doña Sandra.
Para seguir con esta noble labor, requiere de un préstamo para comprar harina por quintales y de esta forma disminuir el costo de producir pan.
Su esposo es de oficio conductor, y con el trabajo que ambos tienen les ofrecen mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra comes from San Rafael del Sur in the town of Managua.  She sells bread, which she makes herself using traditional methods in her own home.
In the photograph, she appears next to the oven which she makes her bread in.

She sells the bread on the streets in the area she lives and it is in great demand thanks to the quality and taste she gives it.

To continue working in this way, she needs a loan to buy flour in quintals so she can reduce the cost of making the bread.

Her husband is a driver, and together they use their incomes to provide a better standard of living for their children.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Geyli Silvet

texts.es:
Doña Geyli es originaria de san Rafael del sur, municipio de Managua-Nicaragua. Tiene cuatro años de vender granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz y otros productos de consumo.
Su negocio ha mejorado, y sus clientes de igual forma le sugieren variedad de productos, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para diversificar su punto de venta.
Es una mujer esforzada y con deseos de superación personal, capaz de crecer como microempresaria en su comunidad y ser una fuente de inspiración a los demás. 
Antes de tener su negocio trabajo como ama de llave  para un hotel importante de la zona, y con su liquidación laboral fue motivada a poner su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Geyli comes from San Rafael del Sur in the town of Managua, Nicaragua.  She has been selling basic grains such as rice, frijoles beans, corn and other food products for four years.

Her business has improved and her customers are starting to ask for a wider range of products.  Therefore, she needs a loan to increase the variety she offers in her shop.

She puts a lot of effort into her work and is always ready to face up to any challenges.  She is capable of growing as a small-time business owner in her community and be an inspiration to others.

She used to work as a maid in an important local hotel, but she was motivated to start up her own business when she lost her job.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr:
Madame Fama, une femme âgée de 35 ans est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a déjà obtenu deux crédita s à l’IMCEC et vient pour la troisième afin de pouvoir renouveler ses marchandises. Fama s’active dans la vente de tissus, draps de lit, vaisselles ; activité kil a démarrée depuis plus de 10 ans. En ce temps, il n’avait qu’un capital de cent mille francs. Avec le temps, elle a fait des bénéfices et a vu son capital augmenter petit à petit.
Fama appuie son époux dans les charges familiales et l’éducation des enfants. Elle peut désormais épargner et s’occuper de ses petits besoins personnels et tout cela grâce aux fruits de son activité. 
Fama rêve de voyager hors du pays pour aller acheter les produits et la marchandise qu’elle commercialise pour cela, elle aura besoin de l’appui d’une Institution financière qui lui financera les frais du voyage.
texts.en:
Ms. Fama, a 35-year-old woman, is a married mother of seven. She has already had two loans with IMCEC and is here for the third time to be able to renew her merchandise. Fama is active in selling fabrics, bed sheets, plates, and cups. This is a business she started over ten years ago. During this time, she only had 100,000 francs in capital. Over time, she made a profit and saw her capital increase little by little. 

Fama supports her husband in covering family expenses and the children’s education. She can now save money and take care of her personal needs, all this thanks to the fruits of her work.

Fama dreams of traveling abroad to find the products and merchandise she sells. To do so, she will need support from a financial institution which will finance her travel costs.

loans.use: to purchase dishes, cups, fabrics, and bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Lesbia Alejandra

texts.es:
Doña lesbia es originaria de san Rafael del sur, una ciudad del pacifico de Nicaragua, su negocio consiste en producir tortillas, un producto alimenticio a base de maíz y muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Es una mujer trabajadora, tiene cuatro hijos, uno de ellos  a su cargo y en edad escolar y para poder salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar tiene que apoyar a su pareja.
Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica, y para cuidar a sus hijos decide   poner su propia actividad comercial en su vivienda
Necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz por quintales esto con el objetivo de reducir el costo de producir tortillas, y de esta forma ser más eficiente en su labor.
texts.en:
Lesbia comes from San Rafael del Sur, a quiet town in Nicaragua.  She makes tortillas, a very popular food in Nicaragua, made from corn.  

She is a hard-working woman who has got four children.  One of them is still at school and depends on her.  She needs to help her husband with the household expenses.

She used to work as a housemaid, and in order to look after her children, she decided to set up her own business from home.

She needs a loan to buy corn in quintals so that she can reduce the cost of making tortillas and become more efficient in her production.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Kanenga Group

texts.fr:
Monaci fait partie du groupe  Kanenga et  habite à Bubanza. Il  à 35 et est marie à Suzanne, une commerçante.Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6 mois à 12 ans dont 2 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, farine,…) depuis 1 an. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles  de sa boutique(riz, haricot, farine,…) en grande quantité  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une voiture pour son transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Monaci is part of the group Kanenga and lives in Bubanza. He is 35 years old and married to Suzanne, a merchant. Together they have three children, from 6 months to 12 years old, of whom two are in school.

Monaci has been doing commerce in a store (rice, beans, flour, …) for a year. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many items for his store (rice, beans, flour, …) in large amounts to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a car as his transportation and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many items for his store (rice, beans, flour, …) in large amounts to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Fania Lisseth

texts.es:
Doña Fania es originaria de san Rafael del sur, una ciudad del pacifico de Nicaragua, su negocio consiste en producir tortillas, productos alimenticio a base de maíz y muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Su estado civil es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, con dos hijos a su cargo, uno de ellos en sexto grado de primaria.
Su forma de trabajo es coser maíz, luego lo procesa en un molino de maíz y procede a la elaboración de tortillas de forma artesanal.
Necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para comprar maíz por quintales, materia prima indispensable para este tipo de alimento
texts.en:
Fania is from San Rafael del Sur, a city on the Pacific coast of Nicaragua. She makes and sells tortillas, a staple made from maize that is very popular in Nicaraguan food. She is 35 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in the sixth grade of primary school.

Her way of working is to cook the maize, then to process it in a grinder and finally make the tortillas by hand. She requires a loan in order to buy maize by the quintal [hundredweight]. It is the indispensable raw material she needs to make this kind of food.

loans.use: to buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Jose habitante del municipio de Somoto en el departamento de Madriz, donde vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, él tiene más de 12 años de vivir en su casa propia la que ha ido mejorando con esfuerzo propio. 
El señor Ricardo Jose se desempeña como obrero en la vigilancia de los pozos que abastecen de agua a su vecindario, él tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a esta labora, la cuales es su principal fuente de ingreso para el sostén de su familia.
Este señor se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de unas láminas de zinc ya que necesita reparar el techo de su casa de habitación antes de que venga la temporada de lluvia. El cliente tiene la esperanza de que el crédito le sea aprobado y así mejorar su casa ya que él quiere mejorar casa vez más su vivienda y así poder darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo Jose lives with his wife and children in Somoto, a town in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Madriz.  He has owned the house for 12 years and worked hard over the years to improve it.  
Sr. Ricardo Jose works as a laborer for an agency that manages the local water supply.  He has worked for the agency for 4 years and his pay is his family's main source of income.
Sr. Ricardo Jose is applying for a CEPRODEL loan that he will use to buy building materials--metal sheeting--that he needs to repair his roof before the coming rainy season.  The investment will allow him to provide his family with a safe and decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy building materials for roof repair.

loans.name: Nouriétou

texts.fr: Nouriétou âgée de 35ans vit avec son mari retraité et leurs enfants à Lomé. Trois d’entre eux vont à l’école. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend au marché et à domicile des céréales. C’est une ancienne cliente de l’institution car elle est à son septième crédit. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui servira d'acheter des céréales. Elle voudrait devenir grossiste et être en mesure d'assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nouriétou is 35 years old and lives with her retired husband and their children in Lome. Three of their children currently attend school. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Nouriétou sells cereals at the market and at home. 

Nouriétou is a long-standing client of the field partner, and this will be her seventh loan with them. The sum that she is asking for will be used to buy cereals.  In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and be able to guarantee the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña María es originaria de san Rafael del sur, un municipio del pacifico de Nicaragua, su negocio consiste en producir tortillas y nacatamales, productos alimenticios a base de maíz y muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Es una mujer trabajadora, tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos en edad escolar y para poder salir adelante con los gastos alimenticios, de salud y educación tiene que apoyar económicamente a su pareja.
Necesita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, hierro, para terminar de construir su vivienda para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María lives in San Rafael del Sur on Nicaragua's Pacific coast.  She has a food sales business.  She makes and sells tortillas and nacatamales, two maize-based foods that most Nicaraguans eat.
Doña María is a hard-working woman.  She has three children, two in school, and she started the business to supplement her husband's income and push the family ahead.  
Doña María is applying for a loan that she will use to pay for construction materials--cement and rebar--to finish her house.  The investment will provide the family with a decent and safe place to live.

loans.use: to pay for building materials.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Karla es una emprendedora en su comunidad por tener a su cargo un punto de venta de comida corriente y productos de consumo.
Necesita de un financiamiento oportuno para comprar cemento, hierro, esto con la finalidad de mejorar las condiciones de su punto de venta y brindarle mejor atención a sus clientes.
Antes de tener su propio negocio en su casa, trabajo para un hotel importante y con su liquidación laboral se le ocurre  poner su propia microempresa.
Es una persona honesta y trabajadora
texts.en:
Karla is an entrepreneur in her community by being in charge of a fast food shop.

She needs this loan to buy cement and iron in order to improve the conditions of her point of sale and provide better service to her customers. 

Before having your her own business at home she worked for a major hotel and with her severance pay she thought to have her own micro enterprise.
 
She is an honest and hardworking person

loans.use: to buy cement and iron

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo es un obrero que reside en la comarca los copales a unos 12 km del casco urbano de la ciudad de Somoto en el departamento de Madriz, este señor labora en la empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado como operador de pozos desde hace unos años siendo esta su sustento familiar. Él es soltero pero tiene dos hijos a su cargo y es quien costea sus gastos.
