Este señor solicita un crédito en las oficinas de ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos y cemento ya que él quiere ir construyendo una cocina en su casa de habitación por que no tiene, el piensa a traces de financiamientos en ceprodel ir mejorando su casa y por ende su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos.
Él se siente seguro que le crédito le será aprobado y podrá llevar a cabo su proyecto e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida ya que es él es sostén de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo, a laborer, lives in the rural town of Copales, some 12 kilometers from Somoto, a city in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Madriz.  He works for the company that maintains local wells and irrigation canals.  He's worked for the company for a number of years and his pay is his means for supporting his family.
Sr. Wilfredo is single but he is responsible for two children, both of whom he supports.  He is applying for a CEPRODEL loan to pay for construction materials--bricks and cement--that he needs to add a kitchen to his house.  He doesn't have a kitchen now and the investment will allow him to build one.
Sr. Wilfredo is confident the loan will be approved and that he'll be able to go ahead with a project that will allow him to provide his family with a safer and more comfortable house.
.

loans.use: to add a kitchen to his house.

loans.name: Berenice Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Berenice es comerciante de ropa usada al detalle, a sus veintidós años tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos está en preescolar.
Tiene un punto de venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de san Rafael del sur, negocio que apertura por iniciativa propia con los que obtiene recursos económicos para atender a sus hijos en sus necesidades básicas.
Su negocio tiene dos años, y necesita de la colaboración económica para comprar una paca de ropa para atender unos encargos de sus clientes.
Es una joven con espíritu de superación personal, capaz de crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Berenice earns her living selling second-hand clothing. She is 22 years old and has three children, one of whom is in nursery school. Berenice has a clothing stall in the municipal market of San Rafael del Sur. She set up the business following her own initiative, and she earns enough from it to provide her children with their basic needs. She has had the business for two years.
She needs a loan in order to buy clothing in bulk, and so meet requests from her customers. She is a young person with a positive spirit of self-improvement, and is capable of growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ntitugungane Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Ntitugungane  et  habite à Bubanza. Elle a 33  et est mariée à Etienne, un imprimeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 8 ans dont 2 étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de  la bière banane et de la bière industrielle depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière industrielle et une grande quantité de banane pour préparer beaucoup de litres de bière de banane ,à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait avoir la capacité de satisfaire tous les besoins familiaux et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Ntitugungane Group and lives in Bubanza.  She is 33 years old and married to Etienne, a printer.  Together they have four children aged between three and eight years old.  Two of their children currently attend school.

Jacqueline has been selling beer and banana beer for five years now.  This will be her first loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many crates of beer and a large quantity of bananas, to be used to prepare many litres of banana beer.  She will then sell the beer and increase her revenue.

In the coming years, Jacqueline would like to be able to provide for all her family's needs and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy the ingredients needed to make banana beer for resale.

loans.name: Butanuka Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe  Butanuka  et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 33  et est marié à Calinie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 6 ans dont 2 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  l’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait avoir une boutique (riz, haricot,..) et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Butanuka Group and lives in Bubanza.  He is 33 years old and married to Calinie, a retailer.  Together, they have four children between the ages of one and six years old.  Two of their children currently attend school.

Elie has been selling palm oil for five years now.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He plans to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil which he will resell to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Elie would like to open a shop (to sell rice, beans, etc) and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Ivyizigiro Group

texts.fr:
Zamda  fait partie du groupe  Ivyizigiro et  habite à Bubanza. Elle a 28  et est mariée à Désiré, un policier. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 16ans dont 2 étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce du riz  depuis  12  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait construire une maison sur sa parcelle et acheter un véhicule de déplacement.
texts.en:
Zamda is a member of the Ivyizigiro Group and lives in Bubanza.  She is 28 years old and married to Désiré, a police officer.  Together they have three children aged between two and sixteen years old.  Two of their children currently attend school.  

Zamda has been selling rice for twelve years now.  This will be her first loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many kilos of rice for resale.

In the coming years, Zamda would like to build a house on her plot of land, and buy a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many kilos of rice for resale.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
La Joven Angélica Maria, posee un negocio de condimentos y especie en  uno de los  mercados de la Ciudad de León desde hace un año, ella realiza esta labor para  ayudar a su esposo gastos del hogar.   

La Joven Angélica María, inicia  a exhibir sus productos desde las 5.30 am finalizando a la 3:00 pm todos los días de lunes a domingo en  este mismo horario.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel fue utilizado para compra de hierro, cemento y bloque para la construcción de su vivienda, y así lograr a tener su propia vivienda ya que actualmente habita junto a su hermana.
texts.en:
Angélica Maria owns a retail business that she operates in one of Leon's many markets.  She started the business a year ago and sells condiments and spices.  She is married and her income and her husband's cover their everyday expenses.

Angélica Maria opens her market stall at 5:30am and works to 3:00pm, every day, from Mondays to Sundays.  
  
Angélica Maria used her CEPRODEL loan to pay for construction materials--rebar, cement, cement blocks--that are going to building a house.  She lives with her sister now and the investment will provide her with a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house.

loans.name: Fernando Alberto

texts.es: Fernando de 36 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, adicional a su trabajo en el campo también en su vivienda posee una pequeña tienda que le da ganancias extras para el mantenimiento del hogar; Fernando necesita invertir en insumos agricolas pero necesita de capital,  por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes,  herramienta, etc. él  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Fernando, 36, lives with his wife and their two children.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He has been in this business for 15 years and has acquired valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests.  His cropland is in an agricultural area and he sells his produce in the neighboring communities to many fixed customers.  They always prefer his products because of their quality and prices, not to mention his unequaled service.

He also runs a small store out of his home which gives him extra income for household expenses.  Fernando is in need of farm supplies but does not have the capital necessary.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, tools, etc.  He has a good credit record and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He believes he can give his family what they deserve in life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, tools, etc.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad,   ejerce el oficio de albañil  y agricultura en pequeño. Él se creció con sus padres y su abuelo quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura desde temprana edad, especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos y cuido de ganado. José carece de una formación academia, ya que en aquél tiempo se le dificulto el acceso a la educación por sus escasos recursos económicos, de esta forma se dedicó a trabajar en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas de su abuelo, con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos en realizar esta actividad y decidió independizarse y formar su hogar , su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos  juntos son padres de 2 hijos uno de 10 años y el otro de 17 quienes se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela.  Hace 11 años José participó en un curso de formación de albañiles en construcción el que duro 6 meses y se graduó con el título de albañil actividad que realiza en la actualidad y se ha convertido en su más fuerte, fuente de ingresos y en segunda opción la agricultura de esta manera lleva el sustento diario a su familia.


José se dedica a la albañilería y realizando esta actividad tiene  10 años de experiencia actividad que aprendió en un curso de formación que fue impartido por programas solidarios del gobierno y también en el tiempo que no hay demanda de trabajos de construcción se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió de su padres y su abuelo. y fue así como decidió continuar esta actividad motivado por los buenos resultados económicos que se tienen además porque se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y le ha dado el sustento diario a su familia y manifiesta que en  cada trabajo que realiza lo acompaña su hijo mayor a quien desde ya lo va capacitando para que en un futuro él sea quien se dedique a realizar dichas actividades.


El crédito será invertido en consolidar deudas con una ferretería,  ya que fue allí que se adquirieron las principales herramientas de trabajo, y otra parte será destinada en compra de materiales pues construirá una acera alrededor de su casa y hacer unas reparaciones al techo de la misma ya que se acerca la apoca de lluvias y tendrá que prepararla  para asegurar el bienestar de su familia, ya es esta quien le proporciona amor, motivación y fuerzas para continuar sus actividades laborales.  


Los sueños de José son los de tener una casa bien amueblada, hacer una ampliación de dos habitaciones para sus dos hijos, haber terminado de pagar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo, para la compra de más herramientas para la construcción, apoyar la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito, con las ganancias y el buen manejo del crédito sueña con tener su propio vehículo el cual se sirva para trasportar los materiales y equipos de construcción y salir y disfrutar de momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 44, is a bricklayer and small crop farmer.  He grew up with his parents and grandfather who worked in agriculture from a young age, especially growing basic grains and raising livestock.  Jose has no academic training because back in his day it was difficult to get an education because of their scarce economic resources.  So he began working in agriculture and livestock farming with his grandfather.  Over time, he acquired experience and knowledge in the field and decided to become independent and establish his household.  His wife is a homemaker and they are the parents of two children, ages ten and 17 who attend school.  Jose participated in a six-month bricklayer training course 11 years ago and obtained a certificate.  This is his strongest business activity and source of income.  His second source is agriculture, in order to support his family.

Jose has been working as a bricklayer for ten years having learned the trade through training courses offered by the government's solidarity programs.  When there is no demand for construction jobs he works in agriculture, a trade learned from his parents and grandfather.  He decided to continue this activity because of the good economic results and the fact that it is his main source of income to support the family.  His eldest son also helps in the work and he believes he is capable of excelling in this activity in the future.

The loan will be used to pay off a debt with a hardware shop, since that is where he acquired most of his work tools.  The rest will be used to buy materials to build a sidewalk around his house and to repair the roof because rainy season is approaching.  He must protect his family because they are the ones who provide him with love, motivation and strength to continue his work.

Jose's goal is to have a well-furnished home and to build on two rooms for his children.  He also wants to pay off the loan and obtain a new one to buy construction tools and support his children in their education until they become successful professionals.  With his profits and a good management of the loan he hopes to buy his own vehicle to transport construction materials and equipment, and to be able to go out and enjoy time with family.

loans.use: To pay off a debt with a hardware shop.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr: Adolé voit son activité grandir compte tenu du fait qu'elle met en pratique les formations sur les thèmes tels que: Augmenter ses gains, Relation avec clients, gestion de stock; Actuellement elle a beaucoup de client et sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 50 trousseaux bébé et 20 douzaines d'assiettes plastiques.
texts.en:
Adolé has managed to grow her business thanks to the training that she has undertaken.  She has attended training in 'Increasing your profits', 'Customer relations' and 'Stock control'.

She has now built up a large customer base, and has requested this new loan in order to buy 50 sets of baby clothes and 20 dozen plastic plates for resale.

loans.use: to buy 50 sets of baby clothes and 20 dozen plastic dishes for resale.

loans.name: Jaya Santoshi Mata Mahila Sangh Group

texts.en:
Subhadra, 51, lives in Sadalga village, Belgaum. She is a former devadasi. The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this life long decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion.

Subhadra (who is standing with her hand raised) has two sons. One of her sons is studying for a Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA) and the other son is studying in the 11th grade. She is a daily wage worker in agriculture fields and does animal husbandry. Subhadra has 30 years experience in this business. She earns INR 4,500 per month on average. Now she wants to purchase a buffalo for which she is seeking a loan of INR 20,000. This will help her to expand her business and hopefully her monthly income too. Subhadra is an industrious and confident woman. She always does her best in her work. She wants to fight against the Devadasi system and stop it from affecting other young girls, as she does not want them to experience the horrific effects of the system as she did in her earlier years.

With the additional income, she wants to improve the standard of living of her family. She hopes to save enough for her children’s education and waits to see them placed in a government or a private company.

This is the first loan of “Jaya Santoshi Mata Mahila Sangh” self-help group (SHG). The other four diligent women (all are former devadasi) in this group are requesting a loan for goat rearing, animal husbandry and house construction.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Laxmi Mahila Sangh - Pamaldini Group

texts.en:
“MASS” NGO works with women who want to leave the Devadasi system and provides these women with employment opportunities so that they can provide a better future for their children. The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and would perform religious rituals, The young women do not have a choice in this life long decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion.

The self-help group called “Laxmi Mahila Sangh” from MASS is located in Pamaldini village, Belgaum. This group consists of seven members, all former devadasis who are trying to achieve impressive things in life. All the group members meet once a week to discuss the loan, savings, repayment details and individual and community problems. All the members have taken a loan from MASS in the past and repaid it on time. 

Yellavva, 48, is the featured borrower of this group. She is standing with her hand raised. She is living with her mother and son in their own house, which is provided by the government. Her elder son is married and living separately with his family. Yellavva has 20 years experience in goat rearing. She buys 1-2 month old kids and raises them. She also works as a laborer in agriculture fields. Her monthly income is around INR 4,000, as it fluctuates depending on her labor work.  

Yellavva now wants to expand her farm and for this reason, she needs to buy more goat kids. Hence, she is seeking a loan of INR 10,000. She hopes to save enough for her son who is studying ITI. She wants to see him in a good post.

The other six members are also requesting a loan for their goat-rearing business.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Mahila Swasahay Sangh Group

texts.en:
The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this life long decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

Gangavva is a 45-year-old woman who is standing with her hand raised in picture. She lives in Sounsudhi village, Belgaum. She is a former devadasi. She stays with her parents and two sons. Her elder son is studying in 10th grade and her other son is studying in 6th grade. Her main source of income is animal husbandry and agriculture. Everyday she sells milk from her buffalos in the local market. Gangavva also cultivates crops on a small piece of land she possesses. She sells some of her harvest in the market for a reasonable price and uses the remaining for household purpose. She earns around INR 4,000 per month, which is not sufficient for her basic needs. 

Gangavva wants to improve her agriculture land. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of INR 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. The other five members of “Mahalaxmi Mahila Swasahay Sangh” are requesting the loan for different purposes like goat rearing, animal husbandry, and improving their agriculture land. All of them have been victims of the Devadasi system and are fighting against it and pursuing everyone in their community not to push their daughters into this unacceptable system. 

Though there are seven members in the group, only six have decided to take this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Dekawowo Nanegbe Group

texts.fr:
Ayéma est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est née dans la région des plateaux au Togo, et a 53 ans. Elle commencé le commerce de matelas traditionnel fait avec du pagne et de la paille. Elle s'approvisionne dans les quartiers périphériques de Lomé et dispose de beaucoup de clients.
Ayéma est actuellement responsable du groupe DEKAWOWO NANEGBE. Ce groupe de femme se réunit pour suivre des formations sur la gestion de leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Toutes ces femmes ont chacune une activité.
Ce crédit que Ayéma sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 15 matelas afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Ayéma is married and has five children.  She was born in the Plateaux Region of Togo and is now 53 years old.  She sells traditional mattresses, made with pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and filled with straw.  She buys the mattresses in the area surrounding Lomé, and she has many customers.

Ayéma is currently the representative of the Dekawowo Nanegbe Group.  This group of women get together to undertake training to improve their business skills.  Each of the women has their own business.

Ayéma will use her loan to buy fifteen mattresses in order to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy 15 traditional, hand made mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Shree Bhagya Jothi Mahila Swasahay Sangh Group

texts.en:
Devadasi literally means servant of God. The practice was prevalent in India wherein women were married to deity/temple at a very young age. The situation of these devadasis is challenging and illiteracy, unemployment, and poverty are common attributes associated with them. Although the system was abolished in 1988, the condition remains appalling.

Rekha, 43, is living in a backward area of Lakkur village, Belgaum, Karnataka. She stays with her two sons and her partner. Her parents dedicated her as a devadasi to the goddess of Yallamma in her earlier age. She has made sure that both her sons are educated. One is studying ITI and the other is in the 8th grade. Rekha did not want her daughters to go through what she did as a devadasi so got her two daughters married and they are well settled with their husbands. Rekha remained illiterate as she was pushed into the devadasi system at a very young age.

She has almost 20 years of experience in the timber business. Her partner helps her with the business. Rekha is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale firewood and furniture made of timber. She sells the timber for firewood and the furniture daily and earns around INR 5,000 per month. Rekha hopes to make some profit, as it is a very crucial for their survival as well for her childrens’ education.

Rekha dreams of seeing her two sons holding a job in the government sector. She is fighting hard against the villagers so they will not dedicate their children to goddess as a devadasi.

Rekha is a featured member of “Shree Bhagya Jothi Mahila Swasahay Sangh” Self-Help Group (SHG). The group consists of nine members including Rekha. Their main occupation is labor work in agriculture fields. They all are requesting a loan for goat rearing and buffalo rearing. They gather weekly for an SHG meeting to discuss their loans, repayments, and savings. They even help out each other with individual and community problems. They all are trying hard to eradicate the Devadasi system in her village.

loans.use: to buy firewood and timber furniture in bulk

loans.name: Vijaya Laxmi Mahila Swa Sahay Group

texts.en:
Laxmibai is 33 years old and lives in Khemlapur village, Raibag, Belgaum. She has studied until the 11th grade. She is married and has two sons who are studying in 8th and 6th grade. They live in their own house, which is provided by the government. 
 
Laxmibai (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) has some experience in goat and buffalo rearing. She purchased a calf four years back, which at present gives four liters of milk per day. She sells the milk to KMF Federation, which is located in her village. She also works in the agriculture fields as a daily wage worker and sometimes helps her husband in his tailoring business.
 
Laxmibai is requesting a loan to buy another calf. She hopes to save enough for her children’s education so that they are well settled. She even wants to open a petty or mobile shop in her village. 

This is the first time the group, “Vijaya Laxmi Mahila Swasahay” Self-Help Group (SHG), will take a loan. The group consists of eight members including Laxmibai who leads this group. The other seven members are Renuka, Mahadevi, Sangeeta, Mallavva, Rukmavva, Sevanta and Paravva. All are daily wage workers in the agriculture fields. They want loans for animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena de 61 años de edad  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios  años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su compañero d vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que es que muestra en la fotografía, y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su hogar sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Lorena, 61, has worked in agriculture for several years which has given her the capacity and knowledge necessary to care for her crops, which are mainly corn and beans.  She sells her produce to basic grain dealers near her place of residence.  She uses the profits from sales to cover family expenses.  She lives in her own house with her common-law husband and son.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy farm supplies such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc. to care for her crops and land, shown in the photograph.  Her aim is to improve profits and continue covering household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc. to improve her cropland.

loans.name: Marta Ofelia

texts.es: Marta es de 36 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos, el primero tiene 19 años de edad trabaja y ayuda a su mamá en los gastos de la familia, el segundo es de 17 años de edad también trabaja y aporta a la familia, el tercero es de 10 años de edad estudia ciclo básico, el cuarto es de 8 años de edad esta estudiando en el nivel primario y el último tiene 6 años de edad también esta estudiando nivel primario, ella obtiene ingreso de una tienda de abarrotes que esta en el mercado municipal del municipio, lleva 4 años de dedicarse a atender su tienda y con las ganancias que le deja la tienda ayuda a su esposo a mantener a la familia, ella solicita un crédito por un monto de Q 3,000.00 para comprar más productos y surtir la tienda para atender mejor a sus clientes, Marta en el futuro quiere tener más grande su tienda y con ello poder darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 36 years old and lives in the town of Sololá, department of Sololá.   She has 5 children: the eldest is 19 and works to help cover household expenses.  The second son is 17 and also works and contributes to the family.  Her third is ten years old and in elementary school.  The fourth is eight and attends primary school and the youngest, six, is also in primary.  She earns a living with her grocery store at the municipal market where she has worked for four years.  With her earnings she helps her husband support the family.

The loan she is requesting in the amount of 3,000 GTQ is to buy goods for the store so she can attend to customers better.  In the future, Marta wants to expand her store so she can give her children an education.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dioumady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2012,est constitué de 26 membres qui sont tous de la même localité. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Fatoumata qui se trouve debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont un garçon et une fille.elle évolue dans le petit commerce de légumes, de poissons, d'oignon et de repas.

avec son financement, elle compte acheter 20 kg de poissons a  800f le kg par deux jour, 25kg d'oignons a 12000f et le reste sera servi pour acheter des légumes.


les objectifs visés pour son bénéfice sont de participer aux charges familiales, renforcer son épargne et participer aux tontinex du quartier.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2012 and is made up of 26 members who all live in the same area.  Their main business activity is retail trade.

Fatoumata (standing on the far right of the photo, with her arm raised) is our borrower representative.  She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl.  She sells vegetables, fish, onions and prepared meals.  She plans to use her loan to buy 20kg of fish at 800 francs CFA a kilo, 25kg of onions at 12,000 francs CFA, and the rest will be used to buy vegetables.

Fatoumata will use her profits to help provide for her family's expenses, increase her savings, and participate in the local savings/investment group.

loans.use: to buy fish, onions and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bethesaïda (1) Group

texts.fr:
Vincencia is a member of the group BETHSAÏDA (1) in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. As a single mother, Vincencia dreams of being able to send her two children to study abroad and hopes to one day buy a piece of land to build her own home on. 

Vincencia runs a small used clothing business and wants to use a loan of 300,000 CFA ($600) to purchase additional bundles of clothing and expand to selling lotion as well. It is difficult to find good quality clothing, but Vincencia hope to continue to grow her savings by taking out small loans from HOPE Congo to increase her capital. Vincencia leads a sub-group of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs and is currently on her second loan cycle. In the future she dreams of being able to expand to open her own clothing store.
texts.en:
Vincencia is a member of the BETHSAÏDA (1) Group in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. As a single mother, Vincencia dreams of being able to send her two children to study abroad, and hopes to one day buy a piece of land to build her own home on. 

Vincencia runs a small, used clothing business and wants to use a loan of 300,000 francs CFA ($600) to purchase additional bundles of clothing and expand to selling lotion as well. It is difficult to find good quality clothing, but Vincencia hopes to continue to grow her savings by taking out small loans from the field partner, HOPE Congo, to increase her capital. Vincencia leads a sub-group of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs and is currently on her second loan cycle. In the future she dreams of being able to expand to open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of clothing to sell, and expand into selling lotion.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 33-year-old married woman from Ramallah city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Hanan and her husband work in their own project which is a dry cleaning store. It is the only store of this kind in this area. It is a good business and earns a good income. They would like to improve their store and expand it.

Hanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy new machines for their store. By taking this loan, Hanan and her husband will be able to improve their store and improve the quality of work. 

Hanan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new machines for their store.

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe, madre de dos hijos de 15 y 6 años, es socia del grupo “siempre unidas”. Ella vive con su conyugue, su dos hijos y su suegra. Tanto ella como su conyugue son el sustento del hogar. La señora se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, además de la venta de accesorios para celulares. Trabaja doce horas diarias, siendo ayudada por sus dos hijos que aun están estudiando en el colegio. La señora incursionó en este negocio gracias a un sobrino. Este le enseñó el negocio y le mostró cuan lucrativo podía ser. La señora está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya que por este pudo construir su casa propia y darles educación a sus hijos.
La señora se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio. Ella piensa invertir el dinero del crédito para comprar nuevos equipos. Se siente entusiasmada por el préstamo ya que gracias a este hará crecer un poco más su negocio. La señora ha pasado por momentos realmente difíciles en su vida, siendo el ultimo el robo de toda su mercadería, valorizada en unos S/. 6000, hace apenas dos meses. Sin embargo, ella no se amilana ante estos hechos y dice que solo se tiene que seguir adelante, ya que lamentarse es una pérdida de tiempo y dinero. El sueño de esta madre es llegar a tener algún día un local grande con gran variedad de equipos y accesorios.
En el grupo la señora se lleva bien con todas las socias, “congeniamos muy bien todas”, expresa. Ella se siente agradecida por ser ayudada por inversionistas KIVA, Por la ayuda prestada y que sigan así, ayudando a los pequeños emprendedores del país
texts.en:
Guadalupe is the mother of two children, ages 15 and six.  She is a member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidas".  She lives with her husband, their two children and her mother-in-law.  Both she and her husband support the household.  Guadalupe sells and repairs cell phones and also sells accessories.  She works 12 hours a day and has the help of her two children who attend school.  She got started in the business thanks to a nephew who taught her about the activity and showed her how profitable it could be.  She is very proud of her work since she was able to build her own home and give her children an education. 

Guadalupe works full time in her business and plans to use the loan to buy new equipment.  She is excited about the loan because it will allow her to expand a bit more.  She has experienced difficult moments in life, the latest one being the theft of merchandise worth 6,000 PEN in only two months.  Nevertheless, she is not discouraged by this and says she only wants to get ahead, as crying over spilt milk is a loss of time and money.  Her goal is to own a bigger shop one day with a variety of equipment and accessories.

Guadalupe gets along with all the members of the group and says "We all get along great.".  She is grateful for the support and help from KIVA lenders, who she encourages to continue helping small entrepreneurs in her country.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 32ans, Madame Amivi est mariée à un commercial et mère de 02 enfants de 05 et 03ans scolarisés. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré la vente des produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2010 et s'approvisionne généralement au Grand Marché de Lomé. Aidée par 01 personne, elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises(riz, huile végétale, tomate et autres....) Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is a young, 32-year-old woman.  She is married to a retailer, and has two children who are five years old and three years old.  Both her children currently attend school.  She started selling food products in 2010 in order to help provide for the needs of her family.  She usually buys her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Amivi employs one person to help run her business.  This will be her second loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy more merchandise (rice, vegetable oil, tomatoes, etc).  Her profits will be used to increase the size of her business and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

Fatuma has operated a coconut-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kadziche

texts.en:
Kadziche appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Besides the fish-selling business, Kadziche operates a shop kiosk. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. In addition to the clothes-selling business, Mwanamisi sells household utensils.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household utensils for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household utensils for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 54 years old. She is from Nyandarua South and is married. They have four adult children.

Ruth has a farming business that she has been running for the past 20 years and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizers.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the grinding machine business, Rose operates a shop kiosk.

She is asking for a loan to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married woman with five children, one underage and four in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase milk, ground nuts, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, ground nuts, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Light High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ronald. He is the Head teacher at Light High School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Ssegukku, Wakiso Distrct with 405 students. Light High has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Light High School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Ronald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kawotto Saviours School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the Deputy Head teacher at Kawotto Saviours Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kajjansi, Wakiso District with 600 students. Kawotto Saviours has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kawotto will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ndejje View School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is the Head teacher at Ndejje View Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namasuba, Wakiso Distrct with 600 students. Ndejje View has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Ndejje View Primary School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has five children of whom four are in school. 

She is a coffee farmer and also brews local wine to supplement the family income. She has applied for a loan to help her buy more bananas (matooke) for local wine production. She hopes to make more profit to enable her raise the tuition fees for her children and meet other family needs.

Her major challenge is limited capital to help her run her business.

Regina is a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy green bananas to ripen, extract juice, and make wine.

loans.name: Katalemwa School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Shaban. He is the Head teacher at Katalemwa Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Matugga, Wakiso District with 360 students. Katalemwa Junior has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Katalemwa Junior will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Shaban ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 43-year-old married woman from Ramallah City. She is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. She wanted to help her husband to improve the family living conditions, so she started her own business four months ago. She makes home-made food and sells it for parties and social events. It is a good business and the income is high.

Hanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more kitchen tools for her new project. By taking this loan, Hanan will be able to improve her business and increase her productivity.

Hanan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen tools for her new project.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 41-year-old man, married to Tabita, a 40-year-old woman. They are blessed with four children: Nadia, seven, who is in the 1st grade of Elementary School; Mini, five, who is in kindergarten; Marcello, three; and Yunita, one. 

Marthen has been running a kiosk business for three years using his own capital. The generated income enables him to support his family on a daily basis as well as provide for his children tuition. Marthen was planning to re-stock the items in the kiosk to have more goods, as well as enlarge the kiosk building. 

In order to implement his plan, Marthen applied for a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on stock for the kiosk such as soft drinks, snacks, candies, etc. and the materials to enlarge his kiosk building such as plywood, nails, etc.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the kiosk and materials to enlarge his kiosk building such as plywood and nails.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 19 years old and single, living with her parents and other siblings in a rural village of Prasat Balangk district, Kampong Thom province. Chanthou graduated from high school in 2013, and she passed her exam to be a trainee teacher, majoring in Khmer literature. After two years of training, she will be a secondary school teacher. With the purpose of aiming to be a professional and move to next step of her life career, she would like to attend a university in the faculty of sciene education, majoring in Khmer literature.

Due to inadequate capital, Chanthou is taking out a loan of an amount of 1,080 US dollars, which will enable her to cover the overall fees for a bachelor degree. Chanthou is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via the Kiva program to allow poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover the overall fees for a bachelor degree.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 47-year-old man who is married to Fransiska, 47, a civil servant. They have been blessed with 4 children, namely Rudolfo, 23, a worker; Maria, 17, who is in Senior High School; Remundus, 15, who is in Junior High School; and the last one is Petrus, 12, an Elementary School student.  

Samuel has been running a kiosk business for years. He sells various items which are for daily use such as rice, instant noodles, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, etc. In 2004, he opened a new kiosk business in his new house. The capital was taken from the first kiosk income. In addition, he sells dozens of containers of mineral water. 

Currently, Samuel needs capital assistance to purchase more stock for the kiosk and dozens of containers of mineral water as he usually receives orders for big events. To do so, he requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the kiosk as well mineral water in large quanties.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 42-year-old man married with three children who are all in school. He comes from a rural area in Kamwenge district.

He is a farmer who deals in stone quarrying and sand mining. The money he gets out of his mines is used to buy feed for his cattle and also pay school fees for his children.

He has applied for a loan to buy more land for sand mining and feed for his animals. He will use the balance to pay school fees for his children.

Robert is a very hardworking and honest man who is working for a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy land for sand mining.

loans.name: Maria Sandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años,  su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su compañero de vida, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía  y así poder tener mejores ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 42 years old, has been dedicated to farming for 15 years. Her main crops are maize and beans. She sells her crops at basic grain agencies that are close to her place of residence. With the earnings that she obtains from her sales, she helps with the family expenses. She lives with her partner. Maria is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs like chemical and organic fertilizers, herbicides, pest control, etc. and to improve the land where she wishes to plant shown in the photograph and thus have better income and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, pest control etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old engaged man. A year ago, he opened his current restaurant, directly after he finished his vocational studies in hospitality. Luckily, he has not faced any remarkable difficulties.

In parallel to his restaurant, Mohamad is establishing an internet station, where he is going to provide internet services to villagers upon request. He is working hard to develop both businesses to earn a good income so he can move forward with his marriage plans.

Mohamad is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy internet station equipment to start providing this service properly. He hopes to continue developing and expanding both businesses in a well managed way.

loans.use: To buy internet station equipment so he can provide internet service to people in his community

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela pues sus productos de buena calidad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Julio está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado y así poder seguir con la crianza que le genera buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: 33-year-old Julio lives in his own home with his wife and son.  He has worked in livestock breeding for 20 years and he sells his products in various markets close to where he lives.  He has a large clientele because his products are of such high quality and what he earns from selling his produce enables him to cover some of his household expenses. Julio is applying for a loan to buy concentrate and vitamins for his cattle so he can continue breeding cattle.  This will allow him to earn a good income and provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy concentrate and vitamins for his cattle

loans.name: Florije

texts.en:
Borrower Florije is a married mother of 4 children. Her husband is a baker and in order to earn a living she has started a handicraft business from her home, focusing primarily on weddings. Florije started to do this kind of work when she was a young girl and has continued until today making it a profession. Because of the many expenses she has had, including caring for her children and their home, she has not been able to open her own shop and continues to work from a room in her home. 

Florije is requesting a loan in order to purchase thread, beads and other materials for her work. The loan will help her improve her business and generate more income. Her goal is to have her own shop and eventually hire an employee to help her. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: To purchase thread, beads and other materials for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, creams, lotions at wholesale.

loans.name: Xhevahire

texts.en:
Xhevhire, 26, is a young mother of two children, ages 1 and 3 years old. She is a house-wife, staying home to care for her children and the home. Her husband works as a guard in a caffe factory in her area. Before she was married, Xhevhire worked in agriculture as her family has always kept cows and sold milk and milk products.

Now, Xhevhire is planning to start her own business, owning a cow and making a stable. She would like a loan to purchase the cow and build the stable, which will help her to generate an income to cover her family's needs. Her new business will also help Xhevhire reduce expenses by using the milk products for her family. She knows that with her previous experience, she will be successful in generating a profit. She is happy to have work and contribute to the family needs. She is very grateful for the help.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and build a stable

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Jackeline es socia del grupo “madres emprendedoras”. Ella tiene 3 hijos de 17, 13 y 5 años. En su casa viven ella, su conyugue (con quien no esta casada), sus 3 hijos y su suegra. Los gastos del hogar son compartidos entre ella y su conyugue. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto de desayuno, almuerzo y cena ya que trabaja diez horas diarias. Lleva ya dos años en el negocio y atiende a un gran número de personas diariamente que va a su puesto de comida principalmente por su buena sazón. La señora refiere que se siente orgullosa de lo que hace, puesto que con su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Antes de iniciar su negocio era ama de casa. Sin embargo, al ver que el dinero proporcionado por su conyugue era insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, se vio obligada a usar su talento en la cocina para iniciar su negocio que hasta ahora le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, siendo una de estas darles a sus hijos una buena alimentación y educación.
La señora se siente entusiasmada con el crédito que se le dio ya que con este, la señora Jackeline podrá comprar más insumos para preparar la comida para su negocio debido a la alta demanda de sus platos. El sueño de la señora es seguir progresando y algún día llegar a tener un restaurante moderno y grande. 
La señora tiene apenas un año en el grupo y cuenta que todo ha caminado muy bien desde que entró a este. Se lleva muy bien con las otra socias y no ha tenido problema alguno con alguna de ellas. Al saber que inversionistas de todo el mundo como Kiva la apoyan ella comento que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo y espera que sigan confiando en ella y en otras personas que necesitan de un crédito para seguir manteniendo sus negocios a flote.
texts.en: Jackeline is a member of the "madres emprendedoras" (enterprising mothers) group.  She has 3 children aged 17, 13 and 5. She lives in her home with her partner (they are not married), her 3 children and her mother-in-law.  She and her partner share the household expenses between them. Jackeline sells food - breakfast, lunch and dinner - and so she works 10 hours a day. She has been involved in this business for two years and, every day,  serves a large number of people who go to her stall on account of her good flavours. She says that she is proud of what she does because her job has enabled her to support her family.  Before she set up her business she was a housewife.  However, when she realised that the money that her husband earned was not enough to cover all her family's needs, she felt obliged to use her talent for cooking to set up her own business.  So far it has proved very satisfying for her as it has enabled her, among other things, to provide good food for her children and pay for their schooling.  Jackeline is very excited about the loan because she will be able to use it buy more supplies for her business and make her dishes for which there is a high demand. Her dream is to continue making progress and to have a big, modern restaurant one day.  She has been a member of the group for just under a year and says that everything has gone very well for her since she joined.  She gets on very well with the other members and has never had any kind of problem with any of them.  Aware that lenders, like Kiva, the world over are supporting her, she says that she is extremely grateful for the support and hopes that they will continue to have confidence in her and other people who need a loan to keep their businesses afloat.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to make the dishes of the day

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es: Pedro de 60 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Pedro se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; necesita invertir en sus cultivos pero necesita  de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. Pedro tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Pedro, 60 years old, lives alongside his life partner and their children. He is dedicated to cultivating maize and beans. He has been dedicated to farming for 25 years and has a lot of experience in this role. He is well known in the area and already has good customers since he obtains the best harvests. As a result, he sells first rate product and at very accessible prices. Additionally, the service is unequaled. Pedro is characterized by his great friendliness. He is an entrepreneurial man with great desire to get ahead. He thinks that taking advantage of the opportunities will take him one step closer to success. He needs to invest in his crops but needs capital. Consequently, he is requesting from INTEGRAL a loan that allows him to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pest control, etc. Pedro has a reputation of having high moral and responsible character and good pay. He trusts he will be able to repay the debt and, at the same time, give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 62 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad el cultivo la realiza año con año. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, siempre está al pendiente de ellos. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes,  etc.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Juan, 62 years old, is dedicated to farming maize and beans. He earns a living this way and is able to bring home the daily bread. The farming is carried out every year. He is a very hard working, honorable and responsible man. Despite the conditions in which he lives, which are very humble, he does not tire of working and giving the best to his family. He is always watching out for them. He has made the decision to approach this institution to request this loan since the planting season approaches and he wishes to be prepared with the main agricultural inputs such as organic fertilizer, pest control, seeds, chemical fertilizer, etc. He hopes to have favorable results since he has no other source of income. He trusts in God that he will manage to obtain an abundant harvest which will allow him to keep bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, pest controls, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Alicia

texts.es: Vilma de 40 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para realizar su siembra ya que el terreno donde la realiza actualmente es arrendado y quiere mejor tener su propio terreno, por esa razón solicita el crédito.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Vilma is 40 years old. She has grown corn and beans for 15 years. This is how she earns her living and brings home the daily bread. She is a hardworking. honest and responsible woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has decided to ask for a loan to by the main agricultural materials, such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds. etc. and to improve the land where she plants, which can be seen in the photograph. This is so she can do the planting. The land where she does it now is rented and she wants to have her own land, that is why she is asking for the loan. She hopes to get favorable results, because she has no other source of income. She trusts in God that she will achieve an abundant crop which will allow her to keep bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Melvil Eliseo

texts.es: Melvil de 50 años de edad vive junto con su familia en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; melvil necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía.  Melvil tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Melvil, 50, lives with his family in a house of their own. He grows corn and beans, and has been working in agriculture for many years. He has gained a lot of experience and his harvest is the best. He sells his harvest to locals and has many customers that prefer his quality, good prices and good service.

Melvil is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, compost, etc. and to improve the piece of land shown in the picture. His acquaintances can give good references of his payment record. He is very responsible and assures he will pay back the loan according to plan. He is also confident that he will bring financial security to his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides and compost, and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, a pesar de ser mayor de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace muchos años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos básicos  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña marta solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y pagar el arrendamiento del mismo y también comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi ella pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Marta, 62 years old, lives in her own house with her two children. Despite being older, she has been dedicated to farming maize and sorghum for many years and this has given her the necessary experience to tend to her crops. She sells her harvests in the basic grain markets. With the earnings that she obtains from her sales and with the help of her two sons, she manages to pay the household bills. Marta is requesting a loan to be able to improve the land where she is thinking of making her planting and to pay the rent on that land and also to buy the necessary inputs like chemical fertilizers, herbicides, organic fertilizers, among other items in order to have good harvests and thus she can obtain greater income to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy the necessary inputs like chemical fertilizers, herbicides, organic fertilizer, among other items.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 51 años de edad desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y frijol adicional a eso también posee un molino ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ganancias  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
José, 51, has been working in agriculture for many years. This activity is his main source of income. He grows corn and beans, and has a mill at home. With his profits, he manages to cover the home expenses. He lives with his family in a house of their own.

José wants to buy agricultural supplies for his crops, such as compost, fertilizers and seeds, and improve the piece of land shown in the picture. However, he does not have enough money to make this investment, so he decided to request a loan in order to be able to continue with this activity. Just as every other farmer, he puts his trust in agriculture, since it is his only source of income. He hopes to have an abundant harvest that allows him to bring food to his family every day and pay back this loan.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer and seeds, and improve the soil.

loans.name: Ada Maribel

texts.es: Ada de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Ada es una mujer  entregada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, quiere realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramientas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía,  Ada  tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Ada is 41 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She grows corn and beans. She has been working in agriculture for several years and has gained valuable experience that allows her to obtain better harvests. The land where she plants is located in an area with a lot of agriculture and is very close to her home. She sells in places nearby the community and she has gained many customers who prefer her because of her accessible prices and good service. Ada is a woman who is dedicated to her work and is very eager to get ahead. She is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to attain success. She wants to make a new investment that will allow her to increase production. That is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc. and to improve the land that can be seen in the photograph. Ada has good payment references that ensure she will be bale to pay off the debt. She hopes to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. and to improve her land.

loans.name: Nelson  Amilcar

texts.es: Nelson de 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos por quienes se esfuerza día con día para brindarles estudios y todo lo necesario para que salgan adelante y cuenten con un mejor futuro, su esposa esta en estados unidos y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, desde hace varios años  que Nelson  se dedica al oficio de la sastrería, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. El es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Nelson solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, para poder atender un pedido grande de uniformes con el que cuenta y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras para seguirle dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Nelson is 38 years old. He lives with his three children for whom she strives every day to give them an education and everything they need to get ahead and have a better future. His wife is in the United States and helps with the household expenses. For several years, Nelson has worked as a tailor. During that time, he has acquired a lot of experience as well as regular customers. He is a very responsible person who works very hard to give the best of himself. Nelson is asking for a loan which he can invest in his business by buying a large quantity of materials, such as fabric, buttons, thread and needles. This way, he can fill a big order of uniforms that he has and not miss the opportunity to make some extra profit to keep giving his children what they need without limits.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto 70 años de edad desde hace 30 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva cafe, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus nietos.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas,  etc. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Humberto is 70 years old. He has been working the land for 30 years. With much dedication, he grows coffee, which allows him to bring home the daily bread. He is described as a hardworking, honest and responsible man. He lives with his family group, which is made up of his wife and grandchildren. He and his wife work very hard to get his family ahead and give them better living conditions than they have had. Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture, he is able to support his home. It is his main source of income, since it is the only way he knows how to earn an honest living. With eagerness to get ahead, he approached this institution to ask for a loan, because he needs to invest in buying agricultural materials he needs, such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pest control, etc. He trusts in God and in his work that in this way he will have an abundant crop which will allow him to have a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la reparación de bicicletas, adicional a eso también posee un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de atender a sus clientes, Jose vive en casa propia con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar repuestos para bicicletas por mayor y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asid arel a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and has worked for several years repairing bicycles. As well as this he also has a small metal workshop. He has a large customer base due to the quality of his work, the good prices and the pleasant way in which he attends to his customers. Jose lives in his own house with his family. 

He is applying for this loan to be able to buy spare parts for bicycles in bulk, and so to be able to continue with his work, which is his only source of income, and to give his family better economic stability without limitation.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles in bulk.

loans.name: Jose De La O

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día.
