Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía.  Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old and works in agriculture, sowing corn and beans. He has done this for several years and this is how he earns his daily keep. He is a hard-working, responsible man, well-known in the area for his enormous heart and kindness towards others. As it is already planting season he has decided to start to prepare.

This is why he has decided to apply for this new loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in the purchase of seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizers, pest controls etc. as shown in the photograph.

What he wishes for most is that his harvest is plentiful and better than previous ones, as this is how he provides support to his family. He trusts in God that with His help, his dedication and effort in his work he will achieve his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizers, pest controls etc.

loans.name: Hyrishahe

texts.en: Hyrishahe is from the Ashkali minority community. She is 26 years old and has 3 children between the ages of 7 months and 5 years old. She is busy at home taking care of the small children while her husband transports materials and goods for a small salary. As with most people that live in the Ashkali community, they live in a very old house under poor conditions. She would like to renovate their house but with the small salary from her husband, they have never been able to do it. Her furniture is very old and damaged, and the insulation in the home is poor.  There are many drafts and leaks in bad weather. She would like to replace the doors and windows as well as purchase new furniture such as beds, sofa, and closets. She is hoping in the future to find a job and contribute to the family budget. She wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To replace doors and windows as well as purchase new furniture

loans.name: Gjylsime

texts.en: Gjylsime is 27 years old and has a seven-month-old son who she stays home to take care of. Her husband works in a salt company with a small amount of income. Despite the small salary, they have been able to save a small amount of money in order to renovate their home, but they still need more money to complete it. She is requesting a loan to complete the renovations to improve their living conditions. In the future, she hopes to find a job and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To complete the renovations to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 35-year-old married mother of five, who has been selling clothes from her home for 14 years. Her determination and wide experience provide her with special talents in her domain. She and her husband combine their incomes to improve their family’s living standards. Thus her limited financial situation at the beginning has been a major setback for expanding her business.
 
Nasreen is an old Al Majmoua borrower of three successful, consecutive loans. Today she is seeking a new loan to increase her inventory with newly released spring and summer collections, which increases her income and provides her customers with a wide variety that attracts their attention and assures business sustainability.

She hopes to keep on developing her business and would like to open her own clothing shop in the future.

loans.use: to add new spring and summer inventory.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 23-year-old married man from Rafah. He lives with his wife and two kids; a boy and girl. Two years ago, Sameer started his own business, which is a traditional food store in the city. It is a good business and the demand is high. Sameer would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. 

Sameer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for soft drinks. By taking this loan, Sameer will be able to improve his store and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for soft drinks

loans.name: Luis  Benjamin

texts.es: Luis de 47 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de arroz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. Luis  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Luis is 47 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home. He works growing rice, and has worked in agriculture for several years, which has given him a lot of experience and enables him to obtain the best harvests. He sells his harvests in the surrounding area of the community and already has a lot of customers, who prefer him for the quality, good prices and above all for the good service.

He needs to invest, which is why he is applying for a loan which will allow him to buy insecticide, weed-killer, fertilizers, manure, pesticides etc. Luis has good payment references from those who know him, he is very responsible and assures that he will be able to repay the debt in the established period and at the same time he trusts that it will bring his home economic security.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, weed-killer, fertilizers, manure, pesticides etc.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with seven children.  Four children are in school and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food .

Nyamvula prepares sweet dumplings and sells them to neighbors and passersby.She cites seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widow with seven children, two in school; the rest are adults. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanasha has operated a fruit stall for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Dobrila

texts.en: Dobrila lives in one of the minority communities of Kosovo, with only her husband. They both receive pensions and have a lot of friends in the community. She likes to cook and enjoys entertaining company at her home, which is always clean and well-maintained. However, in her area, there is a big problem with the water and having access to the water. She says: “Without water it is impossible to live. Everything I do, I need water." Dobrila is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 Euros to open a well to access water for drinking and using. This loan will help her to have enough water and to accomplish all of her chores. She is very grateful for the lenders' help and wants to thank them.

loans.use: To open a well to access water for drinking and using

loans.name: Haki

texts.en:
Haki is 27, single, and hardworking. He lives with his entire family but is the main source of income for them as his parents receive a pension. He is a baker and also works on the land that they own, planting wheat and corn for selling and for feeding the family. 

He is now in need of a loan to purchase agricultural tools for mowing and working the land. He is hoping to get married soon, once he can save more money and earn a stable income. He promises to repay the loan on time and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools for mowing and working the land

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 24 years old. She is married with one child. Her husband works together in the same business of selling sugar, cooking oil, and soap for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, cooking oil, and soaps for sale.  The profits from the business will be used in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is a single man. He is 30 years old and is living with his parents in the Abseron region. Seven years ago, Emin began to study the profession of carpenter and in the next year he founded his business. 

Emin makes chairs from wood. Already for six years he has been in this business and day by day he is trying to develop the business. Today one of his necessary apparatuses, a drill, was broken and Emin wants to buy a new drill. Also he wants to buy more materials. 

Therefore he has applied for a loan in amount of 1,400 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) from the Komak company. For help and support, he says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all lenders. In the future he wants to hire an assistant and, in his personal life, Emin wants to  get married.

loans.use: to buy a new drill and more materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old. She sells cows and has been in the business for the past seventeen years.  

With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She was very successful with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine sells cows and has been in this new business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for sale. 

She plans to use the profits from the business to reinvest in the business. Since she moved to another new business of animals (cows), she has gradually developed a sense of having a big dream for her business because the future for her now is brighter, as Justine narrated.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is very thankful for the previous loan, which has helped him to improve the condition of his home, by replacing the doors and windows, renovating, and facading the house. He is very happy for having had this opportunity and very satisfied with the loan process and lenders. 

He is now requesting a second loan, this time to build an annex to his house, since his home is very small, with only two rooms. He promises to repay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build an annex to his house

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is a father of two adult children, ages 19 and 25 years old. They all still live together in one of the minority communities. He is employed as a technical helper in a school while his wife is a housewife. His daughter is working as teacher and his son is a student. 

Nebojsa is also involved in agriculture. He plants wheat and corn for the family needs and also for selling. Currently, he is need of a loan to order to buy new tools for his agricultural machine. The loan will help him to generate more income and improve the living conditions. He wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his agricultural machine

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en:
Vardush lives in Artashat. For five years, she has been trading clothing and shoes from a rented store in the center of Artashat town. Vardush lives together with her husband. Their children are married and live with their families separately. 

Vardush has requested this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing and shoes to sell to her clients. She needs to meet her customers' demansd and hopes for lenders' support.

Vardush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his college tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: helps Ahmed to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood to make traditional souvenirs.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.en:
Nozigul is 63 years old. She is widowed and has two children. Her children are adults and have their own jobs. Nozigul wants to help her children and to provide the family with all necessary things. She decided to organize a new business selling clothes and in this way to make a living. 

Nozigul will sell clothes in a local market and her children will help her with managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy clothes to set up a new business. She awaits your support. She trusts to your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes to set up a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy replacement refrigerator parts in bulk

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 24 years old and has two children; she works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Cristina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8935 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Cristina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre is a Cameroonian aged 57 and married with a child aged ten months. He has been in this business for over three years which makes him very experienced and his business is stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his turnover from 1,050,000 XAF to 1,300,000 XAF per month.

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish, rice, pepper, oil and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.en:
Lutfi runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Lutfi lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Lutfi is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Lutfi began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат уроженка района Гончи города Истравшан. Она проживает там с мужем и детьми. Ей 43 года. Она занимается шитьем. А муж предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов. При дворе их дома имеется коровник, но нету скотов. Инобат решила параллельно начать еще одну деятельность, а именно откорм-продажу крупнорогатого скота. Для этой цели она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести двух голов курпнорогатого скота хорошей породы и корм для скотов. Муж будет помогать в новом бизнесе. Таким образом они хотят улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Они ждут поддержки.
texts.en: Inobat is 43 and a resident of the city of Istravshan in the Gonchi region. She lives there with her husband and children and works as a seamstress. Her husband works in construction and home renovation. They have a cowshed in their yard, but no animals. Inobat has decided to begin a second occupation fattening and selling cattle. For this she is requesting a loan so that she can acquire two good head of cattle and enough feed for them. Her husband will help her with this new business, which they want to use to improve their family's financial situation. They hope for your support.

loans.use: to buy two head of livestock and feed to start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Cucun

texts.en:
Cucun runs a small stall that sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Cucun lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2,5 hours from Jakarta. Cucun is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Cucun began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
Titin runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Titin lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Titin is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Titin began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 67 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Don Jose  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, and he is very kind and hard working. He lives with his life companion in his own house. He works extremely hard on his own parcel of land, where he cultivates corn and beans; and his produce is very high quality. 

Don Jose is requesting a loan from Integral in order to have the money needed for purchasing agricultural supplies such as pest control, fertilizer, compost, seeds, and other items that he needs for planting. He wants very much to increase his sales in order to be able to realize greater earnings and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase pest control, fertilizer, compost, seeds, and similar items.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta de 60 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y  a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Marta, 60, lives with her family in a house of their own. She is a responsible, enterprising and hardworking woman. She has been raising milk cows for some years and sells her dairy products to locals. She has a good customer base and has managed to earn her customers’ trust. She offers good quality and low prices.

Marta has decided to invest in her animals, since her business depends on them. This is why she decided to request a loan to buy vitamins and feed for her cows. She will be able to continue providing for her family, giving them anything they might need.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her cows.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 30 years old and married with one child.

Christina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Christina has borrowed and repaid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Christina aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an over-sewing machine.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

Lolita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Tabrani

texts.en:
Tabrani runs a small stall that sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Tabrani lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Tabrani is married and living with five people in the family home. As seen in the picture, Tabrani is standing with his child.

Tabrani began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Ciudad Nueva Group

texts.es:
Hace 20 ciclos que este grupo está unido y viene trabajando para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y también ayudar a sus familias. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una mujer digna de admirar es la Sra. Honorina, quien vende especias de todo tipo, para comidas, terere, mate y demás, que sale a vender todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de especias varias para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group has been together through 20 loan cycles.  They work to be able to help each other and also to help their families.  They are doing the Poverty Elimination Survey, which allows them to understand each of their situations and can work according to it.  

One woman worthy of admiration is Señora Honorina, who sells every type of herb—for food, herbal teas, and other uses.  She heads out to make sales every day from a very early hour.  She is a very sacrificing woman who fights to get ahead and give her family everything they need.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of various herbs to be able to keep going with her sales, fighting to improve her life and the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy various herbs to sell

loans.name: Tesapeara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tesapeara, está en su ciclo número 4  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., y por medio de su trabajo también poder dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia quien cuenta que tiene peluquería para damas, donde realiza peinados, cortes de pelo entre otros, con los que sus clientes quedan muy conformes siempre. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, ya que es por ellos que está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. solicita de este préstamo para la compra de shampoo, enjuague, accesorios para el cabello; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Tesapeara is in its fourth cycle. It is a group of women, where all of them work and help each other to get ahead and through their hard work they are able to give their families all that they otherwise couldn't have. 
One of the members is Mrs. Cynthia who has her own hair salon where she does haircuts and styling, among other services. Her customers are always happy with her service. She is dedicated to her family and it is for them that she is working so hard, so she can improve their living conditions. 
Mrs. Cynthia is asking for a loan in order to purchase shampoo, rinse, hair accessories etc. This will help her to see her business plan succeed, which will help her to continue improving her earnings.

loans.use: purchase shampoo, rinse, hair accessories etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en el 2do ciclo, son mujeres que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo, es por eso que se han unido en busca de ello.
Georgelina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, una mujer muy dedicada a trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Comenta que vende perfumes de toda clase, como colonias y fragancias corporales que vende muy bien, ya que tiene muchas clientas.
Ella pide este préstamo que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, ya que quiere comprar perfumes variados, y de esa forma poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas is in its second loan cycle.  They are women who want to help their families through their work.  Because of this, they have come together in search of of it.

Georgelina is one of the members of this group, a woman very dedicated to working to be able to help her family and her loved ones.  She says that she sells every type of perfume, such as colognes and body fragrances.  They sell very well because she has many customers.  She is asking for this loan to allow her to keep going with her sales, because she wants to buy various perfumes.  In this way she can take care of her customers’ orders and keep growing.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Las 21 integrantes forman el grupo llamado Kuña Aty Kyrey, que quiere decir en español grupo de mujeres laboriosas, ya que es eso lo que son, mujeres que luchan por salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Florencia es integrante del comité, ella es casada y vive con su familia, ella tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos se ayudan y trabajan. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que se ha abierto camino y que hoy día ya tiene una clientela formada que siempre compra de ella sus productos. Su mayor anhelo y sueño es poder agrandar su negocio y el día de mañana poder tener un supermercado.
Hoy pide este préstamo ya que necesita surtir su negocio con verduras, frutas, enlatados, productos a granel y demás, lo que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo y luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Twenty-one members make up the group known as Kuña Aty Kyrey, which in English means “group of hardworking women” because that is what they are—women who fight to get ahead and give their loved ones everything that they themselves couldn’t have.

Señora Florencia is a member of this group.  She is married and lives with her family.  She has a little grocery store where everyone works and helps out.  She says that she began with very little, but a road has opened up and today she has an established clientele who always buy her products.  Her greatest desire and dream is to be able to expand her business and in the future to be able to have a supermarket.

Today she is asking for this loan because she needs to stock her business with vegetables, fruit, canned goods, bulk goods and other products.  This will allow her to keep going with her work and fight to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, bulk goods, and other products to stock her business.

loans.name: Jaime Misrain

texts.es: Jaime es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros a si como lo muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla. Jaime desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jaime is a very responsible man with his household obligations. He has always regarded himself as providing the best for his family. He currently lives with his life partner and their children. He is very hard working; he always does it with happiness and enthusiasm. He is a farmer, every year he plants the main basic grains of the region like corn and beans. When his harvest is ready he stores it in granaries as can be seen in the picture to sell it later on.

Jaime wishes to increase his sales and that is why he visited INTEGRAL’s offices to request a loan which will permit him to buy: seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, amongst other items. He hopes to count with the requested help since he doesn’t have another source of income, and that way he will be able to continue to provide for his household without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy: seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, amongst other items.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Margarita  trabaja en una de las instituciones de la Ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de secretaria  desde hace veintiún años, la señora  sale de su casa de habitación 7:30 am, inicia sus labores 8:00 am  finalizando  a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  la señora Reyna es  madre soltera de dos  hijos.

La señora Reyna se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito  el cual implemento para gastos Médicos como es consulta y medicamentos, así lograr la pronta recuperación de su salud y continuar sus labores cotidianas al igual con el cuido de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Margarita works in one of the businesses in the Ciudad de Leon, where she works as a secretary. She has worked since she was 21 years old. She leaves home at 7:30am, begins working at 8:00am and finishes work at 5pm from Monday to Friday. Mrs. Reyna is a single mother of two children. 
She came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan, which she will use to help her pay medical expenses like doctor's visits and medicine. This will help her recuperate her health and to continue her daily work like taking care of her young children.

loans.use: medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand and cement

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La Señora Pastora,  es madre soltera de cuatro  hijos  de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo, se dedica a la venta de jugos, gaseosas y piñatas, desde hace 6 años ella ha realizado esta labor para la manutención del hogar ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos.  

Doña Pastora,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la Compra de piñatas, gaseosas, juegos al contado, lo cual le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y así poder brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pastora  is a single mother of four children who are all still under her care. She makes a living selling juices, sodas, and piñatas. She has been running her business for 6 years and it helps her to maintain her home since she is both mother and father to her children. 
Doña Pastora came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to be used to purchase piñatas, sodas and games. This will help her to increase her working capital and to be able to give a better life to her children.

loans.use: purchase piñatas, sodas and games.

loans.name: Jephtelita

texts.en:
Jephtelita is 54 years old and has three children. Jephtelita is married and has one child who is in school.

Jephtelita and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jephtelita is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,460 Philippines pesos to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jephtelita has been an NWTF borrower since two years ago. With your help, Jephtelita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vevelyn

texts.en:
Vevelyn is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vevelyn is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

She is selling used clothing as a business in the Philippines. Vevelyn requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vevelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vevelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Bernadette

texts.en:
Ma. Bernadette is 29 years old and has one child.  

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ma. Bernadette is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,555 Philippines pesos to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She plans to recover through her processed foods business.

With your help, Ma. Bernadette can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 9,550 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Myla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Adiel

texts.en:
Adiel is 30 years old. For the past five years, he has sold clothes. He has borrowed and repaid a previous loan which he used to provide an added touch of business success.

Adiel is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. He will save the profits from his loan. Adiel thinks the future is good for his business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used bags for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont majoritairement mariées dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouolofobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié,  de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Ouolofobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons), gombos, poissons et la restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une tonne d’oignon à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Ouolofobougou et en ambulant à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Djénèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Yiriwa are married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 34 years of age and three children each. And they all live in Ouolofobougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through ties of kinship, friendship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses at the Ouolofobougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments (onions), okra, and fish, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of resupplying themselves with cash, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Djénèba (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is famous for selling onions. She intends to use her loan to purchase a tonne of onions wholesale in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit, she hawks her merchandise to mostly women customers.

With this loan, Ms. Djénèba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children’s care.

loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Diguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits de beauté (pommades, mèches, …), des poissons, de la pâte d’arachides, d’habits et de la restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Madjè (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beauté de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 paquets  de mèches et 5 cartons de pommades en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au Badialan III à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Madjè espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of five women, most of them married in monogamous households. The women average 39 years of age and four children each. And they all live in Badialan III, a district in Bamako. They know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving beauty products (ointments, hair extensions, …), fish, peanut butter, and clothing, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of resupplying themselves with cash, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Madjè (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling the best quality beauty products. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 packets of hair extensions and 5 boxes of ointments wholesale at the big market. Her sales are made retail to mostly women customers in Badialan III.

With this loan, Ms. Madjè hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la comunidad de Achacahi en una casa de adobe que tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado, Fernando se dedica a la elaboracion de salteñas y empanadas, el horno que usa lo comparte con su padre. Fernando necesita credito para comprar quintales de azucar y harina, la demanda de las salteñas es grande en Bolivia (de hecho son una de las mejores especialidades culinarias del país, si alguna vez visitan Bolivia, se recomienda que prueben las salteñas) por lo que Fernando quiere expandir su negocio y sus padres no pueden brindar la ayuda que Fernando requiere y por eso recurre a ustedes
texts.en: Fernando is single and has no children.  He lives in Achacahi in a house that has running water, a sewer connection and electricity.  Fernando has a bakery business.  He makes and sells saltenas and empanadas.  He and his father share an oven.  Fernando is applying for a loan that he will use to buy bulk supplies of sugar and flour.  The market for saltenas is strong in Bolivia--saltenas are a specialty of the country, something that you should try the next time you go there--and Fernando wants to grow his business.  His parents can't fund his plans and he's appealing to you for the help he needs.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for his bakery business.

loans.name: Geoma

texts.es: Geoma es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe, ella esta en calidad de cuidadora del lugar pero su fuente de ingresos principal es la artesania  y necesita credito para comprar lana para incrementar su produccion  Geoma no tiene a nadie que pueda ayudarle y por eso espera que le faciliten el préstamo
texts.en:
Geoma is single, but she has one child. She lives in El Alto, in an adobe house. She lives there while serving as the housekeeper, but her main source of income is her craft business.

She needs this loan to increase her production. Geoma has nobody that can help her; this is why she hopes to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy wool for her craft business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continua dedicándose al comercio de artesanía, principalmente de joyería en plata, Adelaida vende su mercadería en los principales mercados artesanales de la ciudad , mayormente para el mercado turístico de la ciudad. Adelaida esta solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su comercio y comprar mercadería como aretes, collares, pulseras, anillos y accesorios de plata. 

Adelaida Está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su actividad, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the ‘Los Diamantes’ [The Diamonds] communal bank based in the city of Cusco, Peru. This member continues to sell handicrafts for a living, mainly silver jewelry. Adelaida sells her merchandise at major craft markets in the city, in particular the main tourist market. Adelaida is applying for this loan to capitalize on her trade and buy merchandise such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, and silver accessories.

Adelaida is very grateful to Kiva for the support and assistance she has received to keep her business going. Her work is the main source of income and livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry.

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
Cinforosa se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de expendio ubicado en un mercado de la ciudad, Cinforosa realiza esta actividad hace muchos años y esta le representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Cinforosa solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como verduras, arroz, fideos, menestras, carnes etc.

Cinforosa se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado y por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cinforosa has a food sales business in one of the city's markets.  She started the business several years ago and her earnings from the business are the main source of income for her and her family.  Cinforosa is applying for a loan that she will use to buy meat, vegetables, pasta, rice and other supplies for her food business.

Cinforosa is grateful for your help and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has operated her business for five years and earns additional income from farming rice. Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid a previous loan.

Riza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and other items for her general store. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, sugar, eggs and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en:
Nikki Rose is 34 years old and has two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Nikki Rose's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nikki Rose is requesting a 9,765 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, Nikki Rose would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es casado y tiene dos hijos Julio vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene luz, agua, alcantarillado y gas a domicilio (Julio es uno de los pocos con todas esas comodidades)Julio se dedica al transporte publico, entres las condiciones duras de trabajo está el incremento del parque automotor en la ciudad donde trabaja y el hecho de que pueda ser asaltado por trabajar hasta tarde

Julio necesita credito para reparar el motor de su vehiculo y mejorar accesorios para brindar un mejor servicio, aunque la esposa tiene un puesto de venta de comida, lo que ganan no alcanza por eso Julio necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julio is married with three children.  He owns a well-built house in El Alto that has electricity, gas, running water and sewer service.  (Julio is one of only a few here that has these services.)  Julio has a taxi business and says that he faces many challenges, including the high rate of crime in his city.  

Julio is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to pay for engine repairs and the rest for accessories that will allow him to provide a better service.  Although his wife works, their joint income doesn't stretch far enough for him to pay for the repairs and improvements without your help.

loans.use: to pay for taxi repairs and improvements.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkan sont majoritairement mariées  dans des ménages polygamiques ; Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouolofobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Ouolofobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, tubercules (la pomme de terre), et des légumes. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Badjè (femme  debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules (igname et de la pomme de terre) dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 350 kg 
d’igname à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Badjè espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 
85.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benkan are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 34 years of age and two children each. And they all live in Ouolofobougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Ouolofobougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving tubers (potatoes) and vegetables. 

With the goal of increasing their business inventory, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Badjè (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is famous for selling tubers (yams and potatoes) in her district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 350 kg of yams in Bamako. She makes her sales retail to mostly women customers.

With this loan, Ms. Badjè hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children’s care.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth se dedica  la venta de artesanía, ella hace carteras y sus productos lo exporta a Brasil. Ya tiene 8 años en este negocio de artesanía  y le va muy bien, ella también vende artesanía como por ejemplo chompas,chalinas y polos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana e hilos para que haga las artesanías.
texts.en: Elizabeth has a crafts business.  She makes and sells purses, some of which are exported to Brazil.  She started the business 8 years ago and says that it is doing very well.  She also sells other hand-made merchandise: shirts, sweaters, etc.  Her goal, she says, is to expand her business.  Elizabeth is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the materials she needs--thread and cloth, for example--to carry on her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à N’tomikorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de N’tomikorobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, tubercules (la pomme de terre), légumes, condiments et poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariétou (femme  assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules (la pomme de terre) dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de pomme de terre à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à N’tomikorobougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariétou espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 
90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Tièssiri are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 36 years of age and three children each. And they all live in N’tomikorobougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the N’tomikorobougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving tubers, vegetables, condiments, and fish. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Mariétou (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling tubers (potatoes) in her district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 sacks of potatoes in Bamako. She makes her sales retail to a mostly women customers in N’tomikorobougou.

With this loan, Ms. Mariétou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children’s care.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, actividad que viene realizando hace muchos años y que  representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, bebidas y otros.
texts.en: Carmen sells basic staples in her grocery store. She has been in business for several years and this is the main source of income for her family. Carmen is requesting a loan to buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, beverages, etc. to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Santos Aurelia

texts.es: Doña Santos, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene  4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Hace mas de 15 años que estableció su propio negocio de  venta de comidas, vende pollo frito, tajadas, baleadas, tacos, sopas, agua y refrescos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa.  Ha solicitado el quinto ciclo de préstamo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carnes, arroz, vegetales, harina, manteca, condimentos etc. Para elaborar la comida y vender. Ella considera que esta inversión le va ayudar a crecer y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es ayudar a su familia, a sus hijos con el estudio y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is a 53-year-old single mother with four children. She lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. More than 15 years ago, she started her own business of selling food such as fried chicken, fried plantains, “baleadas” (tortillas stuffed with beans and served with other condiments), tacos, soups, as well as water and soft drinks. She operates her business from her house.

Santos is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. She will invest in the purchase of supplies such as meat, rice, vegetables, flour, lard, condiments, and other items for preparing the dishes that she sells. Santos considers this investment to be helpful in growing and increasing her sales.

Her goals include helping her family, providing for her children’s education, and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, flour, lard, condiments, and other items for preparing the dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Candida Haydee

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora y amable, madre soltera de un adolescente de 11 años de edad, que estudia su segundo ciclo de primaria  (tercero y cuarto grado); tiene 28 años de edad, con 5 años de experiencia de ser docente en una comunidad de Rosita, pagando diariamente C$ 40 de pasaje y recorriendo una hora para llegar a su centro de trabajo. Desde hace 3 años vive en una casita de madera y tambo, en la cual habitan 7 personas, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de tener su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera, que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales para construir su vivienda: 400 bloques, cemento, clavos, hierro, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Con el financiamiento anterior otorgado por PANA PANA, le permitieron mejorar el perímetro del muro de la vivienda de su mamá. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su hijo y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado. También anhela con tener su propio medio de transporte, como una motocicleta.
texts.en:
This borrower is a determined and friendly woman. She is a single mother with an 11-year-old child who is in the second cycle of primary school (which includes the third and fourth grades). The borrower is 28 years old and has five years of experience as a teacher in the community of Rosita. She pays 40 NIO each day for travel expenses since it takes her an hour to get to her job. For the past three years, she has lived in a small wooden cottage with seven other members of her family, which makes for overcrowded conditions. Her goal is to have a wooden house with a concrete foundation so that her family can live securely and decently.

The borrower is requesting her second loan in order to buy construction materials for her home including 400 blocks, cement, nails, iron, and zinc sheets. She will also cover the cost of labor. With her previous loan from Pana Pana, the borrower was able to repair the security wall around her mother’s house. Her dream is to have a secure home with basic conditions so that her child and the rest of her family can be comfortable. She would also like for her house to have a toilet and a septic tank since her family currently uses a latrine on a regular basis. The borrower also hopes to have her own mode of transportation, such as a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build her house.
